Title: Performance Analyst
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we‚Äôre building the delivery of (almost) everything and you‚Äôll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn‚Äôt always easy, but it‚Äôs definitely exciting. Here you‚Äôll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You‚Äôll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you‚Äôre a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

Join our dynamic Operations Analytics Team! As a cornerstone of our organization, this team serves as a one-stop shop for all data analytics needs related to operations and venues. We pride ourselves on our ability to analyze, automate, and guide other teams, functioning as a consultancy/support mechanism. Our work involves close interactions with upper management, contributing significantly to critical strategic discussions. To excel in this role, you must possess a blend of analytical prowess and exceptional communication skills.

What You'll Be Doing


Conducting in-depth analyses using Looker and Excel to support various operational and venue-related teams.
Automating processes to enhance efficiency across departments.
Providing consultancy and support to operational and venue teams to steer their activities based on data-driven insights.
Engaging in regular exchanges with your manager and contributing to strategic decision-making processes.
Preparing reports, occasionally presenting findings through PowerPoint presentations.


Our humble expectations

Must-Haves:


Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Fluent English skills, both written and verbalStrong analytical skills coupled with the ability to communicate findings effectively.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team.
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills.
A proactive attitude towards problem-solving and continuous improvement.


Nice-to-Have:


Proficiency in SQL and Python


Why Join Us?

Join us and contribute to driving the success of our operations through insightful analytics and strategic support. If you have the right mix of analytical expertise and communication skills, we would love to hear from you!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That‚Äôs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: Sales Data Analyst (Part-Time)
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world‚Äôs leading sexual wellbeing company, with the mission to elevate pleasure through innovative technologies, a data-driven approach, and foster creative and fresh perspectives on intimacy. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a streamlined online shopping experience.

At Lovehoney, we employ over 800 passionate and progressive individuals across 9 global offices, each person contributing a unique blend of talents to our diverse workforce. We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers‚Äô lives.

Join us at Lovehoney, where pleasure combines with creativity, data, and innovation!

We are currently looking for a part-time Data Analyst to join our team. This role is ideal for someone highly analytical and detail-oriented, who enjoys working with data sets, developing insights, and driving data-informed decisions. You‚Äôll provide actionable insights through meticulous data analysis, supporting strategic decision-making across teams.

What You Will Do


Collect, compile, and clean large and varied data sets, ensuring their accuracy and reliability.
Develop, maintain, and optimize comprehensive reporting dashboards using analytical tools like Superset and Netsuite.
Conduct in-depth data analyses to identify meaningful trends, patterns, and insights.
Collaborate with various internal teams to ensure accurate and insightful reporting that informs strategic decision-making.
Continuously enhance data quality, reporting processes, and analytic methodologies.



What You Should Bring


Experience in data analysis or related data-centric roles. A great benefit if related with sales.
Proficiency in data management, analysis, and visualization; familiarity with Superset and Netsuite is a strong plus.
Strong analytical capabilities, with demonstrated experience in interpreting complex data.
Attention to detail with the ability to ensure high accuracy and clarity in reporting.
Excellent communication skills, capable of translating data insights clearly to different stakeholders.



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, friendly faces and fun team-building events
Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers, in addition to a 50% discount on all Lovehoney products to explore and discover new ways to have fun
Enjoy a hybrid work model that fosters flexibility and work-life balance, with three days per week in-office and the opportunity to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year, alongside 25 days‚Äô holiday, plus an additional day for each year you are with Lovehoney, providing ample time for relaxation, rejuvenation, and exploration
Access to customized training opportunities to support your unique learning journey, complemented by biannual feedback cycles, offering valuable insights into your performance and growth areas, enhancing your development within the company.
Recognising the significance of physical and mental health, we proudly provide gym benefits in addition to a mental wellbeing platform, to ensure our employees thrive both professionally and personally.



Our interview process


CV review
Interview with one of Talent Acquisition Team Members
Hiring Manager Interview
Task
Hiring Team Interview



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we embrace innovative technologies to enhance our recruitment process. As part of your application, you'll experience practical, AI-driven tasks designed to reflect real scenarios you'll encounter in the role, helping us understand your strengths and approach. Additionally, we leverage artificial intelligence during screening interviews for CV reviews and note-taking. We prioritize transparency and respect your preferences, so you'll have the option to opt out of recording and AI-driven note-taking while still receiving full and fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Private equity has always been a sought-after asset class due to its performance potential.

However, steep entry barriers, including high minimum investments (~‚Ç¨10m), hefty paperwork and the challenge of selecting the right fund have traditionally kept individual investors at bay, with access largely limited to big institutions or a select few.

Enter Moonfare.

We've made investing in private equity more accessible and straightforward with our fully digital investment platform. Now, qualified investors can access some of the most sought-after private market funds at lower minimum investment amounts*.

The diverse Moonfare team ‚Äì which includes alumni from top private banks, groundbreaking startups and beyond ‚Äì is united in pushing boundaries and redefining the private equity landscape.

Join us!

Data Analyst (m/f/d)

At Moonfare, we are on a mission to democratise access to top-tier private market investments. As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in driving data informed decision making across the organisation. You'll be part of a small, high impact team that sits at the intersection of data engineering, product, marketing, and commercial, enabling the business through actionable insights, scalable reporting, and high quality data models.

You will shape how we understand performance, measure success, and identify new opportunities across the company. Your work will help ensure that decisions at Moonfare are always backed by clear, well structured, and meaningful data.

You will:


Develop and maintain advanced SQL-based data models to power business reporting and analysis
Build scalable dashboards and self service tools using Tableau, enabling teams across Moonfare to access key metrics and insights
Perform exploratory and strategic analysis to support product launches, marketing campaigns, and commercial initiatives
Partner closely with product managers, marketing, and business stakeholders to understand goals and define relevant KPIs
Lead experimentation efforts including A/B test design, implementation, and interpretation
Advocate for data quality and consistency, ensuring models and reporting are accurate, well documented, and easily understood
Collaborate with the wider data and analytics team to improve data infrastructure and analytics tooling
Drive initiatives that increase data literacy and empower teams to use data more effectively


The next Moonfarian:


Has 5‚Äì7 years of experience as a Data, Product, or Marketing Analyst
Has a proven track record of transforming data infrastructure and metrics to support business growth
Possesses advanced SQL skills (BigQuery, PostgreSQL), along with strong Spreadsheet and Tableau proficiency; experience with dbt and Snowflake is a plus
Has hands-on experience working with commercial, product, or marketing datasets
Is comfortable designing and interpreting A/B tests and leading experimentation efforts
Collaborates effectively across both technical and non-technical teams
Communicates clearly, takes ownership, and is passionate about driving business impact through data


If you feel you do not meet all of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply!

Our Values:


Our clients come first, Moonfare comes second, and we prioritise ourselves third - Client-Centric Focus. Putting clients first means creating value for them is essential. Placing Moonfare second signifies that our individual professional future at Moonfare depends on the company's commercial success. Prioritising ourselves third reflects our humility in putting clients and Moonfare before personal interests.
We pursue excellence and honor our promises - Commitment to Excellence. We hold ourselves to the highest standards, taking responsibility for our failures, and celebrating our successes. We commit to deadlines and stick to them and we learn from our mistakes.
We are here to win and to celebrate our collective achievements - Win together. We are mission-focused and think and act like owners. We exemplify the attitude we expect and each of us commits to do what it takes to succeed.
We foster personal growth but each of us earns our place as a Moonfarian through merit - Growth and Merit. We hire, retain, and develop exceptional people and invest in empowering them to excel. We must all earn our place at the table every day.


We understand the important role that diversity plays in our success. Different backgrounds, experiences and ideas push us further and raise the bar. We're committed to developing an inclusive and safe culture where everyone ‚Äî regardless of colour, race, religion, sex, origin, sexuality, disability, marital status, citizenship or gender identity ‚Äî knows that they are an integral part of the team and can bring their full potential to their work.


Minimum investments vary according to jurisdiction.


Apply now!
Show more

Placing Moonfare second signifies that our individual professional future at Moonfare depends on the company's commercial success. Prioritising ourselves third reflects our humility in putting clients and Moonfare before personal interests.
  • We pursue excellence and honor our promises - Commitment to Excellence. We hold ourselves to the highest standards, taking responsibility for our failures, and celebrating our successes. We commit to deadlines and stick to them and we learn from our mistakes.
  • We are here to win and to celebrate our collective achievements - Win together. We are mission-focused and think and act like owners. We exemplify the attitude we expect and each of us commits to do what it takes to succeed.
  • We foster personal growth but each of us earns our place as a Moonfarian through merit - Growth and Merit. We hire, retain, and develop exceptional people and invest in empowering them to excel. We must all earn our place at the table every day.

We understand the important role that diversity plays in our success. Different backgrounds, experiences and ideas push us further and raise the bar. We're committed to developing an inclusive and safe culture where everyone ‚Äî regardless of colour, race, religion, sex, origin, sexuality, disability, marital status, citizenship or gender identity ‚Äî knows that they are an integral part of the team and can bring their full potential to their work.

  • Minimum investments vary according to jurisdiction.

Apply now!

Title: Data Analyst (Finance working student)
Description:
üë©‚Äçüíªüë®‚Äçüíª About the role

We're looking for an enthusiastic working student to join our fantastic Finance team in the role of Data Analyst. You'll be an integral part of the finance department, primarily supporting the Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) team. Your role will involve close collaboration with commercial and business leaders, providing crucial data-driven insights to inform strategic decision-making.




Your responsibilities will include:

Reporting: Preparing regular and ad hoc reports using internal data base to support business decisions.
Data Analysis and Automation: Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting financial and operational data to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Process improvements: support the improvement of processes and operations in Finance through data-driven approaches
Business Partnering: Working closely with business leaders to understand their financial needs and provide relevant data and insights to support their decision-making.
Special Projects: Participating in and supporting various finance-related projects and initiatives.




Overall, your work will play a key role in enabling data-driven decision-making across the company, contributing to the achievement of strategic objectives and financial goals.




üöß What you‚Äôll do

Assist in daily routines process and decision-making by collecting, processing and analyzing data.
Support automation and optimization in the financial department.
Prepare reports and presentations to support management decisions
Maintain accurate financial records and perform data entry tasks




üèÖWhat you need to succeed

Please note: Do not be put off from applying because you believe you cannot tick every box. If you think you can help, and you really want to join our growing and exciting business please get in touch, we would love to hear from you.

You are currently enrolled as a student in business administration, finance, economics, mathematics or a related field
You have very good skills in Excel and/or Google Sheets
Experience with SQL or data analytics & visualization tools, e.g. Metabase
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Ability to explain complex topics in a simple way
Proactive mindset and willingness to learn and contribute to real-world projects




üéÅ What's in it for you?

‚Ç¨ 1000 per year for you to contribute to your learning & development to help you grow professionally and personally.
‚Ç¨300 per year for you to endorse team build, including dinners, games, and events.
28 vacation days per year (increasing 1 day every year up to 30).
We welcome you to our office in the center of Berlin 3+ days a week.
Take advantage of our Workation policy, allowing for up to 6 weeks every year of work outside of Germany (some restrictions apply).
Subsidised gym membership to boost your physical and mental well-being.
Tax relief for payments into our Business Bike scheme.
You can accelerate your career and take ownership of your work and development in a flat hierarchy where 360 feedback is encouraged.




ü¶∏ Are you a Monduneer in disguise?

Working in a truly diverse group makes us stronger and more resilient. Furthermore, it enables an unfair advantage - the opportunity to learn from each other, see different perspectives, and consider a broader range of variables in our decision-making. That is what being a Monduneer is all about.




Thus, regardless of your background, age, disability, gender, parental status, race, religion, sexual orientation, educational background, or any other aspect you feel is a statement of your diversity, we look forward to discussing your role in mind.




If you believe you are a Monduneer in disguise, and it's time for you to shine, submit your application, and we'll take it from there.




üíú Meet Mondu

Mondu is changing the B2B payments ecosystem by providing payment solutions that enable any B2B company to grow quickly and safely. We envision a future where businesses, not just consumers, experience a seamless, modern, and human-centered payment flow. Founded by a dream team of passionate entrepreneurs and seasoned tech leaders, Mondu is rapidly scaling. In just two years, we've secured over $120 million in funding, attained an e-money banking license through the Dutch National Bank, and assembled a talented team of over 100 Monduneers across our three locations of Berlin, Amsterdam and London. On the road, we have successfully launched numerous products accessible to buyers in seven markets (and counting!) - catering to thousands of clients.




Our products bring B2B payments up to par with B2C payments: putting the people behind the business at the heart of the payment flow, and ensuring they have a seamless, modern and state-of-the-art experience, whether they are sellers or buyers.




We‚Äôre building a culture at Mondu where amazing people do their best work. If you‚Äôre ready to grow your career and help thousands of organizations pay better, you‚Äôre in the right place.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Lloyds Bank GmbH and its brands Bank of Scotland and Lloyds Bank have won over 1 million satisfied customers in recent years. And this thanks to convincing products and, above all, our committed colleagues who want to achieve the best for our customers every day with new ideas, challenges and joy. In order to continue writing our success story, we are looking for the right reinforcement for our teams, because all our ambitious goals would be unattainable without teamwork. We also welcome career changers.

For our office in Berlin Mitte we are looking for a

Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)

Aufgaben


Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to identify trends and insights
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to support decision-making
Perform data analysis to inform risk strategies
Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation
Design and implement automated workflows to enhance operational efficiency
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate automation solutions
Develop and maintain automated control systems to ensure compliance and quality
Monitor and optimize control processes to reduce errors and improve performance
Conduct regular audits and assessments to ensure the effectiveness of control systems


Profil


Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Several years of experience in risk/compliance/audit team of a financial services organisation or in an audit or advisory company
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL)
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Knowledge of process automation tools
Familiarity with control systems and automation technologies
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
Ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable insights
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Strong organizational and time management skills
Fluency in written and spoken English (German or Dutch is a plus)


Wir bieten


An international team with colleagues from more than 50 different countries
Social benefits such as a company pension scheme and capital formation contributions
30 days holiday as well as 24 and 31 December as non-working days
Employee Assistance Programme ‚Äì personal 24/7 helpline for all employees
Various possibilities for flexible working, i.a. various part-time models, flexitime
Extensive, very flexible home office arrangements
Possibility to work from other EU countries for up to 30 days per year
Additional benefits such as sports activities, free fruit, nuts and drinks
Employer contributions to BVG job ticket and a Lease a bike programme
An informal corporate culture - without dress code and ‚ÄòSie'.
An excellent learning culture and opportunity to improve your professional competencies
Easily accessible city centre offices, in the vicinity of many shops and restaurants to which you receive a discount


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

And this thanks to convincing products and, above all, our committed colleagues who want to achieve the best for our customers every day with new ideas, challenges and joy. In order to continue writing our success story, we are looking for the right reinforcement for our teams, because all our ambitious goals would be unattainable without teamwork. We also welcome career changers.

For our office in Berlin Mitte we are looking for a

Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)

Aufgaben

  • Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to identify trends and insights
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to support decision-making
  • Perform data analysis to inform risk strategies
  • Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation
  • Design and implement automated workflows to enhance operational efficiency
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate automation solutions
  • Develop and maintain automated control systems to ensure compliance and quality
  • Monitor and optimize control processes to reduce errors and improve performance
  • Conduct regular audits and assessments to ensure the effectiveness of control systems

Profil

  • Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
  • Several years of experience in risk/compliance/audit team of a financial services organisation or in an audit or advisory company
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL)
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
  • Knowledge of process automation tools

  • Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail

Title: Data Analyst, Client Onboarding
Description:
Work Location: Berlin or Amsterdam

Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background? Are you passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Analyst we're looking for!

Your primary responsibilities will be:


Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges
Set up long-term dashboarding and tracking to monitor key metrics
Conduct A/B tests to evaluate and optimize business decisions
Perform deep-dives into socio-economic factors and distribution channels to uncover actionable insights


What we're looking for:


Solid analytical skills (you're a natural problem solver)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
Solid statistical & technical foundation (e.g., A/B Testing, hypothesis testing) with a self-driven and proactive attitude
Strong verbal and written communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)
Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
Knowledge of financial markets & financial products (options, futures, etc.)


What we offer:


Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience
Free lunch from our cook, fresh juices & fruit
Continuous growth potential and a training budget of ‚Ç¨2,000 per year
Trips & activities with your colleagues
Relaxed and informal working environment
Discount for membership of the Urban Sports Club
Additional contribution to the company pension scheme
In-house German and English courses with a native speaker and cover half of the costs


About us:

LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The best choice for anyone who takes investing seriously:

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - (Payment)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

About the opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst (Payment) to join the Fintech team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

Be part of building the financial backbone of Delivery Hero. You‚Äôll develop products that empower millions of customers and merchants, from seamless payments to innovative financial solutions like wallets and credit. Your work will support our path to profitability by creating financial flexibility for users and enabling smooth transactions across 70+ countries.

In this role you will:


Partner closely with Fintech Business and Product stakeholders to understand their analytical needs, and execute the roadmap for analytics work for Payment Analytics
Develop and optimize monitoring tools, perform deep-dive analysis and provide insights to facilitate a data-driven decision making
Exploit and analyze high volumes of data in order to quantify and answer questions to improve the business performance. Monitor KPIs, identify user behavior patterns and actively take actions to improve online payment performance across multiple regions
Demonstrate proficiency in coding practices and analytic approaches
Be able to answer the 'What?' question effectively and within reasonable deadlines, but also think about the 'So What?' and 'Now What' portions of the analysis
Proactively bring new ideas and suggestions to the team and our internal clients to improve our Fintech set up


What you need to be successful


You have worked as a data analyst and delivered measurable impact on improving understanding of payments
You have proven experience with daily practice of SQL, and visualization tools such as Tableau, and Looker
You have experience working with online payments and deep knowledge of the PSP, issuer, acquirer, and card scheme data.
You are eager on making business impact through analytics and you understand the product lifecycle
You have strong analytical and problem solving skills
You demonstrate excellent communication and presentation skills


Nice To Have:


Experience with BigQuery and Airflow
Experience with Python
Understanding of real-time data analytics
Good understanding of mathematical and statistical data analysis techniques such as regression, extrapolation, time series analysis, forecasting, statistical hypothesis testing and econometric models




Who We Are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What‚Äôs in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

Additional Information

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Analyst - Product (d/f/m)
Description:
Our Story

Every year millions of people are either filing their taxes in fear or giving up on their tax refund altogether. We're working on fixing that. Our intuitive app enables anyone, regardless of education or background, to file their taxes with newfound confidence.

Spread across Germany, Spain and the UK, the team at Taxfix Group with its brands Taxfix, Steuerbot and TaxScouts, is a compassionate group of solution-finders. We speak our minds openly, and with over 400 professionals, including tax experts, developers, and IT security experts, we're rich in ideas and voices. The group has facilitated more than 3.5 billion euros in tax refunds for its customers since its founding in 2016

Your Challenge

As a Data Analyst in our Product Analytics team, you will play a key role in shaping data-informed decision-making across multiple mission teams.

Partnering with Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and other cross-functional stakeholders, you will use data to uncover insights about user behavior across both our customer-facing products and internal tools.

Your work will involve designing and building reports, analyzing feature performance, generating actionable insights that drive product improvements, and contributing to a robust data foundation by helping define and structure the right tracking and data capture.

Your Responsibilities


Analyze user behavior and product usage to uncover trends, pain points, and opportunities.
Define and track key product metrics to measure feature performance and business impact.
Translate complex data into clear, compelling narratives and share insights with a range of stakeholders.
Build dashboards to enable self-serve analytics across the organization, and also up-skill your stakeholders.
Collaborate with the Analytics Engineering to improve our data sources and self-serve solution.


Your Profile


2+ years of experience in a data analytics role, ideally within a product or tech environment
Ability to translate complex data into clear insights and actionable recommendations.
Good communication skills and ability to work with stakeholders across all levels.
Excellent SQL skills.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Mixpanel, Tableau).
Keen interest in AI‚Äôs potential, paired with hands-on experimentation and solid conceptual understanding of generative-AI tools.


Nice To Have


Experience with A/B testing and Python are plus.
Data modelling and dbt knowledge are a plus.


Why Taxfix?


A chance to do meaningful, people-centric work with an international team of passionate professionals.
Holistic well-being with free mental health coaching sessions and yoga.
A monthly allowance to spend on an extensive range of services that you can use and roll over as flexibly as you like.
Employee stock options for all employees‚Äîbecause everyone deserves to benefit from the success they help to create.
30 annual vacation days and flexible working hours.
A generous learning budget to support your personal and professional development and guidance from our internal L&D experts.
Work from abroad for up to six weeks every year. Just align with your team, and then enjoy your trip.
Plenty of opportunities to socialise as a team. In addition to internal tech meetups, our international team hosts regular get-togethers‚Äîvirtually and in person when possible.
Free tax declaration filing, of course, through the Taxfix app‚Äîand internal support for all personal tax-related questions.
Have a four-legged friend in your life? We‚Äôre happy to have dogs join us in the office.


Excited? So are we. Learn more about Team Taxfix on our blog and get a glimpse of our culture.

At Taxfix, we believe that incredible things happen when you have a wealth of perspectives and experiences. We're proudly committed to equal employment and development opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability, or place of origin. To help mitigate any potential unconscious biases, we ask that you refrain from including your picture, age, or marital status on your CV. Let your experiences speak for themselves.

Not sure if you meet all the requirements for this role? Please apply anyway. You might bring something special to the team that we hadn't considered previously.
Show more

  • In-house German and English courses with a native speaker and cover half of the costs

About us:

LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The best choice for anyone who takes investing seriously:

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

Title: Staff Product Analyst, Adtech
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst to join the Adtech tribe on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

We work on developing digital advertising solutions for our vendors. Currently, these solutions are available on our food ordering platform, both on mobile and the web. The Ad Tech solutions support the vendors in all three steps of the marketing funnel: awareness, consideration, and conversion enabling them to achieve sustainable growth on our platform.

A Product Analyst in the Ad Tech organization plays a pivotal role in enabling data-driven decision-making. You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define and implement tracking requirements, set up A/B tests, analyze large datasets to provide actionable insights on the performance of different revenue streams, and communicate the results to relevant stakeholders.

You will be a critical member in defining the product strategy and the continued success of our brands.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!


Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions
Develop in-depth analytical understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Leverage insights from data by providing analyses, reports and dashboards for product management and other departments
Use quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business, providing insights to help product managers, designers, and engineers to decide which features to build and why
Work with structured and semi-structured data from different data sources and different products


Qualifications


Overall 6+ years of experience, preferably in e-commerce
You've completed a degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science or an equivalent education or possess relevant practical experience
Very good communication skills in English, both written and oral
Data Analysis: Strong experience in SQL (BigQuery) and Python (alternatively R)
A/B Testing: Experience designing experiments and analyzing results with a solid background in statistics
Data Visualization Technologies: Preferably Tableau or similar alternatives e.g. Looker, QlikView, etc.


Nice to have:


Tracking Technologies: Google Analytics or similar alternatives e.g. Adobe Analytics/Omniture, SnowPlow, etc.
Industry expertise in advertising and/or marketing.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst Internship (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
Description:
What To Expect
Start date: ASAP

Duration: 6 months

Location: Gigafactory Brandenburg

Time type: Full time

Tesla is accelerating the world's transition to sustainable energy. This is only possible through extraordinary speed, innovation and efficiency. Gigafactory Berlin forms the perfect basis for rolling out Tesla's incredible success story in Europe. The most important pillar for this are our employees. Their passion, motivation and engagement ensure that we achieve our goals. We are looking for you to continue and expand this success story together.

What You'll Do


Identifying trends and generate insights by conducting analyses of Tesla¬¥s data systems
Convey crucial findings with internal stakeholders to encourage data-driven storytelling and decision-making
Identify critical metrics and develop high-level dashboards to monitor the advancement of the company's KPIs and its top objectives
Constantly pursue methods to increase operational effectiveness
Engage in internal stakeholder meetings and present status updates on a weekly basis
Create reports and keep track of project performance using spreadsheets and data metrics
Support the Program Manager to collect data from cross functional teams



What You'll Bring


Studying towards a degree in Data Science, Supply Chain Management, Purchasing or Economics
Experience with data analytics and visualization programs like Tableau, PowerBI, etc.
Excellent analytical skills including advanced Excel (ie. macros, VBA), SQL and Python preferred
Preferable previous experience in Supply chain processes and procurement
CSS and Java Script front end styling preferred



, Tesla

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x) Customer Success
Description:
Job Description

We at sevDesk:As an intuitive cloud accounting software, we empower founders, self-employed individuals, and small business owners to focus on what truly matters. Our product offers them a smart accounting tool to save time in their daily activities. As a company, we aim for excellence, continuously expand our horizons, and strive for daily improvement of our product and our daily work life. In pursuit of these goals, we rely on our strong culture, innovative spirit, and unwavering passion. In the future, we hope to count you among our dedicated team members.

Your mission:

You are an analytical consultant for the data- and insights-driven development of our Customer Success Team. With your analysis, you identify optimization potential in the organization and influence our Customer Service and Support roadmap with your recommendations for action.

Here's how you'll make an impact:


You analyze user behavior data and use it to support our Customer Success Teams in optimizing customer retention and identifying the most critical customer problems.
You collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to analyze customer-journey touchpoints to continuously improve how our customers interact with our software.
You scrutinize our Service & Support activities, detect shifts in KPI performance, and, in partnership with your stakeholders, translate the findings into data-driven hypotheses and actionable recommendations.
You prepare your findings visually so that it is easy for your stakeholders to incorporate them into their decisions.
You design optimizations in data collection and continuously develop the reporting ecosystem.
You support your colleagues in using product data and help keep our quality standards high with peer reviews
Reporting and analyzing churn prevention activities, onboarding flows, and the impact of customer communications to help the teams boost engagement and retention.


Your Qualification:


You have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst (m/f/x), preferably in a digital and/or SaaS environment.
You speak German (at least B2) and English (C1)
You have a degree in (business) informatics, economics, (business) mathematics or comparable.
You have experience using data to drive impact, including working with tools such as SQL, Tableau, Looker, Snowflake, Redshift, or comparable platforms.
You have relevant experience in the conception and evaluation of A/B tests, good knowledge of statistics is a plus.
You are proactive, results-oriented, and flexible in problem-solving both in your role and for the company.
Your profile is rounded off by strong communication, presentation, and organizational skills.
Despite your passion for data, you recognize that emotions are not always quantifiable, so you actively seek direct dialogue with our users to capture qualitative insights.


__

Our Techstack:

SQL | Snowflake | Snowplow | dbt | Python | Looker | Metabase | Mixpanel

Job Requirements

Your sevdesk Experience

Drive Impact: Make meaningful contributions and help move initiatives forward across teams. Your input will be valued, and your work will have a direct influence on sevdesk's success.

Empowered Ownership: take charge of your work and projects with the expectation of making decisions independently, supported by a team that's there when you need guidance.

Competitive Compensation: Includes a stock option plan and company pension to reward your contributions.

Time to Recharge: 30 vacation days, 3 additional days for social engagement, plus 30 Workation days to work from anywhere in the EU.

Flexible Work Environment: We believe in working where you‚Äôre most productive, whether that‚Äôs at home or in the office. Our hybrid approach balances flexibility with in-person collaboration, fostering trust and strong teamwork when we come together.

Comprehensive Benefits: learning budget, bike leasing, monthly voucher of choice (Amazon, IKEA, Car Sharing, ‚Ä¶), Amazon book flat, corporate discounts and more.

Team Vibes: Enjoy regular team offsites and quarterly events packed with networking and fun!

For more insights, visit us on Instagram



Contact:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ Marc Riehle

Weder bei der Einstellung noch w√§hrend des Besch√§ftigungsverh√§ltnisses werden Entscheidungen auf Basis von Hautfarbe, Religion oder religi√∂sen Glaubens, ethnischer oder nationaler Herkunft, Nationalit√§t, Geschlechteridentit√§t, sexuelle Orientierung, Behinderung oder Alter getroffen. Enpal steht f√ºr einen sicheren Arbeitsplatz und geht gegen Diskriminierung und Bel√§stigung jeglicher Art vor.

Title: Junior BI Generalist
Description:
Department: Data Science & Intelligence

Location: Berlin, DE




Tripledot is one of the largest independent mobile games companies in the world.

We are a multi-award-winning organisation, with a global 2,500+ strong team across 12 studios.

Our expanded portfolio includes some of the biggest titles in mobile gaming, collectively reaching top chart positions around the world and engaging over 25 million daily active users.




Tripledot‚Äôs guiding principle is that when people love what they do, what they do will be loved by others.




We‚Äôre building a company we‚Äôre proud of ‚Äì one filled with driven, incredibly smart and detail-orientated people, who LOVE making games.




Our ambition is to be the most successful games company in the world, and we‚Äôre just getting started.




Lion Studios




Lion Studios is a mobile games publisher that works with mobile developers to get their games discovered by players around the world. Headquartered in San Francisco, Lion Studios‚Äô creative and strategy teams utilize their expertise to help game developers break through the noise and grow their businesses.




Since launching in 2018, Lion Studios has driven 90% of its games to the Top 10 in the App Store and Google Play and helped drive 16 games to #1 in the US App Store‚Äôs Top Free chart.




Role Overview




As a Junior BI Generalist, you will play a crucial role in supporting our product managers and other stakeholders by providing insights into player behavior and game performance. You will work closely with our data engineering team to ensure that stakeholders have the data they need to make informed decisions.




This is an entry-level position ideal for someone with strong analytical skills, a passion for gaming, and a desire to grow in the field of business intelligence. You will be using Looker as your main BI tool connected to Snowflake, our data warehouse.




Work with stakeholders to understand their business questions and create dashboards, reports, and data visualizations in Looker.
Write and optimize SQL queries to extract meaningful insights from our Snowflake database.
Collaborate with data engineering teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency across reports
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) such as DAU (Daily Active Users), retention, and monetization metrics to support game performance analysis.
Maintain and update existing Looker dashboards, ensuring they remain aligned with business objectives.
Proactively identify trends in player behavior that may impact game development or feature optimization.
Participate in team meetings to present findings and contribute to discussions on how to improve game experiences based on data insights.




Required Skills, Knowledge and Expertise




Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or similar).
Basic experience with SQL and an interest in learning more about database querying.
Familiarity with Looker or any other BI tools (Tableau, Power BI) is a plus but not required ‚Äì we will provide training.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret data and generate actionable insights.
Eagerness to learn and grow in a fast-paced, data-driven environment.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Passion for mobile games or the gaming industry is a big plus!
Show more

denkmate: so nennen wir unsere erfahrenen denkwerkenden, die dir zum Start in deinen neuen Arbeitsalltag mit Rat und Tat zur Seite stehen

Janina Schulte-Kellinghaus & Pola Kaiser, Talent Acquisition Team

Title: Freelance AI Agent Assistant
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

If you're a professional who works with AI Data Annotation and friendly user of LLMs, Mindrift offers a unique opportunity to apply your editing, annotating, fact-checking and creative skills to an AI training project.

This is a freelance role for a project, and your typical tasks may include:


Conduct high-quality web searches to verify facts, gather supporting data, and cross-check AI responses.
Perform fact-checking and intent verification to ensure AI responses align with the user's goals.
Carefully review and flag any inaccuracies, inconsistencies, or irrelevant answers.
Provide structured feedback on AI-generated content to help improve model performance.
Work effectively with large language models (LLMs), understanding their capabilities and limitations, and applying best practices when interacting with them
Prompt generation with a purpose to receive the best quality result of LLMs


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You are currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's degree or higher
You have professional and/or educational experience in data annotation, demonstrate a deeper-than-user-level interest in AI, and possess intellectual breadth and curiosity
You are skilled in web searching, fact-checking, intent-checking, able to work with LLMs and have great attention to detail
Your level of English is upper-intermediate (B2) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Staff Product Analyst - Consumer Product
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst to join the Consumer Product Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

The Consumer Product Analytics Team drives product strategy and innovation by providing actionable insights on customers and products, contributing to business success. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to shape the experience for millions of users across our worldwide portfolio of platforms (FoodPanda, Pedidos Ya, Woowa, Yemeksepeti, Foodora, Talabat, HungerStation, eFood, and Glovo), directly impacting customer satisfaction and driving growth. Our diverse team of data professionals is based in Berlin, working closely with product directors, product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to directly influence product direction. We collaborate with a larger data team, including data engineers, data scientists, and ML engineers, to share knowledge and expertise.

At Consumer Product Analytics, you will have the opportunity to access high volume, rich user behavior data, engage in end to end product development cycles, work on complex product problems, and learn from many experienced data professionals.

The main responsibilities of the Product Analytics Team include:


Strategic Impact & Product Leadership: Act as a key strategic data partner to product leadership, influencing product roadmap and investment decisions through deep analytical insights and foresight. Proactively identify high-impact analytical opportunities to drive significant customer satisfaction and business growth.
Advanced Experimentation & Causal Inference: Design, implement, and rigorously analyze A/B tests and other experimental designs (e.g., multi-variate, quasi-experiments) with a strong emphasis on advanced statistical methods for robust hypothesis validation, accurate impact measurement, and understanding causal relationships. Drive the standardization and continuous improvement of our experimentation framework across multiple brands.
Metric Framework & OKR Ownership: Define, establish, and own comprehensive product metric frameworks and quarterly OKRs. Drive alignment on "what good looks like" across product teams, ensuring clear, measurable goals that align with strategic business outcomes.
Data Integrity & Tracking Excellence: Take ownership of tracking definition and work closely with various Delivery Hero brands to significantly improve the reliability, consistency, and completeness of user behavior tracking for our discovery tools. Proactively identify and resolve data quality issues at scale.
Scalable ETL & Reporting Solutions: Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines and self-service dashboards, ensuring data accessibility and empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions independently.
Deep Dive & Exploratory Analysis: Conduct complex, end-to-end exploratory analyses on large-scale user behavior data (transactional, clickstream, etc.) to uncover non-obvious insights, identify root causes of trends, and directly inform product strategy and roadmap development.
Technical & Mentorship Leadership: Contribute significantly to the growth and development of fellow product analysts through knowledge sharing sessions, best practice dissemination, workflow optimizations, and active participation in hiring and onboarding processes. Champion and drive analytical excellence within the team and broader organization.


Qualifications


9+ years of experience in product analytics or a related data-focused role, preferably within rapidly growing and dynamic environments, and with a broad mission scope or multiple stakeholders.
Expert proficiency in SQL and Python for complex data manipulation, analysis, and modeling. Experience with BigQuery and large-scale cloud data warehousing concepts is a strong plus.
Expertise in statistical methods applied to experimental design (A/B testing, multivariate tests, etc.), causal inference, and robust hypothesis validation. You should be able to navigate complex statistical challenges and explain methodologies clearly.
Extensive experience working with large-scale user behavior data (e.g., transactional, clickstream, app usage), including data cleaning, transformation, and analysis to derive actionable insights.
Proficiency with at least one data visualization tool such as Looker Studio (Data Studio), Tableau, QlikView, or Power BI, with a proven ability to create compelling and insightful dashboards.
Demonstrated ability to influence and collaborate with multiple stakeholders, including senior product managers, engineers, and business leaders. You can clearly communicate complex analytical findings and successfully drive large-scale analytics projects end-to-end (e.g., defining success metrics for a tribe, standardizing measurement across brands, or implementing new experimentation methodologies).
Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, MixPanel, Snowplow, Segment, Tealium).


Nice to have:


Experience with Airflow, DBT, or other data pipelining tools
Familiarity with recommender systems, ML models, or ranking algorithms
Experience scaling analytics processes or experimentation programs across multiple teams or brands.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.
Show more

  • 9+ years of experience in product analytics or a related data-focused role, preferably within rapidly growing and dynamic environments, and with a broad mission scope or multiple stakeholders.
  • Expert proficiency in SQL and Python for complex data manipulation, analysis, and modeling. Experience with BigQuery and large-scale cloud data warehousing concepts is a strong plus.
  • Expertise in statistical methods applied to experimental design (A/B testing, multivariate tests, etc.), causal inference, and robust hypothesis validation. You should be able to navigate complex statistical challenges and explain methodologies clearly.
  • Extensive experience working with large-scale user behavior data (e.g., transactional, clickstream, app usage), including data cleaning, transformation, and analysis to derive actionable insights.
  • Proficiency with at least one data visualization tool such as Looker Studio (Data Studio), Tableau, QlikView, or Power BI, with a proven ability to create compelling and insightful dashboards.
  • Demonstrated ability to influence and collaborate with multiple stakeholders, including senior product managers, engineers, and business leaders. You can clearly communicate complex analytical findings and successfully drive large-scale analytics projects end-to-end (e.g., defining success metrics for a tribe, standardizing measurement across brands, or implementing new experimentation methodologies).
  • Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, MixPanel, Snowplow, Segment, Tealium).

Nice to have:

  • Experience with Airflow, DBT, or other data pipelining tools
  • Familiarity with recommender systems, ML models, or ranking algorithms
  • Experience scaling analytics processes or experimentation programs across multiple teams or brands.

Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.

Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Operations Analyst ‚Äì Adsquare Data (m/f/d)
Description:
Hi there, we are‚Ä¶ a highly motivated and skilled team, where everyone's role has a real impact on the company's growth. Success and fun are combined in a great company culture with people from all over the world, that creates a melting pot of individuals with more than 20 different Nationalities!


Be part of a ambitious company whose drive is to take the advertising world into a new era
Build digital products which aim at connecting both the digital and analog world for Advertisers


Aufgaben

Own Adsquare Data Execution & Automation


Ensure Adsquare Data is prepared and delivered seamlessly
Build workflows & automation to reduce manual operational work
Monitor & improve data quality ‚Äì ensuring data is accurate, reliable, and up-to-date
Proactively identify & resolve operational bottlenecks before they impact the business


Optimise Data Distribution & Integrations


Ensure seamless data syndication across DSPs, DMPs, and platforms
Work with Data Analytics Engineers to automate taxonomy mapping & partner integrations
Implement monitoring & alerting systems to detect issues before they impact revenue


Operational Efficiency & Scalability


Improve data ingestion & monitoring processes to ensure stable data pipelines
Analyse partner usage & adoption trends to optimise performance & distribution
Drive efficiency in package management & taxonomy distribution
Collaborate with the Product & Commercial teams to support pricing & data availability


Profil


Highly passionate about data
Passionate about data operations ‚Äì ensuring smooth ingestion, processing, and delivery
A problem solver & automation enthusiast ‚Äì always looking for ways to reduce manual effort
Experienced in managing data pipelines & ingestion workflows (4+ years in Data Ops, Data Engineering, or AdTech)
Familiar with AdTech & programmatic advertising (DSPs, audience segmentation, taxonomy)
Proficient in SQL, Python, ETL workflows/DBT, cloud data infrastructure (AWS, GCP, Snowflake, etc.)
Experienced with data monitoring & quality control ‚Äì ensuring accuracy & compliance
Able to work across teams ‚Äì collaborating with Engineering, Product, and Partnerships
A self-starter who can take ownership and drive improvements in scalability & efficiency


You feel that you don't meet all but most requirements?

Wir bieten

Apply anyway. You have the chance to develop further with us.


Become part of an amazing team which is crazy enough to believe they can change how advertising is done
Unfold your abilities and to let your ideas become reality - Because everyone of us has a say in what we do


Why us?

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
A leading European bank is seeking a highly skilled and ambitious Quantitative Analyst to join its Berlin office. This is a senior-level opportunity within the Risk Methodology team, focused on greenfield model development projects that support key global regulatory and business initiatives, including IFRS9, CECL, CCAR, and climate risk. You will work across Deutsche Bank‚Äôs global credit risk function, partnering with stakeholders across multiple departments and directly engaging with regulators and auditors.




Requirements:




Postgraduate degree (Master‚Äôs or PhD) in a quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics, physics, econometrics, or quantitative finance
Extensive hands-on experience in quantitative analytics within a financial or regulatory context
Proven ability to develop and implement projection models for PD, LGD, and stress testing frameworks (IFRS9, CECL, CCAR, EBA)
Experience in climate risk modeling for ICAAP, scenario analysis, and stress testing is highly desirable
Strong programming skills in Python, R, or MATLAB, with a focus on numerical methods and data processing tools
Excellent understanding of credit products, market dynamics, and regulatory requirements
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, with experience presenting to senior management, external auditors, and regulatory bodies
Strong project management and leadership capabilities, with a track record of delivering complex, cross-functional projects

Title: Website Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
About Yepoda

At Yepoda, Korean effectiveness meets sustainable solutions: our mindfully produced skincare products are made with love in Korea. Our mission is to bring the best beauty innovations from Korea straight to Europe ‚Äì without ever compromising on our values, quality, or sustainability. All our products are made with the best natural and active ingredients, are vegan and cruelty-free. We aim to make the K-Beauty routine easy, effective, and fun.

We are a beauty start-up founded in 2020 and located in the heart of Berlin. Our team is made of over 80 brilliant human beings who came from all over the world to actively write Yepoda‚Äôs story. We are currently looking for a Website Analyst to join our Website team. You will work closely with a Product Manager to deliver data-driven insights that optimize and steer our e-commerce growth to new heights.

Your Tasks


Own and improve data quality, tracking, and reporting infrastructure for our website
Set up and maintain real-time monitoring for key website metrics
Lead ad-hoc analysis to support fast-moving product decisions and incident investigations
Design, implement, and evaluate A/B tests
Collaborate with Product, Business Development, Data, and Marketing teams to align on goals and define the metrics that matter
Proactively communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels
Take ownership of GA4 implementation ‚Äì troubleshoot ecommerce events, validate Meta tracking, and reduce data discrepancies between systems


Your Profile


3+ years of experience as a website, product, business or data analyst, ideally in a fast-paced start-up environment (internship and junior experience not included)
Deep knowledge of GA4, GTM, and server-side tracking setups
Strong SQL skills and hands-on experience with Looker Studio for building actionable dashboards
Experience working with Meta (Facebook Ads) tracking, attribution, and campaign analysis
Comfortable analyzing and reconciling data across platforms (GA4, Shopify, Meta)
Familiarity with A/B testing workflows and ability to evaluate impact based on test results
Basic understanding of statistical concepts like hypothesis testing, regression, and forecasting ‚Äì deeper knowledge is a plus
Independent, structured, and proactive with a strong ownership mindset
Based in Berlin or open to relocating ‚Äì we value in-person collaboration in our HQ
Excellent English communication skills


Nice to Have


Experience with Python for data analysis or automation
Familiarity with dbt Cloud and BigQuery
Language proficiency in German, Italian, Spanish, French, Polish, or Korean


What we offer


Dynamic Environment ‚Äì The opportunity to work in a start-up surrounded by a passionate and dedicated team
Accelerate Your Career ‚Äì Take on ownership from day 1 with room for fast growth
Inspiring Workspace ‚Äì Office in the heart of Berlin's Prenzlauer Berg, dog-friendly, stocked with drinks and snacks
Hybrid Working ‚Äì We support flexibility, but value in-person collaboration where possible
We Value Diversity ‚Äì A welcoming, international, inclusive team with flat hierarchies and trust by default
Employee Discounts ‚Äì Enjoy Yepoda products at a discount and share the love with friends and family
Unique Add-ons ‚Äì Urban Sports membership package to help you stay active and healthy


Would you like to be part of the team? Then we'd love to hear from you! ü´∞‚ú®

Please apply by clicking the ‚ÄúApply for this job‚Äù button below and upload your CV and portfolio in English. Our Talent Acquisition team will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible.

At Yepoda we are dedicated to providing equal employment opportunities to all individuals, regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, citizenship, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, parental status, disability, or any other status protected by applicable law.
