Title: Sr. Analyst, Data & Analytics
Description:
Who We Are

Authentic is a unified platform that integrates M&A, brand strategy, creativity and digital innovation to unlock the power of its global Lifestyle and Entertainment portfolio.¬†As the world‚Äôs largest sports and entertainment licensing company, Authentic connects strong brands with best-in-class partners to optimize long-term value in the marketplace.¬†Its brands generate more than $32 billion in global annual retail sales and have an expansive retail footprint in more than 150 countries, including 13,000-plus freestanding stores and shop-in-shops and 400,000 points of sale.¬†Authentic transforms brands by delivering powerful storytelling, compelling content, innovative business models and immersive experiences. It creates original marketing strategies to drive the success of its brands across all consumer touchpoints, platforms and emerging media

¬†Why Authentic

¬†You‚Äôll be able to access the resources and scale, while leveraging innovative technology and nimble environment. What we‚Äôre saying is, this isn‚Äôt your average day job. If you‚Äôre hungry to drive ideas into action and own your career, let‚Äôs chat. Our team is rapidly innovating to evolve and define the future of our brands. With the help of some of the brightest minds in retail, marketing, licensing, legal and more, we are building the intersection of digital and experiential marketing to help achieve that mission. We reimagine, evolve and transform brands! At Authentic, we foster an inclusive workplace where diversity of thought and expertise drive competitive advantage. Our global teams are built by go-getters who contribute unique perspectives and push the boundaries of creativity and innovation. Headquartered in New York City, Authentic has offices in major metropolitan cities including Los Angeles and Miami, as well as Toronto, Mexico City, London, and Shanghai.

What You‚Äôll Do

The Sr. Analyst, Data & Analytics will play a key role in driving data-driven insights, building and automating data processes, and contributing to business intelligence efforts for the Authentic brands. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze business performance, generate reports, and provide actionable recommendations that contribute to the digital success of the portfolio. This is a high-impact role in a fast-paced environment, ideal for someone passionate about data analysis, digital strategy, and growth.

What you‚Äôll be working on

Data Analysis & Reporting:
Analyze digital sales data, customer behaviors, and other key performance metrics for ABG brands across various digital channels (eCommerce, social media, etc.).
Create regular dashboards and reports to track performance against KPIs, ensuring actionable insights are communicated clearly to key stakeholders.
Monitor and evaluate trends in the retail and digital landscape, identifying growth opportunities and areas for improvement.
Play a key role in architecting and advancing ABG‚Äôs foundational data infrastructure to support scalable insights and operations.
Business Intelligence & Forecasting:
Leverage BI tools and data models to conduct in-depth analysis and generate forecasts that aid in business decision-making.
Provide recommendations for digital marketing campaigns, product assortment, and merchandising strategies based on data analysis.
Collaboration & Cross-Functional Support:
Work closely with technology, marketing, sales & operations teams to ensure alignment in strategic planning and business objectives.
Assist in the onboarding of brands into ABG‚Äôs digital ecosystem, ensuring data integrity, reporting accuracy, and alignment with overall business goals.
Support senior leadership by providing timely analysis and presenting insights during regular business review meetings.
Process Improvement & Optimization:
Identify and implement process improvements to enhance the efficiency and accuracy of reporting and analysis.
Help automate reporting processes and leverage advanced analytics tools to streamline data collection and reporting functions.
Ad-hoc Analysis:
Conduct ad-hoc analysis for special projects or urgent business needs, providing actionable insights to drive key business decisions.

¬†

Must Haves:

¬†

Education:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Data Science, or a related field. Master‚Äôs degree a plus.
Experience:
3-5 years of experience in business analysis, digital analytics, or related field, preferably within eCommerce or retail environments.
Experience in digital planning, sales forecasting, and inventory management is a plus.
Familiarity with fashion brands or the retail industry is beneficial.
Technical Skills:
Business Intelligence & Cloud Platforms: Preferred experience with tools such as BigQuery, AWS, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc. for data collection, processing, and insights generation.
Data Analysis & Visualization: Proficient in Excel, Google Sheets, and Looker for analyzing complex datasets and creating intuitive dashboards and reports.
Database Querying: Strong command of SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis across various database systems.
Analytical Expertise: Skilled in reporting, big data management, and applying analytical techniques to drive data-informed decision-making.
Key Competencies:
Strong analytical skills with the ability to turn large & complex data sets into actionable insights.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present data findings clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional, team-oriented environment.
A proactive approach with a passion for continuous learning and improvement.

¬†

Primary Location Salary Range: $105,000 - $130,000¬†

Authentic is an equal-opportunity employer and we value and embrace the diversity and inclusion of all Team Members. We do not discriminate on the basis of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, national origin, disability, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status.

For individuals with disabilities or religious obligations who would like to request an accommodation, please contact talent@authentic.com

To access Authentic' s¬†Privacy Policy, which contains information regarding data collected from job applicants and how we use it, please click here:

https://www.authentic.com/privacy-policy

Who We Are

Authentic is a unified platform that integrates M&A, brand strategy, creativity and digital innovation to unlock the power of its global Lifestyle and Entertainment portfolio. As the world‚Äôs largest sports and entertainment licensing company, Authentic connects strong brands with best-in-class partners to optimize long-term value in the marketplace. Its brands generate more than $32 billion in global annual retail sales and have an expansive retail footprint in more than 150 countries, including 13,000-plus freestanding stores and shop-in-shops and 400,000 points of sale. Authentic transforms brands by delivering powerful storytelling, compelling content, innovative business models and immersive experiences. It creates original marketing strategies to drive the success of its brands across all consumer touchpoints, platforms and emerging media

 Why Authentic

 You‚Äôll be able to access the resources and scale, while leveraging innovative technology and nimble environment. What we‚Äôre saying is, this isn‚Äôt your average day job. If you‚Äôre hungry to drive ideas into action and own your career, let‚Äôs chat. Our team is rapidly innovating to evolve and define the future of our brands. With the help of some of the brightest minds in retail, marketing, licensing, legal and more, we are building the intersection of digital and experiential marketing to help achieve that mission. We reimagine, evolve and transform brands! At Authentic, we foster an inclusive workplace where diversity of thought and expertise drive competitive advantage. Our global teams are built by go-getters who contribute unique perspectives and push the boundaries of creativity and innovation. Headquartered in New York City, Authentic has offices in major metropolitan cities including Los Angeles and Miami, as well as Toronto, Mexico City, London, and Shanghai.

What You‚Äôll Do

The Sr. Analyst, Data & Analytics will play a key role in driving data-driven insights, building and automating data processes, and contributing to business intelligence efforts for the Authentic brands. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze business performance, generate reports, and provide actionable recommendations that contribute to the digital success of the portfolio. This is a high-impact role in a fast-paced environment, ideal for someone passionate about data analysis, digital strategy, and growth.

What you‚Äôll be working on

  • Data Analysis & Reporting:
    • Analyze digital sales data, customer behaviors, and other key performance metrics for ABG brands across various digital channels (eCommerce, social media, etc.).
    • Create regular dashboards and reports to track performance against KPIs, ensuring actionable insights are communicated clearly to key stakeholders.
    • Monitor and evaluate trends in the retail and digital landscape, identifying growth opportunities and areas for improvement.
    • Play a key role in architecting and advancing ABG‚Äôs foundational data infrastructure to support scalable insights and operations.
  • Business Intelligence & Forecasting:
    • Leverage BI tools and data models to conduct in-depth analysis and generate forecasts that aid in business decision-making.
    • Provide recommendations for digital marketing campaigns, product assortment, and merchandising strategies based on data analysis.
  • Collaboration & Cross-Functional Support:
    • Work closely with technology, marketing, sales & operations teams to ensure alignment in strategic planning and business objectives.
    • Assist in the onboarding of brands into ABG‚Äôs digital ecosystem, ensuring data integrity, reporting accuracy, and alignment with overall business goals.
    • Support senior leadership by providing timely analysis and presenting insights during regular business review meetings.
  • Process Improvement & Optimization:
    • Identify and implement process improvements to enhance the efficiency and accuracy of reporting and analysis.
    • Help automate reporting processes and leverage advanced analytics tools to streamline data collection and reporting functions.
  • Ad-hoc Analysis:
    • Conduct ad-hoc analysis for special projects or urgent business needs, providing actionable insights to drive key business decisions.

 

Must Haves:

 

  • Education:
    • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Data Science, or a related field. Master‚Äôs degree a plus.
  • Experience:
    • 3-5 years of experience in business analysis, digital analytics, or related field, preferably within eCommerce or retail environments.
    • Experience in digital planning, sales forecasting, and inventory management is a plus.
    • Familiarity with fashion brands or the retail industry is beneficial.
  • Technical Skills:
    • Business Intelligence & Cloud Platforms: Preferred experience with tools such as BigQuery, AWS, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc. for data collection, processing, and insights generation.
    • Data Analysis & Visualization: Proficient in Excel, Google Sheets, and Looker for analyzing complex datasets and creating intuitive dashboards and reports.
    • Database Querying: Strong command of SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis across various database systems.
    • Analytical Expertise: Skilled in reporting, big data management, and applying analytical techniques to drive data-informed decision-making.
  • Key Competencies:
    • Strong analytical skills with the ability to turn large & complex data sets into actionable insights.
    • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present data findings clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
    • Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
    • Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional, team-oriented environment.
    • A proactive approach with a passion for continuous learning and improvement.

 

Primary Location Salary Range: $105,000 - $130,000 

Authentic is an equal-opportunity employer and we value and embrace the diversity and inclusion of all Team Members. We do not discriminate on the basis of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, national origin, disability, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status.

Title: Data Analyst - Services
Description:
We are Lenovo. We do what we say. We own what we do. We WOW our customers.

Lenovo is a US$57 billion revenue global technology powerhouse, ranked #248 in the Fortune Global 500, and serving millions of customers every day in 180 markets. Focused on a bold vision to deliver Smarter Technology for All, Lenovo has built on its success as the world‚Äôs largest PC company with a full-stack portfolio of AI-enabled, AI-ready, and AI-optimized devices (PCs, workstations, smartphones, tablets), infrastructure (server, storage, edge, high performance computing and software defined infrastructure), software, solutions, and services. Lenovo‚Äôs continued investment in world-changing innovation is building a more equitable, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. Lenovo is listed on the Hong Kong stock exchange under Lenovo Group Limited (HKSE: 992) (ADR: LNVGY).

This transformation together with Lenovo‚Äôs world-changing innovation is building a more inclusive, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit www.lenovo.com, and read about the latest news via our StoryHub.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze call center metrics, remote service data ( Onsite and Depot), and customer experience feedback to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement
Design and implement dashboards to track KPIs for service delivery performance, customer satisfaction, and operational efficiency
Perform root cause analysis on service delivery issues to help teams address underlying problems
Generate regular reports on service performance metrics for leadership and operational teams
Collaborate with IT and service management teams to improve data quality and collection methods
Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable recommendations for non-technical stakeholders


Required Qualifications


3+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a service delivery or call center environment
Strong experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Proficiency in statistical analysis and data mining techniques
Experience analyzing customer satisfaction metrics and service level agreements
Demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with remote service delivery models and associated metrics
Familiarity with CRM systems and support ticketing platforms
Understanding of customer journey mapping and experience measurement
Experience with process improvement methodologies (Six Sigma, Lean)


What Success Looks Like


Deliver data-driven insights that measurably improve customer satisfaction scores
Create self-service analytics that enable teams to make informed decisions


Identify optimization opportunities that reduce costs while maintaining service quality

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Employment Type: Full-Time, Direct Hire

Location: New York, NY (Hybrid)

Overview

We are looking for an analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our data team supporting high-impact financial operations. This role is geared toward individuals with a strong foundation in analytics and data manipulation, particularly in environments such as private equity, hedge funds, fintech, or investment banking. The ideal candidate will bring technical proficiency, financial insight, and a passion for uncovering actionable insights from complex datasets.

Key Responsibilities

Analyze large-scale financial datasets to uncover patterns, trends, and opportunities
Design and execute data workflows for modeling, forecasting, and operational reporting
Build and maintain dashboards and reporting tools using Power BI and advanced Excel (including macros and VLOOKUP)
Write and optimize queries in SQL and develop scripts in Python to support analytical initiatives
Collaborate with business teams to define data requirements and deliver insights for decision-making
Support machine learning and predictive modeling projects aimed at strategic investment and financial planning
Ensure data integrity and compliance with quality standards in a cloud-driven environment

Required Qualifications

3‚Äì5 years of experience in data analysis roles, ideally in financial services
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Excel with advanced functions (macros, VLOOKUP, pivot tables)
Experience using Power BI or similar data visualization tools
Strong understanding of data manipulation, data modeling, and analytics workflows
Ability to translate complex datasets into clear business insights
Familiarity with ML and predictive modeling techniques for financial applications

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Finance, or a related field
Prior experience in high-growth fintech, hedge funds, or investment banking analytics teams
Certification in SQL development, BI tools, or Python programming is a plus

Work Environment

Hybrid work structure with onsite presence in New York, NY
Fast-paced, data-driven culture combining technology innovation with financial strategy

Title: Data Analyst, Supplier Management
Description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with over 300 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

We are seeking a highly analytical Data Analyst to join our Supplier Management Operations team. In this role, you will partner with sourcing managers to develop risk mitigation strategies, perform strategic sourcing analytics, analyze supplier and category spend, and build comprehensive supplier dashboards. The Data Analyst will lead supplier segmentation initiatives to categorize suppliers based on risk and strategic impact, enabling tailored engagement and risk management strategies.

Responsibilities


Risk Mitigation Strategies: Collaborate with sourcing managers to develop risk mitigation strategies that are aligned with the overall sourcing strategy
Strategic Sourcing Analytics: Perform strategic sourcing analytics, including spend analysis, market research, and supplier performance analysis, integrating financial risk as a key variable in decision-making
Supplier Segmentation: Lead supplier segmentation efforts to categorize suppliers based on risk and strategic impact, to tailor engagement and risk management strategies
Dashboard Development: Design and maintain supplier summary dashboards to provide insights into supplier spend and risk metrics
Supplier Insights and Evaluation: Analyze supplier metrics and gather internal reviews and ratings to enhance visibility and drive informed decision making


Qualities We‚Äôre Looking For


At least 8 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a procurement or sourcing environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate analysis into actionable insights and recommendations for business stakeholders
Experience with supplier segmentation and developing tailored sourcing strategies, considering risk profiles as a key segmentation criterion
Proficiency in financial statement analysis (balance sheet, income statement, cash flow statement), with the ability to identify key financial ratios and red flags
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (Excel, Python, SQL, Tableau, Power BI)
Comfortable working in self-directed and ambiguous environments
Excellent communication, interpersonal and relationship-building skills
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Supply Chain, Data Science or related field
Media and Entertainment or Tech industry experience preferred


Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $60,000 - $290,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.

Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Experient, we partner with the world‚Äôs most recognized brands to deliver superior experience, technology, and transformation, creating a dynamic work environment. We value collaboration, prioritize effective communication, and focus on delivering results quickly and practically. Whether you‚Äôre looking to deepen your expertise or take on new challenges, we‚Äôre here to support your journey every step of the way.

We are seeking a detail-oriented, analytical, and curious Data Analyst to join our team. This role will be responsible for transforming raw data into actionable insights that support strategic business decisions across departments. The ideal candidate will have 2‚Äì5 years of experience in data analysis, strong communication skills, and proficiency with modern analytics tools and programming languages.

What You Will Do


Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for operational improvements.
Develop dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or and Amazon QuickSights.
Write complex SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from relational databases.
Work closely with business stakeholders to define KPIs and support data-driven decision-making.
Perform ad hoc analyses and communicate findings with clarity and visual impact.
Collaborate with data engineers to ensure data accuracy and integrity in analytics pipelines.
Use statistical methods to validate hypotheses and provide predictive insights.


What You Will Bring


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
2‚Äì5 years of experience in a data analyst or business intelligence role.
Proficient with data visualization tools and dashboard building (Power BI, Tableau, Looker, etc.).
Proficient in SQL, Excel, and one or more of Python, R, or SAS.
Solid understanding of data modeling and ETL processes.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Excellent communication skills‚Äîability to present complex data clearly to non-technical audiences.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with Power Automate and Power Apps
Experience working with cloud data platforms (e.g., AWS Redshift, Snowflake, Google BigQuery).
Background in finance, marketing analytics, or supply chain is a plus.


Experient is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, genetic data, or other legally protected status.‚ÄØ

Title: Data & Visualization Analyst
Description:
Data & Visualization Analyst (Remote) at UCT




Drive Semiconductor Innovation with Data at UCT

UCT harnesses data to fuel strategic decisions and innovation in semiconductor manufacturing. We seek a remote Data & Visualization Analyst with unmatched expertise to deliver high-impact analytics. Only masters of these skills need apply!




Key Responsibilities:

Lead data projects from requirements to actionable insights.
Build advanced Power BI dashboards with DAX/Power Query.
Integrate datasets using SAP BW for seamless reporting.
Optimize pipelines with SQL, Python, and cloud platforms.
Design scalable data models and define KPIs.
Ensure data quality in Agile workflows.

Required Skills (This Combination, Advanced & Expert-Level):

SAP BW: Mastery in data integration/reporting.
Power BI with DAX/Power Query: Mastery in visualizations.
Independent Report Creation: Expert in autonomous reporting.
SQL/Python: Expert in querying/scripting.
Data Modeling: Advanced in schema design.
Databricks: Expert in cloud processing (AWS/Azure with trainability accepted).
Thank you, only this order of skill(s) will be reviewed. or less-than-expert proficiency accepted.

Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor‚Äôs/master‚Äôs in computer science, IT, or related field.
Experience: 3-6 years in data analytics/BI, ideally in semiconductor/high-tech industries.
Certifications: SAP BW/BO, Power BI, or Databricks preferred.
Skills: Superior analytical and communication skills. Agile experience a plus.

Work Environment:

Fully remote, supporting UCT‚Äôs semiconductor mission.
Minimal demands: prolonged sitting, occasional standing. Accessibility accommodations provided.

Apply: Submit resume via [michael.halsey@uct.com] .

#DataAnalytics #Semiconductor #RemoteJobs

Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
Overview

At Emory Healthcare we fuel your professional journey with better benefits, valuable resources, ongoing mentorship and leadership programs for all types of jobs, and a supportive environment that enables you to reach new heights in your career and be what you want to be. We provide:


Comprehensive health benefits that start day 1
Student Loan Repayment Assistance & Reimbursement Programs
Family-focused benefits
Wellness incentives


Ongoing mentorship, development, leadership programs...and more!


Hybrid, 2 days remote, 3 days in office, work structure may change per business needs.


Description

JOB DESCRIPTION:


The Data Analyst I is responsible for supporting & maintaining reporting activities to provide operational insights.
The Analyst should be familiar with at least 1 relevant database and associated functionality to modify reports and extract data.
The Analyst will use reporting output to identify trends and communicate findings.
The Data Analyst I is proficient with Excel to clean, manipulate, and summarize data.
Key Excel competencies include ability to write functions (e.g. pair vlook statements with if-then statements).


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in biostatistics, specifically propensity analyses


Minimum Qualifications


Bachelor's degree or Associate's degree and 2 relevant years of experience


Additional Details

Emory is an equal opportunity employer, and qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by state or federal law.

Emory Healthcare is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities upon request. Please contact Emory Healthcare‚Äôs Human Resources at careers@emoryhealthcare.org . Please note that one week's advance notice is preferred.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

The Strategy Data Analyst will support the LANEIGE brand team by delivering data-driven insights across key strategic areas including product performance, consumer behavior, and market trends. This role will work closely with cross-functional teams such as Brand Marketing, E-commerce, and Global HQ to inform decision-making and optimize brand growth.




Key Responsibilities




Business Strategy & Performance Analysis

Collaborate with Demand Planning and Sales Account Leads to consolidate inputs and align with monthly net sales targets, contributing to accurate performance tracking and strategic planning.
Collaborate with the Marketing team to manage SKU lists and regularly share updates with relevant departments to ensure alignment and operational efficiency
Manage and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) on a monthly basis using sales and operational data; communicate findings with relevant departments and HQ.
Conduct weekly/monthly sales performance analysis(Sell-thru, Sell-in) and share insights with brand teams and stakeholders, including HQ counterparts.
Generate diversified insights through regular data analysis to support business growth and strategic planning.
Track and report monthly P&L metrics, identifying issues and escalating them to management with actionable recommendations.




Market Intelligence

Conduct periodic and ad-hoc market research to identify key trends in the US market and propose strategic actions for brands (LANEIGE, INNISFREE, HANYUL)
Collaborate with the CMI team and Amazon Team to manage and analyze market data from third-party sources (e.g., Circana, Profitero)
Support brand and corporate teams with consumer and competitive intelligence to enhance market positioning
Work closely with the Brands(LANEIGE, INNISFREE, HANYUL) Marketing team to provide necessary analytical data and support data-driven decision-making(e.g., category, retailer)




Global Corporate Strategy Development

Support new business development initiatives across North and Latin America (e.g., new markets, new channels) by coordinating with internal and external stakeholders.
Review and summarize key HQ documents written in Korean, and share relevant insights with team members and leadership
Ensure alignment between HQ‚Äôs global strategic direction and APUS‚Äôs local strategies through effective communication and data-driven insights.
Assist in the development of short- and long-term business plans by providing relevant data analysis and scenario modeling.
Provide analytical support for regular HQ meetings (weekly/monthly) and key strategic discussions.




Required Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, business strategy, or a related role (experience in beauty industry is a plus).
Proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools (e.g., SAP, Power BI) are a strong plus.
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills in English & Korean
Ability to work cross-functionally and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.




Company Benefits

Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
HSA Employer Contributions and FSA Options
401k Participation with company matching.
Discount on all APUS Brands Products
Gratis Program - Gift box with top selling products, twice a year
Paid Maternity Leave
Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance
Paid Time Off: Vacation / Personal days / Sick days
Company offered Mental Counseling for all employees
Office-closed holidays and floating holidays
Company sponsored events
Education assistant Program
Employee Referral Program







AMOREPACIFIC, US, INC is an equal opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We actively seek to maintain a diverse work force, and AMOREPACIFIC US, INC therefore recruits qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, or Vietnam veteran status.

  • Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
  • Support decision-making through statistical analysis and forecasting.

üîπ Reporting & Visualization

  • Design and build dashboards and reports using Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.
  • Present data-driven findings in a clear, concise manner to stakeholders.

üîπ Team Collaboration

  • Work with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver tailored analytics solutions.

üîπ Tool Utilization

  • Leverage tools like SQL, Excel, and BI platforms for analysis and reporting.

üîπ Data Governance

  • Contribute to the implementation of data governance and best practices for long-term data integrity.

Qualifications:

‚úÖ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field

‚úÖ Minimum of 2 years of experience in a data analysis or similar role

‚úÖ Proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Excel

‚úÖ Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI

‚úÖ Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking abilities

‚úÖ Excellent written and verbal communication skills

‚úÖ Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders

Title: Data Analyst(Workforce Analytics)
Description:
Step into a role where your analytical mindset makes a real impact. We are looking for a results-driven Data Analyst with strong data analytics skills to join our team. The ideal candidate will be passionate about interpreting complex datasets, generating actionable insights, and enabling data-informed decision-making across the business. If you're analytical, detail-oriented, and enjoy working with cross-functional teams, we'd love to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities


Aggregate and analyze data from internal and external sources to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Translate analytical findings into actionable business insights and strategic recommendations.
Communicate analysis results effectively through dashboards, reports, and presentations tailored for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Apply creative data problem-solving when full data sets are unavailable or incomplete.
Collaborate with teams including Sales, IT, Risk, and Project Management to support data-driven decision-making and process improvements.
Develop and maintain automated dashboards and recurring reports using visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Drive data quality improvement initiatives by identifying inconsistencies, gaps, or integrity issues.
Support origination quality, business performance tracking, and continuous improvement projects.


Required Qualifications


8+ years of experience in data analytics or equivalent work experience.
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights clearly to non-technical audiences.
Proficient in MS Office tools including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in advanced analytics projects related to HR, talent management, or organizational planning.
Prior background in automotive or manufacturing.
Experience working in cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, or GCP is a plus.
Familiarity with data modeling, ETL processes, or cloud data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery).
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and statistical modeling.


Benefits


401(k).
Dental Insurance.
Health insurance.
Vision insurance.
We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity, equality, inclusion, and respect for people.
The salary will be determined based on several factors including, but not limited to, location, relevant education, qualifications, experience, technical skills, and business needs.


Additional Responsibilities


Participate in OP monthly team meetings, and participate in team-building efforts.
Contribute to OP technical discussions, peer reviews, etc.
Contribute content and collaborate via the OP-Wiki/Knowledge Base.
Provide status reports to OP Account Management as requested.


About Us

OP is a technology consulting and solutions company, offering advisory and managed services, innovative platforms, and staffing solutions across a wide range of fields ‚Äî including AI, cyber security, enterprise architecture, and beyond. Our most valuable asset is our people: dynamic, creative thinkers, who are passionate about doing quality work. As a member of the OP team, you will have access to industry-leading consulting practices, strategies & and technologies, innovative training & education. An ideal OP team member is a technology leader with a proven track record of technical excellence and a strong focus on process and methodology.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ORIGIN

Origin is reimagining wealth management by making it accessible and affordable to all.

Today, money is the [#1] source of stress - more than jobs, health, and relationships combined. That stress is exacerbated in the current economic environment, which is presenting people with once-in-a-generation financial challenges. Origin is tackling this problem head on by expanding access to financial planning for those who have historically been boxed out due to high barriers to entry.

Our product simplifies finances for individuals making it easy to manage spend and investments, get expert advice, and take action to hit financial goals.

We are a fast-paced startup in the series B round, led by repeat founders and backed by leading VC firms like Founders Fund, Felicis, and General Catalyst.

THE ROLE

Mission

We are looking for a Data Analyst with a passion for bringing meaning and understanding out of raw and semi-structured data. This role will have you working in a cross-functional and collaborative environment filled with technical talent to help you learn, develop, and hone your skills. As a partner to our product, marketing, and engineering teams you will help guide Origin‚Äôs growth through data-driven decision making.

Responsibilities


Design and maintain core business metrics, dashboards, and data products that empower teams to make informed decisions.
Partner with stakeholders across Marketing, Product, and Engineering to uncover insights about user behavior and product engagement.
Translate complex data into actionable insights through clear visualizations and storytelling.
Model clean, scalable datasets using modern tools like dbt, and Airflow.
Own the full lifecycle of analysis‚Äîfrom question definition and exploration to delivery and iteration.
Drive a culture of curiosity and experimentation, using data to identify growth opportunities and influence product roadmaps.
Ensure high-quality, reliable data through collaboration with engineering and proactive data validation.


Must Have


Proficiency in SQL, including advanced features like window functions and CTEs.
Experience using Python for data analysis, modeling, or automation.
Self-starter who enjoys working across a cross-functional team.
Experience building dashboards and visualizations in a BI Tool (e.g. Tableau, Metabase, PowerBI)
Ability to clearly communicate analytical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related analytical field.


Nice to Have


2-5 years of experience in a data or business intelligence role.
Familiarity with modern data orchestration tools like Airflow and dbt.
Experience with GitHub.
Experience in product and marketing analytics.
Strong statistical skills to guide experimentation roadmaps.


Eligibility Requirements


Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States.
Origin does not sponsor visas.


What We Offer

Financial Benefits:


Generous base salary
Meaningful equity package
Retirement 401k for USA-based Originals


Healthcare And Wellness Programs


Healthcare
Wellness stipend
Mental wellness program
Unlimited access to financial planning
Life insurance for USA-based Originals


Work-life Balance


Unlimited PTO
Remote-first culture
Flexible hours (Core hours: 9 AM to 5 PM local time)
Paid Parental Leave


Additional Perks


Parenthood and fertility assistance
Monthly co-working membership reimbursement
English tutoring stipend for International Originals
Build your home-office one-time stipend
Pick your setup (Apple, Windows) and accessories


ORIGINALS

Fulfilling our mission is only possible with a diverse team that breathes for excellence and is hugely committed to making money simple for everyone, everywhere.

As a team, we are obsessed with delivering the best solution possible to our members through an elegant and self-guided experience. We know that building a product of this magnitude requires from us tons of creativity, autonomy, and flexibility to move fast and embrace uncertainties with ownership. This is who we daily pursue to be!

To embrace talented people like this and provide the necessary resources to achieve their best versions, we believe in the power of a healthy environment where each person is valued for who they are and have clear goals and expectations for the future they can build within the company. Each person here is seen as a key player in our team.

Our environment is diverse, with excellent people and equal opportunities. We believe in the power of the individuality and uniqueness of each of us to make our team even more powerful.

We are building an outstanding solution, and here is an invitation for you to become an Original and join us on this journey!
Show more

We are building an outstanding solution, and here is an invitation for you to become an Original and join us on this journey!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Notice to applicants:

This is a non-sponsorship opportunity; employer will not transfer or sponsor applicants for U.S. work authorizations.
Applicants are required to be legally authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis immediately.
Candidates must be able to commute into an office and reside locally.




No Solicitations or Recruiters.

Direct Emails with candidate resumes will be eliminated. Local Candidates Only




SUMMARY OF POSITION:

The Data Analyst is responsible for managing a combination of data processing, workflow management, quality control analysis, and training communication to improve accuracy, quality, and data integrity. The Data Analyst will have a keen eye for detail, be proficient with various data processing software, and excel at interpreting and reporting data trends and data analytics.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Data Collection & Management: Collect, organize, and validate large datasets and processing statistics from multiple sources to ensure completeness and accuracy, ensuring all data is stored securely and accurately.
Workflow Management ‚Äì Conduct audit of current workflow to improve efficiency, remediate scheduling bottlenecks and recurring quality issues and revamp setup to meet the changing needs of the department.
Data Analysis: Analyze data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can support decision making. Use statistical techniques and software tools to interpret and analyze data.
Data Visualization: Create visual reports and dashboards (using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Excel) to present complex findings in an easily understandable manner for stakeholders.
Data Quality Control: Conduct quality control checks and reviews of electronic documents and data files, ensuring that data is processed correctly and meets the required standards. Perform data cleansing tasks to ensure that datasets are accurate and free from errors, inconsistencies, or redundancies. Assess Processing patterns and establish updated controls when patterns are noticed.
Monitor and Review Logs: Monitor data processing logs for inconsistencies or issues; report any discrepancies to the Supervisor/Manager for immediate resolution. Assess logging patterns and update controls and SOPs as required when anomalies occur.
Problem Resolution: Investigate and report data processing discrepancies and develop solutions to enhance data handling processes. Aim to reduce encountered issues by 25% within a calendar year.
Continuous Improvement: Collaborate with team members to propose and implement enhancements for more efficient data collection, processing, and analysis procedures. Target a 25% reduction in repeated escalated situations within a calendar year.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with other departments to ensure that data requirements and reporting specifications are understood and met.
Ad-Hoc Analysis: Perform ad-hoc analysis as needed to support business requirements or urgent inquiries. Identify new sources of operating problem areas for future automation possibilities. Proactively look for upstream gaps and work with various stakeholders to ensure breakdowns are solved and scalable.
Deliverables: Provide a comprehensive set of recommendations at the end of the engagement to improve workflow efficiency, quality control, data consistency and integrity, quality of training and communication, and cross-department collaboration.
Assigned other duties and special projects as required by management.

Qualification Requirements:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer-related field in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or a closely related field is required, Master‚Äôs degree a plus.

Experience and Skills:

Database experience, a plus
Strong working knowledge with MS Office
Minimum of 3 years of professional experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role focused on data interpretation and insight generation.
Proficiency with data analysis tools and languages such as SQL, Excel, Python, R, and data visualization platforms like Tableau or Power BI.
Minimum of 3 years‚Äô experience working in Linux/Unix environments, with scripting ability in bash or similar.
Strong knowledge of statistical methods, data modeling, and data-driven decision-making techniques.
Familiarity with relational database management systems (e.g., Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL).
Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information clearly and effectively to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Effective problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent organizational and planning skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with a diverse, multi-cultural and multi-generational staff.
Able to multi-task in demanding and fast paced environment
Requires technical problem resolution skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with expedited responsiveness.

Preferred Skills:

Experience with machine learning techniques and predictive analytics tools.
Familiarity with ETL processes and data warehousing concepts.
Working knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud Platform, or Azure for data storage and analysis.
Adaptability to learn and adopt new technologies and analytical tools.
Knowledge of technical troubleshooting methods and systems thinking.
Experience in cross-functional collaboration within a diverse and multi-generational team environment.
High level of responsiveness with excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst & Backend Developer with AI




The Digital Business Team develops promising digital solutions for global products and processes. It aims to organize Applus+ Laboratories' information, making it useful, fast, and reliable for both the Applus+ Group and its clients. The team‚Äôs mission is to be recognized as the most digital, innovative, and customer-oriented company, reducing digital operations costs while increasing the value and portfolio of services.




We are looking for a Data Science / AI Engineer to join our Digital team and contribute to the development of evolving data products and applications.




Responsibilities:

Collect, organize, and analyze structured and unstructured data to extract actionable insights, generate code, train models, validate results, and draw meaningful conclusions.
Demonstrate advanced proficiency in Power BI, including data modeling, DAX, the creation of interactive dashboards, and connecting to diverse data sources.
Possess a strong mathematical and statistical foundation, with experience in numerical methods and a wide range of machine learning algorithms.
Exhibit hands-on experience in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and foundation models, with a thorough understanding of transformers, tokenization, and encoding-decoding processes.
Apply Explainable AI (XAI) techniques using Python libraries such as SHAP, LIME, or similar tools.
Develop and integrate AI models into backend systems utilizing frameworks such as FastAPI, Flask, or Django.
Demonstrate logical and organized thinking with attention to detail, capable of identifying data or code anomalies and effectively communicating findings through clear documentation and well-commented code.
Maintain a proactive mindset for optimizing analytical workflows and continuously improving models and tools.
Exhibit creativity and innovation in problem-solving, with a practical and results-oriented approach.




Technical Requirements:

Demonstrated experience coding in python specifically working in data science projects and using ML most common libraries.
Previous experiences working with Generative AI and explainable AI are welcome.
Expertise in Power BI: data modeling, DAX, dashboards, integration with multiple sources.
Proficient in SQL for querying, transforming, optimizing databases.
Experienced in Python for data analysis, automation, machine learning.
Knowledgeable in data analytics, KPIs, business intelligence practices.
Skilled in translating business requirements into insights and visualizations.




Our current tech stack is:

Power BI (DAX)

HTML:
Data Analyst & Backend Developer with AI


The Digital Business Team develops promising digital solutions for global products and processes. It aims to organize Applus+ Laboratories' information, making it useful, fast, and reliable for both the Applus+ Group and its clients. The team‚Äôs mission is to be recognized as the most digital, innovative, and customer-oriented company, reducing digital operations costs while increasing the value and portfolio of services.


We are looking for a Data Science / AI Engineer to join our Digital team and contribute to the development of evolving data products and applications.


Responsibilities:

  • Collect, organize, and analyze structured and unstructured data to extract actionable insights, generate code, train models, validate results, and draw meaningful conclusions.
  • Demonstrate advanced proficiency in Power BI, including data modeling, DAX, the creation of interactive dashboards, and connecting to diverse data sources.
  • Possess a strong mathematical and statistical foundation, with experience in numerical methods and a wide range of machine learning algorithms.
  • Exhibit hands-on experience in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and foundation models, with a thorough understanding of transformers, tokenization, and encoding-decoding processes.
  • Apply Explainable AI (XAI) techniques using Python libraries such as SHAP, LIME, or similar tools.
  • Develop and integrate AI models into backend systems utilizing frameworks such as FastAPI, Flask, or Django.
  • Demonstrate logical and organized thinking with attention to detail, capable of identifying data or code anomalies and effectively communicating findings through clear documentation and well-commented code.
  • Maintain a proactive mindset for optimizing analytical workflows and continuously improving models and tools.
  • Exhibit creativity and innovation in problem-solving, with a practical and results-oriented approach.


Technical Requirements:

  • Demonstrated experience coding in python specifically working in data science projects and using ML most common libraries.
  • Previous experiences working with Generative AI and explainable AI are welcome.
  • Expertise in Power BI: data modeling, DAX, dashboards, integration with multiple sources.
  • Proficient in SQL for querying, transforming, optimizing databases.
  • Experienced in Python for data analysis, automation, machine learning.
  • Knowledgeable in data analytics, KPIs, business intelligence practices.
  • Skilled in translating business requirements into insights and visualizations.


Our current tech stack is:

  • Power BI (DAX)
  • SQL
  • Python
  • Commonly used ML/AI libraries.
  • Azure AI (Open AI)


Education

  • Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
  • A master‚Äôs degree in data science or AI Engineering is an advantage.


Languages

  • English


If you are passionate about analytics, advanced AI algorithms, and challenging yourself, this is the right job for you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client that is seeking a Data Analyst to support client initiatives. This role is onsite in Juno Beach, FL. Key Responsibilities: Technology Experience Score (TXS) Analytics:


Analyzing and monitoring TXS and its core metrics, aiming for a score of 90 by 2029
Use data from ServiceNow, Nexthink, and IT4U to identify trends and insights


Customer Experience Data Integration


Aggregating experience data across IT4U, Nexthink, ServiceNow, and surveys to build a comprehensive enterprise view
Supporting action prioritization through data-driven insights


IT4U Initiative Support

Engaging with monthly IT4U Influencer Forums and developing pertinent communications


Collaboration & Communication:


Working with service owners, analysts, engineers, and communication teams to translate data into impactful leadership-ready insights
Promoting a customer-first, data-driven culture within TSO teams


Requirements


3-5 years of experience in analytics, ITSM, or digital experience
Familiar with Power BI, Tableau, Excel, ServiceNow, Nexthink, and enterprise portals will be ideal
Strong communication and cross-functional collaboration skills are essential


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Air Apps

At Air Apps, we believe in thinking bigger‚Äîand moving faster. We‚Äôre a family-founded company on a mission to create the world‚Äôs first AI-powered Personal & Entrepreneurial Resource Planner (PRP), and we need your passion and ambition to help us change how people plan, work, and live. Born in Lisbon, Portugal in 2018‚Äîand now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco‚Äîwe‚Äôve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.

Our long-term focus drives us to challenge the status quo every day, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven solutions that truly make a difference. Here, you‚Äôll be a creative force, shaping products that empower people across the globe.

Join us on this journey to redefine resource management‚Äîand change lives along the way.

The Role

As a Data Analyst at Air Apps, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to drive business insights and optimize product performance. You will create reports, dashboards, and performance metrics to help teams make informed decisions and improve user experience.

This role requires a data-driven mindset, strong analytical skills, and experience with visualization tools to turn complex data into actionable insights.

Responsibilities


Analyze user behavior, product performance, and key business metrics to identify trends and opportunities.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or Google Data Studio.
Collect, clean, and structure large datasets to ensure accuracy and usability.
Define and track KPIs for marketing, product, and business performance.
Work with SQL, Python, or R to extract, analyze, and manipulate data.
Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and marketing teams to provide data-driven insights.
Conduct A/B testing and experiment analysis to improve product features and user engagement.
Identify bottlenecks and opportunities in user journeys and customer funnels.
Present findings in a clear and compelling way to stakeholders and leadership teams.
Stay up to date with industry trends, analytics best practices, and emerging data tools.


Requirements


Around 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Strong analytical skills with experience in Python or R for data analysis.
Knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis.
Experience with Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude, or similar user analytics tools.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data warehouses (BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake).
Familiarity with ETL processes and data pipeline optimization is a plus.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment and manage multiple projects.


What benefits are we offering?


Apple hardware ecosystem for work.
Annual Bonus.
Medical Insurance (including vision & dental).
Disability insurance - short and long-term.
401k up to 4% contribution.
Air Stipend of $3,120/year, paid over 12 monthly installments (for home office, learning, wellness, etc.).
Air Conference ‚Äì an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together.


Diversity & Inclusion

At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.

Application Disclaimer

At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Talint's client, a management consulting firm providing innovative solutions and best practices to government and commercial organizations, received the Best Places to Work in Greater Washington by the #WashingtonBusinessJournal for the sixth year in a row.







Our client has an opening for a Jr Data Analyst. This position will support the Army‚Äôs annual Program Objective Memorandum (POM) planning, POM build, and Program budget review. The right candidate will have at least three years of data analysis, data science, and/or data engineering. DataBricks experience is preferred! This position requires a DoD Secret Clearance or higher. This role is hybrid with three to four days a week at Fort Belvoir, VA. It‚Äôs possible this role transitions to full-time in the office.







Desired Skills and Experience:

Active DoD Secret Clearance (required)
3‚Äì6 years of relevant experience with data pipelines and reporting systems
Strong experience in SQL, Power BI, and DataBricks
Familiarity with financial planning, POM processes, or federal data systems
Ability to analyze business needs and translate into data models and tools
Excellent analytical, communication, and documentation skills




Why our client?

Competitive total compensation and benefits package that includes health, retirement, and paid time-off
Our client fosters an open-door policy between employees and leadership to ensure direct lines of communication
Incredible opportunities for advancement as they continue to grow;
They understand the importance of striking a work/life balance and offers flexible schedules.







Responsibilities:

Assist in building and maintaining data pipelines supporting Army financial planning
Support development of SQL queries, Power BI dashboards, and automated reports
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver actionable insights
Support efforts to modernize legacy reporting tools
Work closely with senior data engineers and analysts to refine outputs
Ensure data accuracy and security across systems
Document processes and contribute to audit-readiness

Title: Data Analyst (Remote US)
Description:
About Us

At SimplePractice, our team is dedicated to improving the health and wellness industry by building a suite of innovative solutions for practitioners and their clients. Our product supports practitioners on their clinical journey to becoming licensed, helps them manage their business and practice once they‚Äôre up and running, and enables new clients to discover and interact with practitioners. Taking a practitioner-first approach in everything we do makes it possible for health and wellness practitioners to devote more time to their clients while they use SimplePractice to start, grow, and maintain a successful private practice.

The Role

As a Data Analyst, you‚Äôll play a key role in shaping our data-driven culture. Your day-to-day will blend technical problem-solving with strategic thinking‚Äîdeveloping metrics frameworks, optimizing reporting pipelines, and uncovering insights that guide Product, Design, Engineering and other key business areas. Using SQL, Tableau, and advanced analytics techniques, you‚Äôll transform raw data into actionable insights, empowering stakeholders with the clarity they need. You‚Äôll collaborate cross-functionally to define success, measure impact, and drive continuous improvement.

You‚Äôll have the opportunity to mentor others and foster a culture of innovation by using data to drive product enhancements and business improvements. Whether designing experiments, optimizing user experiences, or translating insights into action, your work will directly contribute to better business outcomes and customer experiences.

Responsibilities


Develop automated reports and dashboards to support product and business operations, ensuring data accessibility and efficiency.
Analyze complex datasets using SQL and Tableau to uncover trends, drive actionable insights, and influence product roadmaps and executive decisions.
Collaborate with Product, Engineering, and Design teams to deliver data-driven solutions that align with business goals.
Apply advanced analytics and statistical methods to identify key business trends and optimize decision-making.
Design and implement scalable data models that integrate multiple sources, ensuring accuracy, reliability, and accessibility.
Effectively communicate insights and analysis results to stakeholders across SimplePractice, highlighting opportunities to better serve both the business and its customers.
Mentor team members and act as a data subject matter expert, driving best practices in analytics and reporting.


Desired Skills & Experience


4 Plus years of experience in data analysis and analytics, with a proven track record of mentoring team members.
Advanced knowledge of data analysis tools and programming languages such as SQL and Python.
Experience building dashboards and visualizations in Tableau or similar BI tools.
Ability to interpret complex data using advanced analytics, such as predictive modeling, to forecast trends and optimize business outcomes.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey technical information to multiple stakeholders.
Proven ability to manage multiple projects and effectively collaborate with multiple stakeholders.
Enthusiastic about data and analytics, learning new techniques and skills, and working with data scientists and engineers.


Bonus Points


Experience with dbt Cloud or similar tools
Knowledge of ETL pipelines and data warehouse best practices
Knowledge of techniques such as regression analysis, hypothesis testing, and multivariate analysis.


Base Compensation Range

$155,000 - $190,000 annually

Base salary is one component of total compensation. Employees may also be eligible for an annual bonus or commission. Some roles may also be eligible for overtime pay.

The above represents the expected base compensation range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we‚Äôll consider many factors including, but not limited to, skills, experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors.

Benefits

We offer a competitive benefits program including:


Medical, dental, vision, life & disability insurance
401(k) plan with company match
Flexible Time Off (FTO), wellbeing days, paid holidays, and summer Fridays
Mental health resources
Paid parental leave & Backup Care
Tuition reimbursement
Employee Resource Groups (ERGs)


California Job Applicant Privacy Notice

Thank you for your interest in opportunities at SimplePractice LLC (‚ÄúSimplePractice‚Äù or ‚Äúus‚Äù or ‚Äúwe‚Äù or ‚Äúour‚Äù). Please note that when you submit your resume or application materials to us for employment purposes, you are subject to the SimplePractice California Job Applicant Privacy Notice.

For more information about our privacy practices, please contact us at privacy@simplepractice.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Stratacent is seeking Data Analyst who will be responsible for analysing enterprise application code written in SAS and Datastage to list out data base dependencies (DB2), within the application and report changes to the development team for modernizing the application to replace DB2 DB source into Snowflake.




Location: Mclean, VA (5 days onsite)




Responsibilities:




¬∑ Analysis of existing SAS and DataStage enterprise application code that extract data from DB2 Db and perform various transformations pertaining to business requirements.

¬∑ Working closely with business stake holders to identify all dependencies for the DB2 DB and provide requirements for development teams to rewrite application code to use Snowflake.

¬∑ Profile data for data quality, document data flow and mapping documents and business logic applied in DataStage jobs.




Required Skills:




¬∑ A minimum of bachelor's degree in mathematics, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field is required.

¬∑ Hands on knowledge in IBM datastage job development, debugging and optimization.

¬∑ Hands on knowledge with writing Base SAS code connecting to various RDBMS data sources.

¬∑ Be proficient SQL programming (i.e., use of SQL for analysing DB2 data),

¬∑ Ability to effectively communicate designs and decisions to peers, customers and management.




About Us Stratacent is an IT Managed Services firm, headquartered in Jersey City, NJ, with two global delivery centers and offices in New York City, India, London and Canada. We are a leading IT services provider focusing in Financial Services, Insurance, Healthcare and Life Sciences. We help our customers in their digital transformation journey and provide solutions around Cloud Services, Automation, Data and Analytics, Application Development, IT Service Management and Cyber Security. We have partnerships with AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform, Automation Anywhere, Snowflake and SAS. (To learn more: www.stratacent.com )




Benefits

¬∑ Health Insurance

¬∑ Vision Plan

¬∑ Dental Plan

¬∑ Health Saving Account (HSA)

¬∑ Paid Time Off and Vacations

¬∑ 401K Plan

¬∑ Continuous Learning Program




Stratacent is an equal opportunity employer. As such, to the extent defined by federal, state, and municipal law, Stratacent will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, age, sex, national origin, ancestry, handicap, or any other factor protected by law.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
Journey with us! Combine your career goals and sense of adventure by joining our incredible team of employees at Royal Caribbean Group. We are proud to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, and excellent career development opportunities, each offering unique ways to explore the world.

We are proud to be the vacation-industry leader with global brands ‚Äî including Royal Caribbean International, Celebrity Cruises and Silversea Cruises ‚Äî the most innovative fleet and private destinations, and the best people. Together, we are dedicated to turning the vacation of a lifetime into a lifetime of vacations for our guests.

Royal Caribbean Group‚Äôs Data Analytics and AI Team has an exciting career opportunity for a full time Business Intelligence Data Analyst reporting to the Senior Manager, Business Intelligence.

This is an in-person role in our headquarters in Miami, Florida.

Position Summary

As part of the Enterprise BI Solutions team, the BI Data Analyst will assist RCG business stakeholders and team members in developing end to end BI solutions, defining data requirements, and project scope. This role will also provide ongoing BI Solutions development and BI systems admin support as needed, ensuring development best practice and optimal performance. The analyst will also perform related duties including user access and workspace management. Additionally, they will contribute to targeted Enterprise BI development projects, providing ongoing support and enhancements to ensure that solutions remain effective and aligned with organizational goals. The analyst will participate and contribute to RCG‚Äôs BI Center of Excellence, by sharing best practices, provide user training, contribute to CoE communications and staying up to date and informed about emerging BI/AI trends.

Key Responsibilities


BI Report, Dashboard & Data Development: Assist internal stakeholders in understanding their BI and data needs, aligning priorities with business objectives. Support the development of dashboards, routine reports, automated reporting tools, ad-hoc reports, and critical business analytics essential for data-driven decision-making and insights.
Strategic Insights/Opportunities: Collaborate with business leaders and subject matter experts to identify opportunities where BI solutions can enhance strategic decision-making, improve revenue, reduce cost and streamline operations, as well as support the implementation of BI/Analytic solutions tailored to business needs.
Power BI Systems Administration: Assist BI Systems team with administration, supporting user access, security settings, and workspace management. Ensuring optimal performance and availability of Power BI reports and dashboards.
Power BI Development: Design, develop, and maintain Power BI reports, dashboards, and data models. Implement best practices for data visualization and report performance optimization.
Knowledge Sharing: Contribute to the BI CoE (Center of Excellence) by sharing knowledge, CoE communications contributions, developer/user training, and educating enterprise BI users on end-to-end BI development best practices. Assist in establishing and evolving enterprise-wide standards, methodologies, and maintaining the BI CoE knowledge base and BI community resources.
Innovation and Research: Stay informed about emerging trends and technologies in BI, AI, data analytics, and data integration. Support the recommendation of new strategies, systems, and tools to improve the organization‚Äôs capabilities, enhance knowledge bases, and improve BI platform performance.


Qualifications And Education


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Information Systems, Analytics, or a related field is preferred. Alternatively, relevant work experience will be considered.
2-4 years of experience in BI/Data dashboard and report development.
Familiarity with BI systems, data integration, and the development of BI/Data/Analytics Solutions.
Proficiency in BI platforms and related tools such as Power BI.
Experience in Power BI administration, including managing user access, security settings, and workspace management.
Familiarity with data integration & orchestration platforms such as Azure Data Factory or similar technologies.
Understanding of SQL development best practices using programming languages such as Oracle PL/SQL, Transact SQL, or Python.
Knowledge of BI systems architecture and database platforms, both on-premises and cloud-based (SaaS) platforms.
Ability to work well with non-technical business partners.
Good written and oral communication skills.
Ability to deliver results in a timely manner with consistency and precision.
Strong project and time management skills to successfully navigate multifaceted responsibilities.
Ability to work independently or as part of a collaborative team.


We know there's a lot to consider. As you go through the application process, our recruiters will be glad to provide guidance, and more relevant details to answer any additional questions. Thank you again for your interest in Royal Caribbean Group. We'll hope to see you onboard soon!

It is the policy of the Company to ensure equal employment and promotion opportunity to qualified candidates without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, sexuality, gender identity or expression, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Royal Caribbean Group and each of its subsidiaries prohibit and will not tolerate discrimination or harassment.
