Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Aescape is looking for a Data Analyst to be the founding member of our data team, our go-to expert to work directly with stakeholders to run experiments and help teams make critical business decisions with data. While we already have a working stack and tools in place you'll be responsible for defining our analytics strategy, investigating new AI tools and capabilities, and ensuring our metrics accurately reflect business performance. This is an amazing opportunity for you to develop our data practice along with your strategic analytics skills while working at the intersection of robotics, AI, and wellness. If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you!

This role is based onsite in NYC in our HQ

Aescape is the NY-based lifestyle robotics company redefining self-care.

Backed by $128MM in funding from investors like Valor Equity Partners (an early investor in Tesla and SpaceX), we launched the world‚Äôs first-to-market AI-powered robotic massage experience with Equinox in August 2024 and quickly went viral: WIRED, Fast Company, Popular Science, Sports Business Journal, Fortune, Vogue and Bloomberg are only some of the leading publications that have covered our technology, with celebs like Will Smith posting about us.

Since then, we‚Äôve announced partnerships with global industry leaders across hospitality, pro sports, corporate wellness, and luxury real estate ‚Äî with more on the horizon as we supercharge growth.

What You‚Äôll Do

As a Data Analyst at Aescape you will‚Ä¶


Serve as Aescape‚Äôs data expert, helping teams across the company deepen their understanding of metrics and analytics, turning business questions into actionable data.
Define, operate and scale our data infrastructure, establishing golden tables, metrics, and ensuring pipeline health, working with external vendors where needed.
Partner with product and marketing to design, plan and execute experiments and analyze results that drive strategic decisions.
Build automated reporting systems and self-service analytics components for common business queries, present to leadership when required.
Own KPI definition and reporting, surfacing trends and anomalies across the business.
Lead customer satisfaction measurement initiatives with product and engineering.
Create our AI/analytics roadmap and continuously optimize our data stack for scale.


What You‚Äôll Bring


Advanced SQL expertise and proven ability to transform sometimes messy or unstructured data into reliable, scalable systems.
Strong stakeholder management skills with ability to translate business requests into technical specifications, pushing back when appropriate.
Track record of building automated analytics solutions and reducing manual processes.
Experience with experimentation frameworks, A/B testing, and statistical analysis.
Strong communication skills to present complex data insights to non-technical audiences.
Ability to diagnose data issues quickly and a drive to continuously improve and automate.
Comfort working and making decisions with incomplete information.


Nice To Have


You have Python & Pandas experience for data analysis.
You‚Äôve experience building a data warehouse & analytics stack from the ground up.
You have expertise in statistical analysis and predictive modeling.


What‚Äôs In It For You


Join a trailblazing tech company anticipated to transform the massage industry.
The chance to make a difference with a product that empowers healthier and happier living.
Team culture driven by passion, ambition, empowerment, inclusion, curiosity, and fun!
We‚Äôll grow together ‚Äì your personal and professional growth are equally important.
An environment that empowers individuals, emboldens teams, and rewards achievement.
Early stage equity in a company led by serial entrepreneurs with multiple exits.
Free massages in SF, NY HQ and our Partner locations!
Medical, vision, and dental insurance covered by us.
401k with 4% company match.
Unlimited vacation, generous parental leave.
Working late? Dinner is on us.
Competitive pay + bonus + equity plan. The salary range for the role is $120,000-$150,000.


Begin Your Aescape Career Journey

At Aescape, we're on a mission to redefine self-care for a better world, and we're seeking trailblazers to join us on this journey. We're inspired by individuals who are passionate, driven, and eager to learn. We value diverse perspectives and resourceful, determined individuals who are committed to making a difference. At Aescape, we empower people to reach their full potential, just as our product empowers better living. If you're ready to innovate, create, and make a meaningful impact, we want you on our team.

YOUR JOURNEY. YOUR AESCAPE.

Title: Retail Operations Data Analyst
Description:
Meta is looking for a Reality Labs (RL) Retail Operations Data Analyst. This person will be responsible for planning, budgeting, communicating, building, maintaining, and reporting on all aspects as it relates to Channel Enablement Operations programs across all of our existing and future partners. There will be a retail operations focus that this role will require. This role plays an instrumental part in helping customers find, learn and experience Reality Labs products through physical retail. The primary role of the RL Retail Operations Data Analyst is to work with data and ensure data is managed with accuracy, accessibility and with visualization in mind. The role is impact, accuracy and organization oriented with the goal of defining functional processes. The RL Retail Operations Data Analyst must be have experience in a fast-paced environment, executing multiple projects at a time while working collaboratively and communicating clearly across teams.

Retail Operations Data Analyst Responsibilities:


Build processes for the retail organization based on business needs and requirements presented from the organization
Manage, maintain and visualize large volumes of data from multiple sources globally using Tableau
Partner closely with Channel Marketing Managers, Strategic Account Managers, 3rd party labor partners, Analytics and Channel Services team members on a regular basis to run the business with the utmost efficiency and accuracy
Act as liaison between global 3rd party labor partners, channel marketing managers and channel services for data management
Assess and make calculated decisions to maximize return on investment and efficiency by leveraging partnerships with the internal analytics team
Build highly detailed analysis recommendations for a variety of Reality Labs initiatives across all product lines
Create, maintain, and enforce in-store data collection processes with 3rd party labor partners
Review instructions and execution for multiple projects simultaneously with a keen eye for detail
Manage field execution reporting to internal stakeholders via dashboards
Develop and launch key performance indicator management tools and dashboard by managing engineering resources


Minimum Qualifications:


5+ years of professional experience designing, building and managing data visualizations
3+ years of retail operations, channel marketing analytics or relevant experience
Experience with Tableau, PowerBi, Alteryx, Hive and other data visualization and customization tools
Experience managing data pipelines and ingestion processes
Experience understanding the unique operating conditions within retailers and how that impacts the planning and executing of the initiatives for all product lines
Experience sharing program/project updates across broad teams and organizations
Experience Creating/Managing Data Visualization
Extremely high level of accuracy and attention to detail with the experience to track and communicate the intricacies of reporting results for project execution
Experience managing relationships with cross-functional stakeholders and external vendors
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Economics, Statistics, or Data Science)


Preferred Qualifications:


Microsoft and Google Suite expert proficiency
Experience translating complex engineering and data related items to make them understandable by the lowest common denominator.
Consumer Electronics experience.
Familiarity with retail partners and their guidelines and processes.
Experience in reporting on large-scale launches and programs.
Experience with AI enhanced Data Modeling and Analysis
Experience within a brand managing analysis and budgets.
Understanding of SQL subqueries, statements, join types, window functions, common
Tableau Certified Data Analyst preferred
Experience in working in a highly cross-functional setting.


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today‚Äîbeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$104,000/year to $149,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Data Analyst, TechOps Business Performance
Description:
United States, Georgia, Atlanta

TechOps

17-Jul-2025

Ref #: 29071

LinkedIn Tag: LI-TB1

How you'll help us Keep Climbing (overview & key responsibilities)

The Business Performance Analytics team is responsible for providing powerful and insightful metrics, dashboards, and reports to our customers in the Component & Engine Maintenance and MRO teams. We‚Äôre seeking an experienced pipeline-centric data engineer to work with existing data layers and to create and support a data platform utilizing the latest technologies such as SAS, Python, AWS, MS SQL, etc. Ideally, candidates will wear many hats in the role, but much of the focus will be on building out our ETL processes utilizing SAS/Python, writing SQL, and working with API. Beyond technical prowess, the data engineer will need soft skills for clearly communicating highly complex data trends to organizational leaders. We‚Äôre looking for someone willing to jump right in and help the company get the most from its data.

Key Job Functions

Provide lead Data expertise in the creation and enhancement of decision support systems for the MRO Business Performance team. Leverages emerging technologies and identifies efficient and meaningful ways to communicate data and analysis to satisfy divisional needs. Leads inter/intra-departmental initiatives that improve usability of data and end-user satisfaction. Demonstrated ability to think tactically and strategically to improve the quality and efficiency of existing processes. Develop dynamic automated processes that create reports, metrics, and scorecards. Candidate success will depend on


Working with data to solve business problems, building and maintaining the infrastructure to answer questions, and improve processes
Help streamline our ETL workflows, adding value to our product offerings and building out the customer lifecycle and retention models
Utilize Tableau to provide data visualization
Collaborate and develop data models and pipelines for research, reporting, and machine learning
Be an advocate for best practices and continued learning
Represent the team in interactions with other TechOps business units.
Practices safety-conscious behaviors in all operational processes and procedures.


Benefits and Perks to Help You Keep Climbing

WHY YOU‚ÄôLL LOVE DELTA!

Benefits

Our culture is rooted in a shared dedication to living our values ‚Äì Care, Integrity, Resilience, Servant Leadership, and Teamwork ‚Äì every day, in everything we do. At Delta, our people are our success. At the heart of what we offer is our focus on Sharing Success with Delta employees. Exploring a career at Delta gives you a chance to see the world while earning great compensation and benefits to help you keep climbing along the way:


Competitive salary, industry-leading proÔ¨Åt sharing program, and performance incentives
401(k) with generous company contributions up to 9%
Paid time off including vacation, holidays, paid personal time, maternity and parental leave
Comprehensive health beneÔ¨Åts including medical, dental, vision, short/long term disability and life beneÔ¨Åts
Family care assistance through fertility support, surrogacy and adoption assistance, lactation support, subsidized back-up care, and programs that help with loved ones in all stages
Holistic Wellbeing programs to support physical, emotional, social, and financial health, including access to an employee assistance program offering support for you and anyone in your household, free financial coaching, and extensive resources supporting mental health
Domestic and International space-available flight privileges for employees and eligible family members
Career development programs to achieve your long-term career goals
World-wide partnerships to engage in community service and innovative goals created to focus on sustainability and reducing our carbon footprint
Business Resource Groups created to connect employees with common interests to promote inclusion, provide perspective and help implement strategies
Recognition rewards and awards through the platform Unstoppable Together
Access to over 500 discounts, specialty savings and voluntary benefits through Deltaperks such as car and hotel rentals and auto, home, and pet insurance, legal services, and childcare


What You Need To Succeed (minimum Qualifications)


Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) preferred or at least seven years of technical experience in analytics, business intelligence tools.
Understanding of TechOps and the MRO industry.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional projects.
Ability to solve problems at both conceptual and practical levels.
Must be a self-starter able to work in a team environment as well as on individual efforts.
Strong interpersonal, negotiation, and time management skills.
Exceptional analytical skills.
Strong customer focus (internal and external).
Advanced skills in SAS, Python, AWS, Palantir, Alteryx, Tableau, SQL, Databases such as Teradata and SQL Server
Must be performing satisfactorily in present position.
Consistently prioritizes safety and security of self, others, and personal data.
Embraces a diverse set of people, thinking and styles.
Possesses a high school diploma, GED, or high school equivalency.
Is at least 18 years of age and has authorization to work in the United States.


What Will Give You a Competitive Edge (preferred Qualifications)


Experience with MS Excel, PowerPoint, Word, MS Access, SAP, and Hyperion is preferred.

The Business Performance Analytics team is responsible for providing powerful and insightful metrics, dashboards, and reports to our customers in the Component & Engine Maintenance and MRO teams. We‚Äôre seeking an experienced pipeline-centric data engineer to work with existing data layers and to create and support a data platform utilizing the latest technologies such as SAS, Python, AWS, MS SQL, etc. Ideally, candidates will wear many hats in the role, but much of the focus will be on building out our ETL processes utilizing SAS/Python, writing SQL, and working with API. Beyond technical prowess, the data engineer will need soft skills for clearly communicating highly complex data trends to organizational leaders. We‚Äôre looking for someone willing to jump right in and help the company get the most from its data.

Key Job Functions

Provide lead Data expertise in the creation and enhancement of decision support systems for the MRO Business Performance team. Leverages emerging technologies and identifies efficient and meaningful ways to communicate data and analysis to satisfy divisional needs. Leads inter/intra-departmental initiatives that improve usability of data and end-user satisfaction. Demonstrated ability to think tactically and strategically to improve the quality and efficiency of existing processes. Develop dynamic automated processes that create reports, metrics, and scorecards. Candidate success will depend on

  • Working with data to solve business problems, building and maintaining the infrastructure to answer questions, and improve processes
  • Help streamline our ETL workflows, adding value to our product offerings and building out the customer lifecycle and retention models
  • Utilize Tableau to provide data visualization
  • Collaborate and develop data models and pipelines for research, reporting, and machine learning
  • Be an advocate for best practices and continued learning
  • Represent the team in interactions with other TechOps business units.
  • Practices safety-conscious behaviors in all operational processes and procedures.

Benefits and Perks to Help You Keep Climbing

WHY YOU‚ÄôLL LOVE DELTA!

Benefits

Our culture is rooted in a shared dedication to living our values ‚Äì Care, Integrity, Resilience, Servant Leadership, and Teamwork ‚Äì every day, in everything we do. At Delta, our people are our success. At the heart of what we offer is our focus on Sharing Success with Delta employees. Exploring a career at Delta gives you a chance to see the world while earning great compensation and benefits to help you keep climbing along the way:

  • Competitive salary, industry-leading proÔ¨Åt sharing program, and performance incentives
  • 401(k) with generous company contributions up to 9%
  • Paid time off including vacation, holidays, paid personal time, maternity and parental leave
  • Comprehensive health beneÔ¨Åts including medical, dental, vision, short/long term disability and life beneÔ¨Åts
  • Family care assistance through fertility support, surrogacy and adoption assistance, lactation support, subsidized back-up care, and programs that help with loved ones in all stages
  • Holistic Wellbeing programs to support physical, emotional, social, and financial health, including access to an employee assistance program offering support for you and anyone in your household, free financial coaching, and extensive resources supporting mental health
  • Domestic and International space-available flight privileges for employees and eligible family members
  • Career development programs to achieve your long-term career goals
  • World-wide partnerships to engage in community service and innovative goals created to focus on sustainability and reducing our carbon footprint
  • Business Resource Groups created to connect employees with common interests to promote inclusion, provide perspective and help implement strategies
  • Recognition rewards and awards through the platform Unstoppable Together
  • Access to over 500 discounts, specialty savings and voluntary benefits through Deltaperks such as car and hotel rentals and auto, home, and pet insurance, legal services, and childcare

What You Need To Succeed (minimum Qualifications)

  • Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) preferred or at least seven years of technical experience in analytics, business intelligence tools.
  • Understanding of TechOps and the MRO industry.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional projects.
  • Ability to solve problems at both conceptual and practical levels.
  • Must be a self-starter able to work in a team environment as well as on individual efforts.
  • Strong interpersonal, negotiation, and time management skills.
  • Exceptional analytical skills.
  • Strong customer focus (internal and external).
  • Advanced skills in SAS, Python, AWS, Palantir, Alteryx, Tableau, SQL, Databases such as Teradata and SQL Server
  • Must be performing satisfactorily in present position.
  • Consistently prioritizes safety and security of self, others, and personal data.
  • Embraces a diverse set of people, thinking and styles.
  • Possesses a high school diploma, GED, or high school equivalency.
  • Is at least 18 years of age and has authorization to work in the United States.

What Will Give You a Competitive Edge (preferred Qualifications)

  • Experience with MS Excel, PowerPoint, Word, MS Access, SAP, and Hyperion is preferred.

Title: Data Analyst (contract)
Description:
Data Analyst (Contract)

Please note that this is a contract role providing services to Microsoft through external staffing partners of Allegis Global Solutions. If you are selected for this role, you will be employed by AGS and will not be an employee of Microsoft.

Summary

The team is seeking for a skilled and detail-oriented professional where you will play a crucial role in supporting digital marketing efforts through data analysis. This position focuses on analyzing marketing campaign performance, particularly in the realm of email marketing, and involves setting up measurement and tracking systems. You will be responsible for researching audience segments, conducting in-depth analyses, and presenting insights that drive strategic decisions. If you have a passion for data and storytelling, this is an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact on our marketing initiatives.

Job Responsibilities


Analyze marketing campaign performance and prepare comprehensive reports with actionable insights.
Conduct in-depth ad hoc analysis to uncover audience behaviors and performance drivers across email campaigns.
Research data sources to define campaign audiences and contribute to the planning phase before launches.
Collaborate with marketing, product, analytics, and engineering teams to align on data requirements and targeting strategies.
Prepare data presentations and communicate complex analysis results effectively to stakeholders.
Derive meaningful business insights by exploring large datasets and identifying patterns for optimization opportunities.
Support the implementation of new data measurement techniques for retention and engagement emails.


Requirements


5-7 years of overall experience in data analytics or related fields.
A degree in computer science, marketing, statistics, or a field related to data analytics is required.
Strong communication skills to present complex data clearly to stakeholders.
Proficiency in data storytelling to convey insights from data effectively.
Excellent collaboration skills for working with cross-functional teams during campaign planning.
Attention to detail for accurate analysis, reporting, and audience research.
Advanced Excel skills including data manipulation, formulas, pivot tables, and statistical analysis.


Additional Details


Location: Remote
Duration: 11 Months
Pay Range: $50 - 56.50 per hour
Weekly Schedule: 40 hours


AGS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer (M/F/Disability/Veterans). We will consider all applications without regard to race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Ascendion:

Ascendion is a full-service digital engineering solutions company. We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees. Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation and impact for enterprise clients. Headquartered in New Jersey, our workforce of 6,000+ Ascenders delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is built differently to engineer the next. Ascendion | Engineering to elevate life




We have a culture built on opportunity, inclusion, and a spirit of partnership. Come, change the world with us:

Build the coolest tech for world‚Äôs leading brands

Solve complex problems ‚Äì and learn new skills

Experience the power of transforming digital engineering for Fortune 500 clients

Master your craft with leading training programs and hands-on experience




Experience a community of change makers!

Join a culture of high-performing innovators with endless ideas and a passion for tech. Our culture is the fabric of our company, and it is what makes us unique and diverse. The way we share ideas, learning, experiences, successes, and joy allows everyone to be their best at Ascendion.




About the Role:

Job Title: Data Analytics Engineer




Location: Remote




Key Responsibilities:

Design, write, and optimize complex SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and analysis using Oracle or other RDBMS.
Perform data enrichment and normalization to ensure high-quality, clean, and usable data for downstream analysis and reporting.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into scalable data solutions and reports.
Conduct root cause analysis on data issues and anomalies.
Develop, maintain, and publish accurate and insightful reports, dashboards, and ad-hoc analysis as needed.
Ensure data integrity, completeness, and consistency through systematic validation and auditing.
Proactively identify opportunities for data-driven insights and process improvements.
Work independently and take ownership of tasks from requirement gathering to delivery.




Minimum Qualifications:

5+ years of experience in SQL development and working with Oracle or similar RDBMS.
Proven experience with writing and optimizing complex, large-scale SQL queries.
Deep understanding of data enrichment, normalization, and standard data practices.
Excellent attention to detail with a track record of producing high-quality analytical work.
Strong communication skills (written and verbal) and experience with report writing and presentation to stakeholders.
Proactive, self-driven individual with strong problem-solving skills and a commitment to continuous improvement.
Working knowledge or experience in BSA/AML compliance, fraud detection, or risk analytics.




Salary Range: The salary for this position is between $110,000 ‚Äì $120,000 annually. Factors which may affect pay within this range may include geography/market, skills, education, experience, and other qualifications of the successful candidate.




This position is eligible for commissions in accordance with the terms of the Company‚Äôs plan. Commissions for this position are estimated to be based on individual performance. Additionally, this role is also eligible for bonus based on achievement of mutually agreed KRAs.




Benefits: The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: [medical insurance] [dental insurance] [vision insurance] [401(k) retirement plan] [long-term disability insurance] [short-term disability insurance] [personal days accrued each calendar year. The Paid time off benefits meet the paid sick and safe time laws that pertains to the City/ State] [12-15 days of paid vacation time] [6-8 weeks of paid parental leave after a year of service] [9 paid holidays and 2 floating holidays per calendar year] [Ascendion Learning Management System] [Tuition Reimbursement Program]




Want to change the world? Let us know.

Tell us about your experiences, education, and ambitions. Bring your knowledge, unique viewpoint, and creativity to the table. Let‚Äôs talk!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst with a desire to excel? If so, then Talent Software Services may have the job for you! Our client is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to work at their company in Redmond, WA.




Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities:

Purpose of the Team: The main function of a Data Analyst is to support digital marketers by analyzing marketing campaign performance and impact. This includes supporting campaign setup for measurement and tracking, as well as researching and defining audience segments for emails.

Key Projects:
This role will support one line of business with a heavy focus on email. The team is initiating a project for new data measurement techniques for retention and engagement emails.
Campaign Analysis and Reporting: Analyze campaign performance and prepare reports, including generating insights and data storytelling for presentations.
Audience Research and Targeting: Research data sources to define campaign audiences, contributing to the planning phase before campaign launches.
Data Preparation and Presentation: Prepare data, create presentations, and communicate complex analysis results to stakeholders.

Typical Task Breakdown and Operating Rhythm: The role will consist of 60% data analysis, 20% meetings, and 20% preparing for presentations, communications, and updating preliminary data.

Conduct in-depth ad hoc analysis to uncover audience behaviors, performance drivers, and opportunities for optimization across email campaigns.
Perform research to support the creation and refinement of personalized targeting signals using cross-channel data sources.
Collaborate with marketing, product, analytics, and engineering teams to align on data requirements, insights, and targeting strategies.
Derive meaningful business insights by exploring large datasets, identifying patterns, and translating findings into actionable targeting opportunities.




Qualifications:

Minimum 5 years experience with PowerPoint (Ability to create clear, effective presentations to communicate data analysis findings)
Minimum 2-3 years experience with Power BI and Adobe Analytics (for data analysis and reporting)
Minimum 5 years experience with advanced Excel (data manipulation, formulas, pivot tables, some statistical analysis)
Previous experience with Ads platforms is a plus.
Strong Communication: Ability to clearly present and explain complex data and analysis results to stakeholders is essential.
Data Storytelling: Skill in preparing presentations and conveying insights from data in an understandable way.
Collaboration: Work with marketers and other team members during campaign planning and results presentation.
Attention to Detail: Required for accurate analysis, reporting, and audience research.
Knowledge of data is part of the planning phase before campaign launch.
Performance Indicators: Performance will be assessed based on the delivery of results on a monthly basis, ability to lead presentations and meet deadlines, collaboration, and responsiveness with the team.
Years of Experience Required: 5-7 years of experience in the field.
Degrees or Certifications Required: A degree in computer science, marketing, statistics, or a related field in data analytics is required.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Commercial Data Analyst

Company: XponentL Data, Inc.




Overview:

We are seeking a key individual to bridge the gap between commercial operations and advanced data solutions. In this pivotal role, you will leverage your expertise in data integration, manipulation, and visualization to enhance our pharmaceutical commercial strategies, support product launches, and enable next-generation analytics capabilities. If you thrive on collaborating with diverse stakeholders, solving intricate data challenges with tools like SQL and Python, and driving business impact through robust data solutions, this opportunity is for you.




Key Responsibilities:




Drive Commercial Operations: Partner closely with business stakeholders to translate their commercial visions into actionable data strategies, proactively developing and enhancing critical reports, data integrations, and data management processes.
Master Pharmaceutical Data: Lead the end-to-end process of data validation, integration, and manipulation for diverse pharmaceutical commercial data sources, including national and HCP-level sales (IQVIA/Symphony), call and sample data, and promotional insights. You'll leverage SQL for advanced querying and Python (or similar scripting languages) to automate data pipelines and streamline extraction efforts.
Deliver Actionable Insights: Design, create, and maintain dynamic Power BI dashboards and executive-ready Excel reports. Your ability to transform complex datasets into clear, compelling, and actionable insights will directly empower marketing and sales leadership.
Ensure Data Integrity: Champion data integrity and accuracy by establishing and rigorously enforcing robust data governance practices and comprehensive data quality controls across all commercial datasets.
Bridge Business & Technology: Serve as the critical liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams (including data engineering and IT), ensuring seamless alignment on data strategy, key performance indicators (KPIs), and solution architecture.
Influence Commercial Strategy: Conduct in-depth analysis of pharmaceutical sales performance, prescriber behavior, and intricate market data. Your insights will directly influence commercial strategy, optimize field deployment, and provide vital support for successful new drug launches.




Qualifications:

7+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, Business Analyst, or Consultant with a strong focus on commercial data and analytics within the Pharmaceutical or Life Sciences industry.
Deep expertise and hands-on experience with key pharmaceutical commercial data sources (e.g., IQVIA Xponent, DDD, Symphony, Veeva CRM, Salesforce, 867/852/849, Payer Data, ICS, MMIT).
Expert-level proficiency in complex SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis.
Strong experience with Python or other scripting languages for data integration, automation, and data processing.
Expert-level skills in Power BI and Microsoft Excel (PivotTables, VLOOKUP) for report and dashboard creation.
Familiarity with database concepts and cloud data environments (e.g., AWS Redshift, SQL Server).
Understanding of data migration, data integration, and data warehousing principles.
Exceptional analytical skills to identify trends, interpret complex data, and translate findings into clear, actionable business recommendations.
Proven ability to manage cross-functional initiatives, communicate effectively with leadership, and drive project execution.
Detail-oriented with a proactive approach to identifying inefficiencies and developing streamlined solutions.

Job Summary:

Aaratech Inc is seeking a highly analytical and detail-driven Data Analyst to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for transforming raw data into actionable insights that influence strategic decisions and improve operational performance. If you enjoy working with large data sets, creating impactful visualizations, and collaborating across departments, we want to hear from you!

üîπ Team Collaboration

üîπ Tool Utilization

Leverage tools like SQL, Excel, and BI platforms for analysis and reporting.

üîπ Data Governance

Contribute to the implementation of data governance and best practices for long-term data integrity.

‚úÖ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field

‚úÖ Minimum of 2 years of experience in a data analysis or similar role

‚úÖ Proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Excel

‚úÖ Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI

‚úÖ Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking abilities

‚úÖ Excellent written and verbal communication skills

‚úÖ Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Essential Functions


Collaborate with Product and Analytics teams to use a combination of exploratory and descriptive analytics to inform product strategy and roadmap, and provide ad-hoc analyses that uncover root cause of recent business trends.
Understand data infrastructure and coordinate with Data Engineering to deliver data models and structures to meet business demands.
Assist in the design of relevant data models, including outlining dimensions and measures needed, for answering business questions.
Establish and implement product data standards and best practices in order to optimize the data collection, fidelity and accuracy. Develop product measurement plans and dashboards to monitor metrics and KPIs.
Support Sales in deploying and documenting internal dashboards and reporting.
Ensure optimization and validations initiatives are implemented, tracked and reviewed postproduction.
Shape, explore and publish data for business analysis or stakeholder initiatives using core Business Intelligence (BI) tools.
Other duties as assigned.


Minimum Qualifications


3+ years of experience in using data and analytics to drive business decisions, preferably in a sales or commercial setting.
Experience with cloud-based data warehouses (e.g., AWS Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery).
Advanced SQL concepts including joins, CTEs, case statements, stored procedures, data writing, window functions, etc.
Experience building and maintaining Tableau dashboards and reports for business stakeholders.
Experience with working with and optimizing data ELT/ETL processes.
Ability to translate technical data into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders (e.g., sales rep, managers).
Experience with creating ad-hoc reports based on business questions and requirements.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with shifting priorities and quick turnaround requests.


Preferred Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
Experience with SalesForce (or other CRM systems) and its data.
Experience with sales KPIs and reporting metrics (e.g., win/loss rates, conversion %).
Experience with creating or modifying database tables to support reporting.
Experience with Python, R, or VBA (e.g., automating report refreshes, data quality checks).
Experience with scheduling/report automation tools like (e.g., Airflow, Redwood, Tableau Server scheduling).
Strong Excel skills for quick ad-hoc data analysis, validation, or visualization.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Part-Time Data Engineer (San Francisco Bay Area Only)

Local Candidates Only | No Third-Party Agencies | No Visa Sponsorship Available

We are seeking a Part-Time Data Engineer to join a cutting-edge team focused on AI innovation in the pharmaceutical industry. This is a 20-hour-per-week contract position. Candidates can choose to work either 4 hours per day across 5 days or 5 hours per day across 4 days.

Please Note:

Only candidates currently residing in the San Francisco Bay Area will be considered.
We are not working with third-party agencies.
Visa sponsorship is not available for this role.
Candidates with more than 5 years of professional experience will not be considered.

About the Team: AI Emerging Tech & External Collaborations

You ll be joining a strategic innovation team driving the adoption of AI-enabled solutions and next-generation technologies to support our Pharma and DIA Partnering functions. Our focus is on building scalable data infrastructure, integrating external research capabilities, and enabling end-to-end AI workflows to accelerate decision-making and unlock real business value.

From collaborating with external research partners to shaping internal AI strategy, this is a unique opportunity to help define how data and AI transform a global organization.

Role Overview

As a Data Engineer, you will play a key role in architecting, building, and maintaining robust data systems that support machine learning and advanced analytics. You ll collaborate closely with data scientists, business stakeholders, and external collaborators to develop clean, accessible, and well-modeled datasets essential for AI innovation.

Key Responsibilities

Design & Build Scalable Data Pipelines: Develop and maintain pipelines for ingesting, transforming, and curating structured and unstructured data.
Data Profiling & Standardization: Analyze and align data sources, identify quality issues, and define models to support AI/ML use cases.
Data Product & API Development: Build reusable, secure data assets and APIs for analytics and machine learning workloads.
Infrastructure Architecture: Help design and implement scalable data platforms, including AWS-based data hubs.
AI/ML Integration: Ensure data solutions support downstream AI applications, including LLMs and AI agents.
Metadata & Governance: Embed data governance, lineage, and metadata practices into all solutions.
Monitoring Frameworks: Develop real-time data monitoring and alert systems.
Workflow Orchestration: Manage containerized workloads (e.g., Docker) and use orchestration tools like Amazon EKS or Google Agent Development Kit (ADK).
Continuous Improvement: Evaluate and refine data tools, processes, and platforms for performance and scalability.




Required Qualifications

Bachelor s or Master s degree in Computer Engineering, Data Science, or a related field
3 5 years of professional experience as a Data Engineer in an enterprise environment
Strong proficiency in Python
Experience with AI/ML data pipelines
Knowledge of data governance and metadata management best practices
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for an exciting opportunity working for a Global Technology Leader?

At Aviat Networks, we take great pride in hiring a workforce that is committed to supporting and strengthening our values and attributes. If you are a results-oriented, customer centric and innovative thinker who also takes pride in personal and professional integrity, Aviat Networks is the ideal next step in your career. We are looking for people who love to solve problems, enjoy change, and know how to have fun so come and join a dynamic team that strives to bring communications to the world.

Aviat Networks is the world‚Äôs largest independent supplier of wireless transmission systems. We are recognized worldwide for cutting-edge 5G, backhaul, networking solutions and services. Customers in more than 135 countries depend on Aviat Networks to build, expand, and upgrade their voice, data, and video solutions.

About the Role: We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our growing analytics team. The ideal candidate has a passion for data, a solid analytical mindset, and foundational skills in programming and statistics. You will work closely with senior team members to gather, clean, analyze, and visualize data to support business decision-making and strategic initiatives.

Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and organize data from various sources (databases, APIs, CSVs, etc.)
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies
Assist in building and maintaining reports and dashboards to communicate findings to stakeholders
Create simple data visualizations to support reports and presentations
Support senior analysts or data scientists in designing and testing predictive models
Document processes and contribute to the development of data pipelines
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineering, marketing, product) to understand data needs
Work under guidance to help answer business questions using data
Document your work and follow best practices in data handling
Stay up to date on industry trends and emerging technologies in data analytics
provide mentorship and training to foster skill development within the team.
Other duties as assigned.


Qualifications & Competencies


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in data science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field
Proficiency in Excel, Python or R for data analysis
Working knowledge of SQL for querying relational databases.
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib/seaborn
Understanding of basic statistical concepts and data modeling and machine learning concepts
Internship or academic project experience in data analysis or data science
Exposure to cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure)
Experience with version control (e.g., Git)
Strong analytical, problem-solving skills and communication skills with a bias for action
Eagerness to learn and grow in a fast-paced, data-driven environment
Good project management experience, including the ability to prioritize and manage multiple initiatives across teams.
Good communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and provide clear reporting to senior management.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, demonstrating resilience and adaptability in a constantly evolving network landscape.


We encourage you to read our Candidate Privacy Notice. You have the right to withdraw your consent at any time. To do this you can email us at privacy@aviatnet.com.

Aviat Networks provides equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. The Company does not discriminate against applicants or employees on the basis of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran or military status, disability or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state or local law.

Aviat Networks offers a competitive benefits package. Apply NOW to learn

For positions in California, Colorado, or New York City you may contact us at human.resources@aviatnet.com for the salary range for this position (include the exact Job Title as it reads above)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At T-Mobile, we invest in YOU! Our Total Rewards Package ensures that employees get the same big love we give our customers. All team members receive a competitive base salary and compensation package - this is Total Rewards. Employees enjoy multiple wealth-building opportunities through our annual stock grant, employee stock purchase plan, 401(k), and access to free, year-round money coaches. That‚Äôs how we‚Äôre UNSTOPPABLE for our employees!

** This is not a remote position. T-Mobile is a hybrid work environment requiring work in the office three (3) days per week. The successful candidate will be located in the greater Seattle, Washington area.**


Job Overview

The data analyst is responsible for analyzing business requirements and converting them into data requirements such as reports, visualizations, and data lifecycle management. They will analyze and interpret complex data sets to inform business decisions.

Job Responsibilities:


Collaborate with Business SMEs, Product owners, Data Stewards, and Data Architects to identify critical data elements, define business terms, capture metadata, define data schema, clean, and prepare data in an appropriate format to perform analysis. Analyze data using statistical techniques to identify trends and patterns (e.g. growth/decline in key metrics) and create visualizations and reports to present findings to business stakeholders and/or data scientists for further actions.
Perform data profiling, assess, and monitor the quality of data by working with the Data stewards, Data quality leads, and internal stakeholders and support the implementation of data quality rules and remediation of issues.
Collaborate/Partner with product owner and agile delivery teams to ensure that the project/product is delivered with quality and in time.
Interpret data models (Logical and Physical) and ensuring they align with the solution design. Convert user requirements into technical specifications and design documents, and identifying new data sources for the data warehouse.
Also responsible for other Duties/Projects as assigned by business management as needed.



Education and Work Experience:


Bachelor's Degree (Required)
2-4 years Experience in data identification, querying, cleaning, wrangling, checking quality, working with common relational and non-relational databases in big data environments on both on- prem and cloud such as Azure, AWS and Google Cloud. Required
2-4 years Experience articulating and translating business questions and using statistical techniques to arrive at an answer using data. Required
2-4 years Experience writing and speaking about technical concepts to business, technical, and lay audiences and giving data-driven presentations Required
2-4 years Experience working with relational databases using SQL Required
2-4 years Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau etc Required
2-4 years Experience with big data architecture and pipeline, such as Hadoop, Hive, Spark, and Kafka is a plus Preferred



Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


Technology Knowledge of relational databases and data architecture computer systems, including not limited to SQL (Required)
Technology Experience working with relational databases using SQL (Required)
Technology Experience with Data querying, cleaning, wrangling, working with common relational and non-relational databases in big data environments such as Azure, AWS and Google Cloud. (Required)
Technology Experience articulating and translating business questions and using statistical techniques to arrive at an answer using data (Required)
Technology Data Visualization skills using tools such as PowerBI, Tableau etc (Required)
Communication Excellent presentation, communication, and organizational skills (Required)
Agile Familiarity with Agile Methodology (Required)
Problem Solving Strong analytical, critical-thinking skills with demonstrated ability analyze/synthesize‚ÄØdata and generate insights. (Required)



Licenses and Certifications:


Certified Analytics Professional (CAP) SnowPro Advanced: Data Analyst CompTIA Data Analytics Plus certification Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate (Preferred)
At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States



Travel:

Travel Required (Yes/No): Yes

DOT Regulated:

DOT Regulated Position (Yes/No): No

Safety Sensitive Position (Yes/No): No

Base Pay Range: $68,000 - $122,700

Corporate Bonus Target: 10%

The pay range above is the general base pay range for a successful candidate in the role. The successful candidate‚Äôs actual pay will be based on various factors, such as work location, qualifications, and experience, so the actual starting pay will vary within this range.

At T-Mobile, employees in regular, non-temporary roles are eligible for an annual bonus or periodic sales incentive or bonus, based on their role. Most Corporate employees are eligible for a year-end bonus based on company and/or individual performance and which is set at a percentage of the employee‚Äôs eligible earnings in the prior year. Certain positions in Customer Care are eligible for monthly bonuses based on individual and/or team performance. To find the pay range for this role based on hiring location, copy and paste this link into your browser: https://paylookup.t-mobile.com/paylookup?reqID=REQ326415

At T-Mobile, our benefits exemplify the spirit of One Team, Together! A big part of how we care for one another is working to ensure our benefits evolve to meet the needs of our team members. Full and part-time employees have access to the same benefits when eligible. We cover all of the bases, offering medical, dental and vision insurance, a flexible spending account, 401(k), employee stock grants, employee stock purchase plan, paid time off and up to 12 paid holidays - which total about 4 weeks for new full-time employees and about 2.5 weeks for new part-time employees annually - paid parental and family leave, family building benefits, back-up care, enhanced family support, childcare subsidy, tuition assistance, college coaching, short- and long-term disability, voluntary AD&D coverage, voluntary accident coverage, voluntary life insurance, voluntary disability insurance, and voluntary long-term care insurance. We don't stop there - eligible employees can also receive mobile service & home internet discounts, pet insurance, and access to commuter and transit programs! To learn about T-Mobile‚Äôs amazing benefits, check out www.t-mobilebenefits.com.

Never stop growing!

As part of the T-Mobile team, you know the Un-carrier doesn‚Äôt have a corporate ladder‚Äìit‚Äôs more like a jungle gym of possibilities! We love helping our employees grow in their careers, because it‚Äôs that shared drive to aim high that drives our business and our culture forward. By applying for this career opportunity, you‚Äôre living our values while investing in your career growth‚Äìand we applaud it. You‚Äôre unstoppable!

T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, religious affiliation, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination, retaliation or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with how we do business and will not be tolerated.

** This is not a remote position. T-Mobile is a hybrid work environment requiring work in the office three (3) days per week. The successful candidate will be located in the greater Seattle, Washington area.**


Job Overview

The data analyst is responsible for analyzing business requirements and converting them into data requirements such as reports, visualizations, and data lifecycle management. They will analyze and interpret complex data sets to inform business decisions.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with Business SMEs, Product owners, Data Stewards, and Data Architects to identify critical data elements, define business terms, capture metadata, define data schema, clean, and prepare data in an appropriate format to perform analysis. Analyze data using statistical techniques to identify trends and patterns (e.g. growth/decline in key metrics) and create visualizations and reports to present findings to business stakeholders and/or data scientists for further actions.
  • Perform data profiling, assess, and monitor the quality of data by working with the Data stewards, Data quality leads, and internal stakeholders and support the implementation of data quality rules and remediation of issues.
  • Collaborate/Partner with product owner and agile delivery teams to ensure that the project/product is delivered with quality and in time.
  • Interpret data models (Logical and Physical) and ensuring they align with the solution design. Convert user requirements into technical specifications and design documents, and identifying new data sources for the data warehouse.
  • Also responsible for other Duties/Projects as assigned by business management as needed.


Education and Work Experience:

  • Bachelor's Degree (Required)
  • 2-4 years Experience in data identification, querying, cleaning, wrangling, checking quality, working with common relational and non-relational databases in big data environments on both on- prem and cloud such as Azure, AWS and Google Cloud. Required
  • 2-4 years Experience articulating and translating business questions and using statistical techniques to arrive at an answer using data. Required
  • 2-4 years Experience writing and speaking about technical concepts to business, technical, and lay audiences and giving data-driven presentations Required
  • 2-4 years Experience working with relational databases using SQL Required
  • 2-4 years Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau etc Required
  • 2-4 years Experience with big data architecture and pipeline, such as Hadoop, Hive, Spark, and Kafka is a plus Preferred


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Technology Knowledge of relational databases and data architecture computer systems, including not limited to SQL (Required)
  • Technology Experience working with relational databases using SQL (Required)
  • Technology Experience with Data querying, cleaning, wrangling, working with common relational and non-relational databases in big data environments such as Azure, AWS and Google Cloud. (Required)
  • Technology Experience articulating and translating business questions and using statistical techniques to arrive at an answer using data (Required)
  • Technology Data Visualization skills using tools such as PowerBI, Tableau etc (Required)
  • Communication Excellent presentation, communication, and organizational skills (Required)
  • Agile Familiarity with Agile Methodology (Required)
  • Problem Solving Strong analytical, critical-thinking skills with demonstrated ability analyze/synthesize‚ÄØdata and generate insights. (Required)


Licenses and Certifications:

  • Certified Analytics Professional (CAP) SnowPro Advanced: Data Analyst CompTIA Data Analytics Plus certification Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate (Preferred)
  • At least 18 years of age
  • Legally authorized to work in the United States


Travel:

Travel Required (Yes/No): Yes

DOT Regulated:

DOT Regulated Position (Yes/No): No

Safety Sensitive Position (Yes/No): No

Base Pay Range: $68,000 - $122,700

Corporate Bonus Target: 10%

The pay range above is the general base pay range for a successful candidate in the role. The successful candidate‚Äôs actual pay will be based on various factors, such as work location, qualifications, and experience, so the actual starting pay will vary within this range.

At T-Mobile, employees in regular, non-temporary roles are eligible for an annual bonus or periodic sales incentive or bonus, based on their role. Most Corporate employees are eligible for a year-end bonus based on company and/or individual performance and which is set at a percentage of the employee‚Äôs eligible earnings in the prior year. Certain positions in Customer Care are eligible for monthly bonuses based on individual and/or team performance. To find the pay range for this role based on hiring location, copy and paste this link into your browser: https://paylookup.t-mobile.com/paylookup?reqID=REQ326415

At T-Mobile, our benefits exemplify the spirit of One Team, Together! A big part of how we care for one another is working to ensure our benefits evolve to meet the needs of our team members. Full and part-time employees have access to the same benefits when eligible. We cover all of the bases, offering medical, dental and vision insurance, a flexible spending account, 401(k), employee stock grants, employee stock purchase plan, paid time off and up to 12 paid holidays - which total about 4 weeks for new full-time employees and about 2.5 weeks for new part-time employees annually - paid parental and family leave, family building benefits, back-up care, enhanced family support, childcare subsidy, tuition assistance, college coaching, short- and long-term disability, voluntary AD&D coverage, voluntary accident coverage, voluntary life insurance, voluntary disability insurance, and voluntary long-term care insurance. We don't stop there - eligible employees can also receive mobile service & home internet discounts, pet insurance, and access to commuter and transit programs! To learn about T-Mobile‚Äôs amazing benefits, check out www.t-mobilebenefits.com.

Never stop growing!

As part of the T-Mobile team, you know the Un-carrier doesn‚Äôt have a corporate ladder‚Äìit‚Äôs more like a jungle gym of possibilities! We love helping our employees grow in their careers, because it‚Äôs that shared drive to aim high that drives our business and our culture forward. By applying for this career opportunity, you‚Äôre living our values while investing in your career growth‚Äìand we applaud it. You‚Äôre unstoppable!

T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, religious affiliation, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination, retaliation or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with how we do business and will not be tolerated.

Talent comes in all forms at the Un-carrier. If you are an individual with a disability and need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know by emailing ApplicantAccommodation@t-mobile.com or calling 1-844-873-9500. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

üè¢ Company: Aaratech Inc

üõë Eligibility: Only U.S. Citizens and Green Card holders are eligible.

Please note that we do not offer visa sponsorship.




Job Summary:

Aaratech Inc. is seeking a highly analytical and detail-driven Data Analyst to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for transforming raw data into actionable insights that influence strategic decisions and improve operational performance. If you enjoy working with large data sets, creating impactful visualizations, and collaborating across departments ‚Äî we want to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities:

üîπ Data Collection & Management

Gather, clean, and organize data from various internal and external sources.
Ensure accuracy, consistency, and integrity of datasets.

üîπ Data Analysis

Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Support decision-making through statistical analysis and forecasting.

üîπ Reporting & Visualization

Design and build dashboards and reports using Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.
Present data-driven findings in a clear, concise manner to stakeholders.

üîπ Team Collaboration

Work with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver tailored analytics solutions.

üîπ Tool Utilization

Leverage tools like SQL, Excel, and BI platforms for analysis and reporting.

üîπ Data Governance

Contribute to the implementation of data governance and best practices for long-term data integrity.

Qualifications:

‚úÖ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field

‚úÖ Minimum of 2 years of experience in a data analysis or similar role

‚úÖ Proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Excel

‚úÖ Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI

‚úÖ Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking abilities

‚úÖ Excellent written and verbal communication skills

‚úÖ Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholder

Title: Data Analyst 3
Description:
Payrate: $55.00 - $60.00/hr.
¬†
Summary:
The main function of a Data Analyst is to support digital marketers by analyzing marketing campaign performance and impact, support campaign setup for measurement and tracking including researching and defining audience segments for emails.
¬†
Responsibilities:
This role will contribute to supporting one line of business, with a heavy focus on email. The team is starting a project for new data measurement techniques for retention and engagement emails.
Campaign Analysis and Reporting: the role involves analyzing campaign performance and preparing reports, including generating insights and data storytelling for presentations.
Audience Research and Targeting: The role requires researching data sources to define campaign audiences, contributing to the planning phase before campaign launches.
Data Preparation and Presentation: Preparing data, creating presentations, and communicating complex analysis results to stakeholders are core responsibilities.
Conduct in-depth ad hoc analysis to uncover audience behaviors, performance drivers, and opportunities for optimization across email campaigns.
Perform research to support the creation and refinement of personalized targeting signals using cross-channel data sources.
Collaborate with marketing, product, analytics, and engineering teams to align on data requirements, insights, and targeting strategies.
Derive meaningful business insights by exploring large datasets, identifying patterns, and translating findings into actionable targeting opportunities.
¬†
Top 3 Hard Skills Required + Years of Experience:
Minimum 5 years‚Äô experience with PowerPoint (Ability to create clear, effective presentations to communicate data analysis findings)
Minimum 2-3 years‚Äô experience with Power Bi and Adobe Analytics (for data analysis and reporting)
Minimum 5 years‚Äô experience with advanced Excel (data manipulation, formulas, pivot tables, some statistical analysis)
¬†
Education/Experience:
Years of Experience Required: 5-7 overall years of experience in the field.
Degrees or certifications required: A degree in computer science, marketing, statistics, or in a field related to data analytics is required to be eligible for this role.
¬†
Pay Transparency: The typical base pay for this role across the U.S. is: $55.00 - $60.00/hr. Final offer amounts, within the base pay set forth above, are determined by factors including your relevant skills, education and experience and the benefits package you select. Full-time employees are eligible to select from different benefits packages. Packages may include medical, dental, and vision benefits, 10 paid days off, 401(k) plan participation, commuter benefits and life and disability insurance.
¬†
For information about our collection, use, and disclosure of applicant's personal information as well as applicants' rights over their personal information, please see our Privacy Policy (https://www.aditiconsulting.com/privacy-policy).
¬†
Aditi Consulting LLC uses AI technology to engage candidates during the sourcing process.¬† AI technology is used to gather data only and does not replace human-based decision making in employment decisions.¬† By applying for this position, you agree to Aditi‚Äôs use of AI technology, including calls from an AI Voice Recruiter.
¬†

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Information:

PeopleSoft Job Code/ Title: Data Analyst (DE0007)

Global Level: GL-12

Job Family/Function: Digital & Technology / Data Science & Analytics

About the Role:

As a CBRE Data Analyst, you will perform basic analysis to ensure that recommendations and business conclusions are backed by thorough data research and findings.

This job is part of the Data Science & Analytics job function. They are responsible for reviewing data that supports improving effectiveness and predicting outcomes to develop business intelligence.

What You‚Äôll Do:

* Use SQL and other scripting languages to develop and maintain complex queries that pull and curate data from multiple sources
* Develop and maintain data dashboards and associated assets including scripts, tables, workflows, and supporting processes in accordance with team standards
* Apply fundamental data structures and algorithms to solve complex problems
* Define basic data requirements and gather information using judgment and statistical tests.
* Use programming and evaluation tools (e.g. Python), including open-source programs to plan models and extract insights.
* Apply modeling and optimization methods to improve business performance.
* Develop and maintain data models, data automation systems, low-code solutions, and reporting systems, and performance metrics support.
* Develop ad-hoc reporting based on the review of existing data sources.
* Exhibit rigor, judgment, and ability to present a detailed 'data story' to a business line.
* Confirm the quality and integrity of existing data sources.
* Collaborate with the agile development team to provide recommendations and communications on enhancing existing or new processes and programs.
* Have some knowledge of standard principles with limited practical experience in applying them.
* Lead by example and model behaviors that are consistent with CBRE RISE values.
* Impact the quality of your own work.
* Work within standardized procedures and practices to achieve objectives and meet deadlines.
* Exchange straightforward information, ask questions, and check for understanding.

Title: Data Analyst (CRM)
Description:
ABOUT US

We are a fast-growing, close-knit, dynamic, and successful Digital Services Company that specializes in providing support to large multinational companies for SEO, Product & Web Content Management, Social Media Management, Performance Marketing, E-Commerce Management, CRM & E-Mail Marketing Automation, DX & Development, Data Management & Analytics, Project Management, Digital Consultancy, and Recruitment.




As a multinational Dutch company, we have offices in Amsterdam, Istanbul, Lisbon, Kuala Lumpur, Bogota & Portland. With our exceptionally talented & diverse team, and our A+ client portfolio, the world is our oyster!




We are looking for a Data Analyst (CRM) to join our team. The working hour for this position is from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm PST.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Design and maintain integrated data pipelines combining CRM platform data (e.g., SFMC) with web analytics (Google Analytics) for unified campaign reporting.
Analyze email marketing campaign performance: open rates, click-through rates, conversion rates, and revenue impact.
Conduct A/B tests on email subject lines, content, and CTAs; analyze results to recommend optimizations.
Develop interactive dashboards and reports (Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio) that provide clear, actionable insights on campaign effectiveness and customer engagement.
Collaborate closely with marketing, sales, and data engineering teams to understand data needs and support campaign strategy.
Validate data quality and ensure compliance with privacy and security standards.
Identify trends, anomalies, and customer behavior patterns to optimize marketing strategies and customer retention efforts.
Support segmentation and personalization initiatives by leveraging CRM and behavioral data.
Assist in the creation of customer retention models and customer lifetime value (CLV) analysis.
Provide insights and recommendations to improve multi-channel marketing efforts and overall customer journey.
Document processes, dashboards, and data definitions to ensure transparency and reproducibility.
Mentor junior analysts on CRM data best practices and analytics techniques.




QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing Analytics, Data Science, Economics, Statistics, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
2 years of experience in CRM analysis, marketing analytics, or data-driven campaign optimization.
Strong knowledge of CRM platforms, preferably Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC) or similar.
Experience integrating marketing data from multiple sources (e.g., SFMC, Google Analytics).
Proficient in SQL and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, DOMO).
Working knowledge of Python or R for data analysis and campaign optimization.
Familiarity with A/B testing methodologies, segmentation, and conversion funnel analysis.
Understanding of marketing KPIs: open rates, click-through rates, conversion rates, revenue attribution, engagement metrics.
Awareness of data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR) and best practices for data compliance.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills; ability to translate technical findings into actionable business insights.







WHAT WE OFFER

Mental Health & SupportüíÜüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è: Free company subscription to our mental health & support partner ‚Äò‚ÄôOpenup‚Äô‚Äô.

Referral Programüë´üèª: Our referral program ‚Äò‚ÄôFriends2Work‚Äô‚Äô encourages our employees to refer their friends followed by a cash award once they are hired.

Self-Improvementüí™üèª: Access to numerous online courses and training in our own in-house training platform NMQ Academy & access to our exclusive Mentorship Program provided by our brilliant senior peers.

Team Environmentüëë: We give you to opportunity to work with global brands together with a fun, diverse, and dynamic team and become a part of a global success story!




If you are interested in joining our team, please apply with your CV in English.




By applying to this job advertisement, you accept that you have shared your personal data within the scope of the clarification text we have provided at www.nmqdigital.com




NMQ Digital is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.




Don't be discouraged if you feel that you don‚Äôt fully meet every single one of the requirements for a particular role, there is always room for growth in NMQ!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Role

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to join our Customer Success team and lead the delivery of data-driven solutions for game studios. In this role, you will own the onboarding journey, serve as a trusted analytics advisor, and help build a data-first culture within our customers‚Äô organizations.




Key Responsibilities:

Drive Customer Onboarding: Guide customers through the onboarding process for ThinkingData‚Äôs behavior analytics platform ‚Äî including data collection design, SDK and event validation, and dashboard setup.
Be the Analytics Expert: Act as a strategic partner to customers, helping translate business goals into measurable data strategies across collection, analysis, and reporting.
Enable Data-Driven Culture: Provide ongoing consultation to support customers‚Äô digital transformation and promote best practices for data-informed decision-making.
Industry-Focused Guidance: Research and curate analytics best practices tailored to game genres, lifecycle stages (soft launch, LiveOps), and business models (IAP, IAA, hybrid).
Deep-Dive Analytics: Apply descriptive and diagnostic analysis to uncover gameplay trends, monetization bottlenecks, and user segmentation opportunities.
Customer Support & Training: Be responsive to product questions, troubleshooting requests, and on-site or remote training needs.
Knowledge Sharing: Contribute to internal knowledge bases covering analytical techniques, success stories, and game-specific metric frameworks.




Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
5+ years of experience in data analytics, preferably in gaming or digital product environments
Strong SQL skills and experience building reports and dashboards
Experience defining and analyzing key business metrics (e.g., retention, LTV, conversion funnels)
Solid understanding of how analytics ties into product development, marketing, and operations
Excellent communication, documentation, and presentation skills
Proactive, self-motivated, and comfortable working across customers and internal teams




Preferred:

Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., data lakes, ETL pipelines)
Experience with product analytics platforms (ThinkingData, Amplitude, GameAnalytics, Mixpanel)
Understanding of LiveOps, AB testing, and in-game economy metrics
Ability to balance hands-on analytics with customer-facing responsibilities

  • Knowledge Sharing: Contribute to internal knowledge bases covering analytical techniques, success stories, and game-specific metric frameworks.
