Who We Are

Cymax Group Technologies is a leading eCommerce technology and logistics services platform for big & bulky vendors and retailers. We maximize the best of technology, automation, and AI to simplify the complexities of eCommerce through our two products - Channel Gate and Freight Club. We partner with vendors and retailers to tackle some of the industry‚Äôs biggest challenges, offering prescriptive recommendations to optimize their ROI in a competitive market. Our remote-flexible team works to support our partners from the US and Canada.

About The Role

Are you passionate about turning complex data into clear, actionable insights? Do you thrive at the intersection of business strategy and analytics? We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Analyst to join our high-impact team and serve as the vital link between our business leaders and analytics experts.

As a trusted advisor to senior leadership, you‚Äôll uncover revenue and margin opportunities, shape strategic initiatives, and champion a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organization.

This is a hybrid role, based in the Vancouver, BC area.

What You‚Äôll Do

  • üìä Deliver Insights: Conduct deep-dive analyses to identify growth opportunities and optimize performance across the business. Deliver clear, concise analyses that uncover revenue and margin opportunities, and inform prioritization of strategic initiatives and marketing campaigns.
  • üó£Ô∏è Tell the Story: Translate complex data into compelling, executive-ready narratives that influence high-level decision-making. Present to Senior Leadership level audiences and influence roadmaps for Product, Marketing, Vendor Management and Logistics.
  • üîç Drive Change: Proactively identify gaps in and improvements in our business, continually advocating for optimization and advocate for data-based decision making throughout the organization, working with business owners throughout the organization to tackle complex problems using data and insights.
  • ü§ù Mentor & Lead: Coach junior analysts and business partners on statistical rigor, code quality, and visualization. Champion a culture of experimentation, reproducible research, and continuous improvement.

What We‚Äôre Looking For

Experience & Education

  • 7+ years in analytics or data science roles
  • 3+ years in eCommerce or digital marketplaces

Technical Skills

  • Advanced SQL and experience with modern data warehouses
  • Proficient in Python or R for data wrangling, modeling, and visualization
  • Skilled in Power BI (or similar tools)
  • Deep understanding of eCommerce funnels, category & vendor management analytics, sales attribution, and marketing metrics.
  • Proven ability to distill complex analyses into stories for non‚Äëtechnical stakeholders and influence decisions.
  • Bonus: Familiarity with machine learning techniques for recommendation and forecasting

Personal Attributes

  • Detail-oriented with excellent communication skills
  • Comfortable training both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Passionate about data, experimentation, and continuous learning

Why Join Us?

  • üåç Impact: Your work will directly influence strategic decisions at the highest levels.
  • ü§ù Collaboration: Work alongside smart, driven colleagues who value data as much as you do.
  • üìà Growth: Opportunities to lead, mentor, and shape the future of analytics in a fast-paced environment.

Compensation

The Salary Range for this role is between $90,000 and $120,000, depending on experience. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location. We offer a comprehensive range of benefits which includes:

  • Health and wellness support for our team members and their families including an employee assistance program
  • 100% paid premiums for health and dental benefits in Canada
  • Paid time off
  • Easy access to online and phone-based counselling services
  • And a remote-flexible work environment.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Detailed Job Description

JOIN US IN ENABLING TRADE THROUGH CANADA'S LARGEST PORT.

The Vancouver Fraser Port Authority is an arm‚Äôs-length federal agency responsible for the shared stewardship of the lands and waters that make up the Port of Vancouver, Canada‚Äôs largest port. Our mandate, as outlined in the Canada Marine Act, is to enable Canada‚Äôs trade objectives on behalf of all Canadians, ensuring the safe movement of goods through the Port of Vancouver while protecting the environment and considering local communities.

As an organization with a significant impact on communities and businesses across Canada, the Vancouver Fraser Port Authority is dedicated to diversity, inclusion, and sustainability. We strive to create a workplace that mirrors the richness of our community, empowering all employees to achieve their full potential.

The senior business analyst ‚Äì information services works closely with business stakeholders and technology teams to create both business and functional requirements and guide the process from idea inception to delivery.

This position will assist the manager, information systems and data with the business analysis, project management of multiple complex projects, implementation and technical support for chosen technology.

The senior business analyst ‚Äì information services will coordinate cross-functional teams in mapping out and solving business problems, developing business requirements, work plans and technical specifications, as well as performing system and user tests, preparing documentation and training users.

What You Do


Provide input for business planning and participate in the project planning process. Identify opportunities for improvement and/or enhancements opportunities of existing business applications and processes; implement these improvements through effective leadership and engagement of others.
Develop overall maintenance and upgrades plans for major VFPA business applications.
Work with internal and external customers to identify and validate specific business and user requirements.
Utilize artifacts such as business requirements documents (BRDs), JIRA, data analysis and Business Process Documentation, facilitates requirements alignment sessions
Determine system needs to ensure project deliverables meet customer expectations.
Create technical specifications for delivering customer solutions.
Participate in the implementation and transition of project outcomes to the appropriate area(s).
Work with the project team to develop and conduct user and support training.
Oversight of consultants to develop and implement solutions aligned with agreed upon specifications.
Ensure change control and IS change management procedures are followed within the project team as they relate to requirements
Participate in the project close out and lessons learned activities to validate solutions with the business to ensure delivery and continuous improvement.
Identify integration opportunities and overlaps among VFPA business applications; recommend improvements and enhancements. Resolve application and data integration issues as required
Participate in determining and acquiring development resources (people, hardware and software).
Design systems specifications, modules, and process changes.
Document current and future/desired processes
Develop testing approach and plans and conduct testing to assure quality delivery.
Provide technical expertise and guidance, support and troubleshooting to VFPA business applications and processes.
Interact with users and anticipate user needs on a regular basis.
Provide technical input directed toward the evaluation and acquisition of new systems and/or enhancements of existing systems.
Prepare RFPs and / or requirement specifications to evaluate proposal submissions.



What You Bring


A post-secondary degree in computer science, business administration or another acceptable area.
A minimum of five years‚Äô related experience, including recent proven leadership on business analysis, project management and user requirement gathering in complex business environments.
Experience working with both agile and waterfall delivery methodologies is required, and well as proficiency in tools like Visio, Jira, Sharepoint and MS Project.
Must also have proficiency in modern programming languages, data management, analysis and reporting tools for assigned applications.
Strong preference for those with a passion and dedication to ongoing professional development (i.e. Business Analyst Certification).
Software development experience is an asset. Must value maintaining their technology skills and acts proactively to stay abreast of advances in their areas of expertise.
Proficiency in tools like Visio, Jira, SharePoint and MS Project is required.
Ability to communicate with people of various technical and business backgrounds, including the ability to explain difficult technical concepts in simple terms to business users.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required, as well as the ability to communicate both technically and non-technically.
This individual must have good organizational skills and the ability to effectively multi-task.
Must be a self-motivated team player with an excellent ‚Äúcustomer service‚Äù approach and a strong dedication to quality customer service.
Must have strong diagnostic and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work effectively in a quickly changing environment.



What We Offer


Market-competitive base salaries and variable incentive plan
Generous and inclusive benefits offering including retirement benefits plan
Flexible remote work program
Earned time off program
Paid vacation and personal care leave
Learning, development, and advancement opportunities
Onsite gym with towel service in a national landmark in the heart of Vancouver‚Äôs waterfront
Friendly, unique, and respectful workplace



Location: Vancouver, Canada

Job type: Bargaining Unit, Full-Time, Permanent, Hybrid

Working environment: Normal office conditions.

Marine Transportation Security Clearance

The incumbent must obtain and maintain a valid Marine Transportation Security Clearance as this position is required to access restricted areas/information as defined by the Marine Transportation Security Regulations.

This is Canadian-based employment, and it is expected that all employees maintain legal entitlement to work in Canada. Applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process may be subject to background checks, including but not limited to criminal record, credit, and/or reference checks.

At the Vancouver Fraser Port Authority, we are dedicated to employment equity and a workplace reflective of the diversity of our port community. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates including women, persons with disabilities, Indigenous peoples, and members of visible minorities. Reasonable accommodation can be provided in the selection process and while working with the port authority. If you require support applying to our openings, please contact us at careers@portvancouver.com.

Title: Business Systems Analyst, Retail Technology
Description:
Department: Technology

Reports to: Sr. Product Manager, Retail Technology

Location: North Vancouver, B.C.







Your Opportunity at ARC‚ÄôTERYX:




As the Business Systems Analyst you will act as the conduit between technology teams and multiple business teams. You assist with our configuration and integration projects by eliciting and analyzing requirements, liaising between business and technical resources, and documenting business processes or systems and their integration. You must be able to quickly absorb new and different types of information, modify and adapt existing knowledge, and work in a changing and evolving environment to ensure successful project delivery using an agile scrum methodology. You are a critical thinker who enjoys diving into the details and seeking to understand the ‚Äúhow‚Äù and ‚Äúwhy‚Äù, while balancing the need for working software over comprehensive documentation.¬†

¬†

Meet Your Future Team:




The retail technology team partners closely with various parts of the business to deliver the Arc‚Äôteryx retail experience roadmap. In this role, you will work with talented teams to deliver new systems and enhancements that will strengthen the retail guest experience. We dig in and get to the root of the right problems.




If you were the Business Systems Analyst now, here are some of the core activities you would be doing:
Working with the WFM Product Manager to configure and implement a new WFM Pro product for Arc‚Äôteryx retail employees
Working alongside cross-functional teams to elicit, document and review HRM business requirements and policies
Supporting the implementation and configuration of a new HRIS; UKG Pro
Building out and supporting execution of functional test cases, capturing the results in TestRail and collaborating with the project team for defect resolution
Collaborating with various business stakeholders to develop business requirements detailing user stories, use cases, and flow diagrams to support development design and build activities
Ensuring stakeholders are consulted and accepting of the technology product at each step of the implementation journey
Developing subject matter expertise in specific retail domains, ensuring that the technology product maintains exceptional quality when delivered to production
Working alongside internal and external development teams and technology SaaS vendors to implement new technology products, clarifying any questions relating to business requirements or process along the way
Working with Agile teams contributing to successful sprint objectives
Clarifying questions and providing documentation to support completion of development and test phases
Creating understandable visual representations to communicate complex concepts and models for various target audiences




Here are some of the things you could be working on in the future:
Documenting detailed user stories, process flows, system flows, and acceptance criteria that will be used for business process review, solution & technical architecture, and quality assurance
Identifying and documenting business process, changes, and improvements
Facilitating and managing stakeholder engagement
Maintaining process and system documentation as business and systems evolve
Developing, updating, and embedding your extensive expertise on business areas & technologies in scope within the Business Analysts chapter and the agile squads
Expanding the UKG Pro product to new geographical regions




Are you our next Business Systems Analyst, Retail Technology?
You have a Bachelor‚Äôs degree or post-secondary education in business, information systems or a relevant field, completion of a recognized Business Analysis program, and/or equivalent business experience
You have experience working with HRIS and HRM policies
You have experience with UKG Pro configuration, integration, and data migration
You have familiarity with UKG APIs or middleware like Boomi or MuleSoft and business process modeling tools (Visio, Lucidchart), and HR reporting tools
You have experience executing functional testing and working with quality assurance on defect triage & resolution
You have experience in end-to-end HRIS implementation, including requirements gathering, configuration, testing, deployment, and change management
You have an understanding of HR data privacy, security best practices, and regulatory compliance (GDPR, PIPEDA) in HRIS systems
You have 5+ years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst, working on agile projects related to e-commerce and/or retail
You have experience with working in an Agile methodology
You are capable facilitating workshops or stakeholder alignment meetings
You have excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate with all levels of stakeholders to be able to explain, articulate, and document concepts, business processes, systems and business requirements efficiently
You possess a high level of analytical and critical thinking
You have strong troubleshooting skills
You are able to navigate conflict resolution in cross-functional teams
You have and feel comfortable experience using JIRA & Confluence
You are proactive in identifying the root cause of issues and developing solutions
You remain highly flexible and adaptable when faced with ambiguity
You are able to balance autonomy and collaboration
You seek the best (but sometimes not the easiest) solutions, with an unwavering commitment to do what is right
You have experience with working in the (Outdoor) Apparel or Retail industry







Equal Opportunity




Arc‚Äôteryx is committed to actively creating and fostering a culture of inclusivity where voices are heard, people are seen, and values are respected. We care about the uniqueness of our applicants, employees, and guests, and we do so in a safe space fueled by curiosity and acceptance.¬†




Creating an inclusive workplace is connected to our core value Do Right while also having the added benefit of helping make our business better. We believe inclusion helps us to create a healthier, happier workplace, drive creativity and innovation, and reflect the communities where we operate.¬†¬†




All applicants, employees, and guests can expect equality of opportunity and fair treatment in alignment with our values.




Leave it Better

We believe that the mountains transform us, that how we adventure matters, and that there‚Äôs always a better way.¬†

Join us in creating positive change in ourselves, our communities, and the world.¬†




Live it. Get out there - the mountains make us better¬†

Disruptive evolution. In pursuit of better. Always.¬†

Commit. We set bold objectives and see them through.¬†



A reasonable estimate of the pay range is CAD$82,000 - CAD$112,000 at the time of this posting. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors such as job-related skills, relevant experience, education and/or training. The upper end of the range is typically reserved for candidates with demonstrated expertise that is above job requirements or who bring exceptional directly transferable experience.
Please note that the range details above reflect the base pay only and does not include our competitive bonus program and benefits that we offer.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Position Summary

BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST

JOB ID: 6375

REGULAR/FULL-TIME

LOCATION: SURREY, B.C (Hybrid Work)

To be considered for this role, applications MUST be submitted online, by clicking on 'Apply' below.


Join one of BC‚Äôs Top Employers!
Be part of an exceptional company culture with great employee benefits and a healthy work/life balance!


BC Housing thanks all applicants for their interest; only those selected for an interview will be contacted. This position is only open to those legally entitled to work in Canada.

THE ORGANIZATION

BC Housing is a provincial Crown Corporation that develops, manages and administers a wide range of subsidized housing options for those most in need across the province to address critical gaps across the housing continuum ranging from emergency shelter through to rent assistance in the private market and affordable home ownership. Share in the rewards of working with an organization that offers challenging work and competitive compensation and supports the growth and development of its people.

Our mission is to provide access to safe, quality, accessible, and affordable housing options. We do this to promote strong, inclusive communities where people can thrive.

BC Housing offers competitive salaries and an excellent benefits package. But a job is more than a pay cheque. We also offer our staff the opportunity to work together to make a difference. When employees go home at the end of the day, they experience the satisfaction of knowing they‚Äôve helped provide safe, affordable housing for British Columbians. And while they‚Äôre here, employees can take advantage of many opportunities:


In-house training, and training at other institutions, for courses related to employees‚Äô current positions or to prepare them for advancement within BC Housing.
Wellness programs including physical fitness, programs to help employees quit smoking, free flu shots, mental health resources, and lunch-and-learn lectures and seminars.
Recognition programs including long-term service awards, idea recognition and outstanding performance awards.
Livegreen incentives include an employee transit pass program, and other initiatives that encourage alternative, sustainable transportation (even a bike purchase program!).

BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST:

$92,145.79 - $106,699.96 Annually - actual salary offered will be commensurate with education, experience and internal parity.

Position Summary

Reporting to a Manager in the IMT Enterprise Business Systems (EBS) or Analytics and Systems Development (ASD) units, the Business Systems Analyst is responsible for providing business analysis and functional support for core BC Housing business systems. He/she/they provides applications support to Business Support resources, leads business process modeling, proposes new/enhanced business processes, documents requirements, collaborates on technical requirements and specifications, and liaises with various IMT development and support teams. The position supports development of business cases, manages assigned projects, chairs project meetings, monitors ne w installs and services, resolves problems, coordinates release notes documentation and training programs, and participates in post¬≠implementation reviews and performance analyses.

CANDIDATE PROFILE

The successful candidate will have the following:

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:


University degree in Information Technology or other related discipline from a recognized post-secondary institution.
Considerable IT industry experience specifically focused on IT solutions and services, with experience in business analysis.
Considerable experience in supporting enterprise-wide business systems and working with interfaces including troubleshooting issues.
Or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience acceptable to the employer.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:


Considerable knowledge of Oracle technology including database and middleware
Considerable knowledge of project lifecycle concepts and the ability to apply them to small projects such as business process changes and data cleansing
Considerable knowledge of IT standards, system development life cycle, and IT development environments
Sound knowledge of business processes in a social housing environment, including finance, procurement, asset maintenance, project development and property management
Sound knowledge and understanding of the Commission's structure and business operations
Considerable knowledge and understanding of a variety of information systems programs and business processes pertaining to accounting, procurement, maintenance and real estate management
Sound knowledge of feasibility, risk assessment, impact and cost-benefit analysis techniques and processes
Sound knowledge and understanding of systems technology trends and the ability to critically assess and evaluate those trends as they apply to the organization.
Strong skills in business requirements gathering, process modelling and solution architecting including writing business requirement documents and/or polishing business documents
Excellent oral and written communication, analytical, problem-solving, decision-making, organizational and time management skills
Strong project management, leadership and facilitation skills, and good negotiation and influencing skills
Ability to plan and manage moderate-sized projects, or portions of larger projects, manage teams of staff and contractors in the development, change management and implementation of systems, and work cooperatively in a team environment.
Ability to take ownership of tasks and drive them through to completion
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office including Excel, Word, Project, Visio, and SharePoint
Proficiency in the use of hardware technologies including servers, workstations, networks and operating systems
Criminal Record Check


How to Apply:

Please review the attached job description for a complete list of duties, qualifications and competencies. BC Housing thanks all applicants for their interest; only those selected for an interview will be contacted. This position is only open to those legally entitled to work in Canada.

THE ORGANIZATION

BC Housing is a provincial Crown Corporation that develops, manages and administers a wide range of subsidized housing options for those most in need across the province to address critical gaps across the housing continuum ranging from emergency shelter through to rent assistance in the private market and affordable home ownership. Share in the rewards of working with an organization that offers challenging work and competitive compensation and supports the growth and development of its people.

Our mission is to provide access to safe, quality, accessible, and affordable housing options. We do this to promote strong, inclusive communities where people can thrive.

BC Housing offers competitive salaries and an excellent benefits package. But a job is more than a pay cheque. We also offer our staff the opportunity to work together to make a difference. Title: Business / System Analyst (Vancouver)
Description:
Paradigm has opportunities for Business Analysts to employ their knowledge, skills and techniques to deliver and implement significant initiatives and enable our customers to maximize their investments in their business processes and information technology.

Our customers are beginning to return to the office. Depending on the customer, the role may or may not start remote but may switch to onsite at the customer direction.

The Business Analyst / Systems Analyst will work on a variety of projects with stakeholders to develop and enhance solutions which support our customer‚Äôs needs. The candidate will work closely with the business areas to produce the standard business analysis deliverables and tailor these based on the type of project and methodology being used.

The Business Analyst / Systems Analyst plays a critical role in the success of our customer‚Äôs projects. The candidate must have excellent communications skills to engage with all levels of the business to understand their needs and solicit their requirements.

Responsibilities


Participates in requirements analysis and verification sessions for complex projects and may lead requirements analysis and verification sessions for less complex projects.
Analyze, define and interpret business needs and issues by gathering, analyzing, documenting, validating and supporting the Business area(s) and user(s) technical (functional/non-functional) requirements.
Determine user needs and requirements and recommend ways to improve systems.
Identify, document, report and track project issues.
Working knowledge of various methodology such as agile, waterfall, scrum, hybrid.
Creation of BRD, FRD, use cases, user stories, JAD sessions and other project related documents.
Translate business requirements into functional specifications, manages changes to such specifications, and educates the IT organization on the direction of the business.
Gather information about the customer‚Äôs work processes and information flows.
Has knowledge and background of other technologies and tools.
Has basic understanding of business, market and industry issues facing a specific business unit or function.
Ensures all user acceptance tests are conducted and documented according to standards. Identifies and documents system deficiencies and recommends solutions.
Assist and\or lead the change management activities to ensure complete user adoption of changes implemented.
Experience working within public sector (government ministries, Crown corporations) is a very strong asset.
Excellent understanding of government operations of work in the industry.


What You Can Expect From Us


An organization that values your innovative spirit and passion for helping customers succeed with over 30 years of experience and presence in Regina, Winnipeg and Saskatoon.
Opportunity to work on exciting, challenging and transformational projects.
A personalized Professional Development program that you tailor to fit your needs and skill set.
Competitive compensation, benefits, profit sharing and vacation policies.
Monthly team-building and idea-sharing presentations to foster growth and best practice approaches.
An organization that values commitment and believes in work/life balance: after seven (7) years of service, you will receive a six (6) week paid sabbatical.
Exciting Employee Ownership options.
Access to a network of consultants with deep knowledge and experience to support and connect with.


‚ÄØ

To learn more about our‚ÄØBenefits,‚ÄØCulture‚ÄØor apply for these opportunities, please visit our website:‚ÄØCareers.ParadigmConsulting.com

We thank you for your interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Paradigm Consulting Group is committed to cultural diversity, inclusiveness and gender equity. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

Title: Entry Level Data Back-end Engineer (Remote, Canada)
Description:
Summary

Yelp engineering culture is driven by our values: we‚Äôre a cooperative team that values individual authenticity and encourages creative solutions to problems. All new engineers deploy working code their first week, and we strive to broaden individual impact with support from managers, mentors, and teams. At the end of the day, we‚Äôre all about helping our users, growing as engineers, and having fun in a collaborative environment.

Are you curious about exploring data at an enormous scale and finding innovative ways to collect it, curate it, and make it easily accessible for others to use?

At Yelp, our datasets contain billions of interactions between users and local businesses around the globe. This data helps us make large scale business decisions that influence Yelp‚Äôs product roadmap and power our machine learning models. If you are looking to deepen your experience and excited about making an impact with large-scale data, we‚Äôd love to have you join us!

The Marketplace Data Observability team is responsible for managing, governing, and monitoring all of Yelp‚Äôs Ads data to protect our revenue stream and to support offline analysis (human and ML) that aids in making long term company decisions. We build tools that help us better understand our data quality, and we strive to uncover data issues before they impact our stakeholders.

As a Data Backend Engineer on this team, you will be responsible for building elegant and scalable data marts and products that serve critical, up-to-date, structured information to support different types of analytics within Yelp. As a core contributor to our growing data modeling and data warehousing engineering efforts, you will help design and own mission-critical data flow pipelines and datastores to enable decisions ,including effective A/B testing, and company investments.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular area in Canada. We welcome applicants from throughout Canada. We‚Äôd love to have you apply, even if you don‚Äôt feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we‚Äôre looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

What You'll Do


Build systems that can effectively store and crunch terabytes of data.
Assist in designing data models for efficient data storage, retrieval, ML training, and reporting.
Create and maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models using industry-standard modeling tools.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including ML engineers, data analysts, business analysts, and data scientists, to understand data requirements and translate them into effective data models.
Participate in data integration efforts, including ETL processes and data migration.
Stay up-to-date with industry best practices, emerging technologies, and trends related to data warehousing.
Take part in on-call rotation, with support from your teammates.


What It Takes To Succeed


Experience writing code in a modern object-oriented programming language (e.g., Python, Java, or C++)
Experience in building and deploying live software services in production.
Keen interest in building and operating high performing, highly available and scalable data systems.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to communicate effectively to technical and non-technical cohorts alike across multiple teams and help others succeed.


What You'll Get


Compensation range is $85,000-122,000 annually. Depending on your role and level, you may also be offered a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits.
This opportunity has the option to be fully remote in all locations across Canada.
You can find more information about Yelp's five star benefits here!


Closing

At Yelp, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, and education ‚Äî and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values, which include ‚ÄúPlaying Well With Others‚Äù and ‚ÄúAuthenticity.‚Äù

We‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other protected status.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-recruiting@yelp.com or 1-415-969-8488.

Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Recruiting and Applicant Privacy Notice

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Who We Are

Cymax Group Technologies is a leading eCommerce technology and logistics services platform for big & bulky vendors and retailers. We maximize the best of technology, automation, and AI to simplify the complexities of eCommerce through our two products - Channel Gate and Freight Club. We partner with vendors and retailers to tackle some of the industry‚Äôs biggest challenges, offering prescriptive recommendations to optimize their ROI in a competitive market. Our remote-flexible team works to support our partners from the US and Canada.

About The Role

The Data Engineerplays a pivotal role in designing, building, and maintaining scalable, robust, and secure data pipelines and architectures that enable our analytics and business intelligence teams to derive actionable insights. This role will collaborate cross-functionally with data analysts, data scientists, software engineers, and business stakeholders to ensure our data infrastructure supports current and future needs.

This is a hybrid role, 1-2 days in the office, based in the Vancouver, BC area.

üåü What You‚Äôll Be Doing


ETL/ELT Development: Design, develop, and deploy scalable ETL/ELT processes for diverse data sources.
Workflow Optimization: Optimize data workflows for performance, reliability, and cost-efficiency in hybrid cloud (Azure/Databricks) and on-prem environments (SQL Server).
Data Quality & Governance: Implement data quality, validation, and governance frameworks to ensure high data integrity.
Storage Solutions Maintenance: Maintain and enhance data warehouse, data lake, and other storage solutions for performance and resilience.
Automation & Monitoring: Automate routine data operations and develop monitoring systems to proactively detect and resolve issues.
Tool & Technology Integration: Evaluate and integrate new tools and technologies to support evolving data needs and industry best practices.
Collaboration with Analytics Teams: Collaborate with analytics and data science teams to deliver clean, well-modeled datasets for self-service analytics and advanced modeling.
Documentation: Develop and maintain clear documentation of data pipelines, processes, and architectural decisions.


üß† What You Bring


Experience: 3+ years of experience in a data engineering or backend developer role.
SQL Proficiency: Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with modern data warehousing solutions.
Hybrid Data Environment: Comfortable working in a hybrid data environment, supporting both on-prem (SQL Server) and cloud-based data warehouses (Databricks).
Programming Skills: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Scala, or Java for data pipeline development.
Orchestration & Version Control: Experience with orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Prefect, Dagster) and version control systems (e.g., Git).
Data Modeling & Distributed Computing: Solid understanding of data modeling, data lakes, and distributed computing frameworks (e.g., Spark).


üí° Bonus Points If You Have:


Experience with Business Intelligence Tools: Exposure to business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and enabling semantic layers is an asset.


Compensation

The Salary Range for this role is between $75,000 and $90,000, depending on experience. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location. We offer a comprehensive range of benefits which includes:


Health and wellness support for our team members and their families including an employee assistance program
100% paid premiums for health and dental benefits in Canada
Paid time off
Easy access to online and phone-based counselling services
And a remote-flexible work environment.


Join Our AI Journey at Cymax Group!

At Cymax Group, we thrive on innovation and entrepreneurship. As an AI-first organization, we are on an exciting journey to continuously grow and evolve our focus on AI, empowering our people at all levels. Our fast-paced environment encourages agility and nimbleness, enabling our team to adapt swiftly to changing market dynamics. We're passionate about continuous learning and growth, offering opportunities for professional development. Our data-driven decision-making ensures we make informed choices that lead to success. If you're excited about making an impact and being part of a dynamic, AI-empowered team, you'll feel right at home here.

Join us and be part of a dynamic team that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence. Apply now to make a significant impact at Cymax Group Technologies and Freight Club!

Accessibility

We can provide accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

We maximize the best of technology, automation, and AI to simplify the complexities of eCommerce through our two products - Channel Gate and Freight Club. We partner with vendors and retailers to tackle some of the industry‚Äôs biggest challenges, offering prescriptive recommendations to optimize their ROI in a competitive market. Our remote-flexible team works to support our partners from the US and Canada.

About The Role

The Data Engineerplays a pivotal role in designing, building, and maintaining scalable, robust, and secure data pipelines and architectures that enable our analytics and business intelligence teams to derive actionable insights. This role will collaborate cross-functionally with data analysts, data scientists, software engineers, and business stakeholders to ensure our data infrastructure supports current and future needs.

This is a hybrid role, 1-2 days in the office, based in the Vancouver, BC area.

üåü What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • ETL/ELT Development: Design, develop, and deploy scalable ETL/ELT processes for diverse data sources.
  • Workflow Optimization: Optimize data workflows for performance, reliability, and cost-efficiency in hybrid cloud (Azure/Databricks) and on-prem environments (SQL Server).
  • Data Quality & Governance: Implement data quality, validation, and governance frameworks to ensure high data integrity.
  • Storage Solutions Maintenance: Maintain and enhance data warehouse, data lake, and other storage solutions for performance and resilience.
  • Automation & Monitoring: Automate routine data operations and develop monitoring systems to proactively detect and resolve issues.
  • Tool & Technology Integration: Evaluate and integrate new tools and technologies to support evolving data needs and industry best practices.
  • Collaboration with Analytics Teams: Collaborate with analytics and data science teams to deliver clean, well-modeled datasets for self-service analytics and advanced modeling.
  • Documentation: Develop and maintain clear documentation of data pipelines, processes, and architectural decisions.

üß† What You Bring

  • Experience: 3+ years of experience in a data engineering or backend developer role.
  • SQL Proficiency: Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with modern data warehousing solutions.
  • Hybrid Data Environment: Comfortable working in a hybrid data environment, supporting both on-prem (SQL Server) and cloud-based data warehouses (Databricks).
  • Programming Skills: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Scala, or Java for data pipeline development.
  • Orchestration & Version Control: Experience with orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Prefect, Dagster) and version control systems (e.g., Git).
  • Data Modeling & Distributed Computing: Solid understanding of data modeling, data lakes, and distributed computing frameworks (e.g., Spark).

üí° Bonus Points If You Have:

  • Experience with Business Intelligence Tools: Exposure to business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and enabling semantic layers is an asset.

Compensation

The Salary Range for this role is between $75,000 and $90,000, depending on experience. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location. We offer a comprehensive range of benefits which includes:

  • Health and wellness support for our team members and their families including an employee assistance program
  • 100% paid premiums for health and dental benefits in Canada
  • Paid time off
  • Easy access to online and phone-based counselling services
  • And a remote-flexible work environment.

Join Our AI Journey at Cymax Group!

At Cymax Group, we thrive on innovation and entrepreneurship. As an AI-first organization, we are on an exciting journey to continuously grow and evolve our focus on AI, empowering our people at all levels. Our fast-paced environment encourages agility and nimbleness, enabling our team to adapt swiftly to changing market dynamics. We're passionate about continuous learning and growth, offering opportunities for professional development. Our data-driven decision-making ensures we make informed choices that lead to success. If you're excited about making an impact and being part of a dynamic, AI-empowered team, you'll feel right at home here.

Join us and be part of a dynamic team that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence. Apply now to make a significant impact at Cymax Group Technologies and Freight Club!

Accessibility

We can provide accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

As a part of the Data and Analytics team, you will be supporting some of the largest game titles on a cutting-edge project to find mathematically vigorous new ways of getting games in hands. This team is fast-paced, and passion driven, and requires a Data Scientist that is flexible to drive value, work in an agile environment, and who wants to make an immediate impact.

You will report to a Senior Data Scientist under a Director, Data Science. Our team's mandate covers many parts of the player journey from acquisition to churn prevention, and together we will make a pioneering impact in these areas.

This will evolve into a hybrid position with 3 days in office each week.

Responsibilities


Build statistical and machine learning models to predict the Life Time Value of player cohorts, and deploy said models through collaborating with data engineers.
Produce dashboards or other visual reporting to share results with non-technical partners.
Transform adhoc requests into well-defined technical problems which you will then solve.
Support other team efforts, including the set up and analysis of incrementality, A/B tests.


Qualifications


3+ years relevant professional experience or a degree in a quantitative field, including but not limited to physics, engineering, mathematics, computer science, and economics.
Proficient at git, Python and SQL.
Experience working with cloud databases such as Google BigQuery and Snowflake.
Experience building Looker and Tableau dashboards.
Experience using xgboost, scikit-learn or other Python machine learning libraries.
Comfortable working remotely with a multi-functional team, understanding the perspectives of each partner
Experience working in an Agile development environment and familiar with process management tools such as JIRA, Target process, Trello or similar


Nice-to-haves


Experience with casual inference e.g., fixed effects, diff-in-diff and other machine learning methods.
Experience with container technologies e.g., Docker and Kubernetes.


Compensation And Benefits

The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).

PAY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria) * $96,400 - $133,900 CAD


In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

About Electronic Arts

We‚Äôre proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: GIS Analyst
Description:
Are you someone with leadership and technical capabilities? Do you enjoy building relationships and working collaboratively in a team environment with both internal and external stakeholders? Are you a trusted partner and a problem solver? If you enjoy entrepreneurship and innovation, this opportunity is for you! As someone with excellent communication skills and business acumen, you will thrive in our fast-paced and agile environment.

Your opportunity

We are currently seeking candidates for the position of GIS Analyst in our Vancouver Office . You will be a member of Dillon‚Äôs GIS Discipline within the Data Integration Services Practice You will be a key part of our multidisciplinary group serving our public sector (federal, provincial, and municipal), and Indigenous clients.

This is an office based position.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with multidisciplinary project teams including planners, engineers, scientists, and technologists
Contribute to the development and management of existing and innovative technical systems, standards, and procedures to maintain a high standard of efficiency and quality in products and services
Provide GIS technical support related to GIS components of operational projects (internal and external) including data management, spatial analysis, and visualizations in various GIS and data management software (e.g. ArcGIS, Tableau, and Power BI)
Provide innovative and efficient web tool architecture and design that can be used across multidisciplinary areas
Apply programming and coding skills to assist with project and data resolution management, enhance web applications through the development of additional functionalities and components, and develop automated reporting tools
Develop, implement, and maintain related coding procedures and policies specific to GIS Web Applications throughout the development life cycle, ensuring adherence to organization standards and user requirements. (e.g. ArcGIS Enterprise and ArcGIS Online)
Test, review, analyze, optimize, and monitor Web GIS Portal systems/tools and internal processes for enhanced efficiency, effectiveness, and to uphold optimal functionality and performance
Conduct comprehensive research and assess a range of GIS software solutions to enhance the development and management of existing and innovative technical systems, tools, and applications



Learning and Development


Commit to self-development and ongoing learning and professional development
Contribute to Dillon‚Äôs corporate profile through active participation in professional associations and committees



Qualifications


A degree in Computer Science, Geography, Surveying, Science, Engineering, or a related field
Completion of a one-year technical program in GIS
A minimum of 1-3 years of professional experience, preferably in the consulting industry, or technical program equivalent
Demonstrated abilities in the use of ESRI GIS software (ArcMap, ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Online)
Report writing, organization, and interpersonal skills
Versatile, adaptable, and willing to conduct a variety of tasks



Experience


Proficient in data compilation, relational database design, and extract, transform, and load (ETL) processes
Designing custom data collection tools and models with automated reports
Using statistics and machine learning principles to manipulate data and present results from large datasets
Understanding of spatial analysis, spatial statistics, remote sensing, and working knowledge of ESRI analysis tools (Network Analyst, Spatial Analyst, 3D Analyst)
Development of mobile applications (Survey123, Collector, Field Maps) and ArcGIS Online web applications
Demonstrated abilities in multidisciplinary project teamwork and coordination
Proficient in the writing of technical reports
Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication, and organizational skills
Working knowledge of the following programs and programming languages would be considered an asset: AutoCAD, Pix4D, Power BI, CityEngine, Python, ArcPy, JavaScript, and Arcade



Young professionals with less than three years of consulting experience have an opportunity to join Dillon Early Career Development (ECD) . Our ECD program is a unique component of our overall Talent Pipeline, designed to accelerate the development of our early career professionals as consultants. Program participants are offered enhanced opportunities for learning and development while building a sense of community through both formal and informal learning.

Dillon‚Äôs commitment to the growth and development of our people is a driving force of our success. With over a third of our staff participating in this program, our young professionals are provided with a unique opportunity to practice self-development and build for Dillon‚Äôs future.

Compensation

$59,775 -$79,463

Dillon is including the salary range that we in good faith believe may offer for this position. It will be dependent on the successful applicant‚Äôs education, experience, and skills, in addition to internal equity and geographic region. Dillon reserves the right to pay outside of the posted range, contingent on factors unrelated to an applicant‚Äôs gender or other status protected by provincial and/or federal law.

Why choose Dillon

Dillon is powered by people who are technically proficient, passionate about socially important projects, and motivated to deliver superior, tangible results. We strive to remain at the forefront of technology and innovation, and are empowered to continually grow and develop.

We live our core values :


Reliability: words result in actions that build trust;
Achievement: do the work to hit the target;
Continuous development: always learning; always adapting; always growing;
Creativity: discover new possibilities;
Courage: do the things that matter, especially when it‚Äôs hard;
Inclusiveness: enabling belonging to draw strength from our differences.



Dillon is a certified Great Place to Work . This recognition underscores our commitment to fostering an outstanding employee experience and cultivating an exceptional workplace culture. At Dillon, we believe that our people are our greatest asset. This designation reflects our ongoing efforts to ensure that our workplace is not just a place of work, but a community where everyone can thrive.

In addition, we offer:


Employee share purchase plan
Dillon is 100% employee owned and share ownership is open to all employees.
A competitive compensation package
Comprehensive health benefits
Generous retirement savings plan
Student loan repayment assistance with matching employer contributions
Work life balance
Dillon values its staff and the contributions that are made each day and understands that work arrangements can differ based on personal needs and business needs. We are taking a trust-based approach to oÔ¨Äer a variety of Ô¨Çexible work options to help balance the competing demands of work and personal life.
Early Career Development (ECD) program
We are committed to developing the skills and knowledge of our people at every stage of their career. The ECD program is designed to accelerate the development of successful consulting careers of new graduates. The program focuses on a mix of skills and behaviours that align with technical, consulting, clients, business acumen, and early leadership.
Focus on Innovation
The ability to anticipate, examine, and adopt new and innovative solutions is a crucial driver for the continual and progressive advancement of our business performance. In our culture, people are empowered to reflect and question current practices and seek forward looking solutions to today‚Äôs problems and tomorrow‚Äôs opportunities.
Employee and Family Assistance program
A variety of EFAP tools and online resources to support well-being are available to all employees.
Goodlife Fitness Corporate Membership
Our employees can take advantage of reduced annual membership fees.
Wellness Subsidy
Our Employees can take advantage of wellness subsidy that can be put towards expenses for a variety of health and/or wellness related activities such as gym membership, purchase of home fitness equipment, yoga classes and dance classes

About Dillon

Dillon is a proudly Canadian, employee-owned, professional consulting firm specializing in planning, engineering, environmental science and management. We partner with clients to provide committed, collaborative, and inventive solutions to complex, multi-faceted projects. With over 20 offices and more than 1000 employees across Canada, Dillon offers a wide range of services related to building and improving facilities and infrastructure, protecting the environment, and developing communities.

Now operating for over 75 years, we continue to strive for excellence in everything we do. Dillon has been listed as one of Canada‚Äôs Best Managed Companies for the past 18 years and has the distinction of having achieved Platinum Club member status in this program.

Employment Equity, Diversity & Inclusion at Dillon

Dillon is committed to the principles of employment equity, inclusiveness, and diversity within our organization. We strive to achieve a workplace where opportunities are based on skills and abilities and that respects and values differences.

Inclusion is more than a word to us, it is the way we choose to run our business. We encourage you to contact us if you require accommodation during the interview process.

We would love to hear from you!

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Job Description:


We are looking for a skilled and driven Business Analyst to join the Back Office IT team. This role supports business-critical systems by analyzing processes, improving application functionality, and delivering data-driven insights. The ideal candidate will bring a strong understanding of software and web application lifecycles, along with hands-on experience in SQL and business reporting. This position is a great fit for someone who thrives in a hybrid technical/business environment and enjoys solving real-world problems through collaboration, analysis, and innovation.




Responsibilities

¬∑ Analyze business processes, gather requirements, and contribute to the design of practical, high-impact IT solutions.

¬∑ Support and enhance web-based applications, ensuring system reliability and alignment with business needs.

¬∑ Investigate and resolve issues in financial data or reporting by analyzing source data using SQL and other tools.

¬∑ Translate business needs into technical requirements and assist in the planning and execution of new functionality.

¬∑ Create and execute test plans, support deployments, and document operational procedures.

¬∑ Generate operational reports and dashboards using tools such as SQL, Tableau, Power BI, or Sigma.

¬∑ Collaborate with internal stakeholders, developers, and vendors to manage small-to-medium initiatives and improve system performance.

¬∑ Contribute to Agile project workflows and participate in backlog grooming, sprint planning, and retrospectives.




Qualifications

¬∑ 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or Systems Analyst, with a focus on IT and software/web development environments.

¬∑ Proficient in SQL with demonstrated experience in querying and validating complex data sets.

¬∑ Familiarity with tools such as DataGrip, Toad, or similar IDEs for database exploration.

¬∑ Hands-on experience with BI and reporting tools including Tableau, Power BI, Sigma, or SSRS.

¬∑ Strong understanding of software development lifecycles and Agile methodologies.

¬∑ Clear and effective communicator with the ability to engage both technical and business audiences.

¬∑ Highly analytical, detail-oriented, and proactive in identifying and solving problems.

¬∑ Bonus: exposure to scripting (Python, PowerShell), financial operations, or energy industry systems.




Affinity Earn:

Know someone who‚Äôs great for this, or any of our open roles? Earn up to $4,000/year for each successful referral through Affinity Earn. You can also earn up to $50,000 for helping us find new clients. Learn about our referral program at https://affinity-group.ca/earn/ or browse our jobs & follow us at https://www.linkedin.com/company/affinity-staffing/jobs/

About Affinity:

Affinity Group is a technology and business consulting and services company. We believe in creating long term relationships between clients and consultants that foster a mutually beneficial partnership. Affinity is an equal opportunity employer. HTML:
Job Description:

We are looking for a skilled and driven Business Analyst to join the Back Office IT team. This role supports business-critical systems by analyzing processes, improving application functionality, and delivering data-driven insights. The ideal candidate will bring a strong understanding of software and web application lifecycles, along with hands-on experience in SQL and business reporting. This position is a great fit for someone who thrives in a hybrid technical/business environment and enjoys solving real-world problems through collaboration, analysis, and innovation.


Responsibilities

¬∑ Analyze business processes, gather requirements, and contribute to the design of practical, high-impact IT solutions.

¬∑ Support and enhance web-based applications, ensuring system reliability and alignment with business needs.

¬∑ Investigate and resolve issues in financial data or reporting by analyzing source data using SQL and other tools.

¬∑ Translate business needs into technical requirements and assist in the planning and execution of new functionality.

¬∑ Create and execute test plans, support deployments, and document operational procedures.

¬∑ Generate operational reports and dashboards using tools such as SQL, Tableau, Power BI, or Sigma.

¬∑ Collaborate with internal stakeholders, developers, and vendors to manage small-to-medium initiatives and improve system performance.

¬∑ Contribute to Agile project workflows and participate in backlog grooming, sprint planning, and retrospectives.


Qualifications

¬∑ 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or Systems Analyst, with a focus on IT and software/web development environments.

¬∑ Proficient in SQL with demonstrated experience in querying and validating complex data sets.

¬∑ Familiarity with tools such as DataGrip, Toad, or similar IDEs for database exploration.

¬∑ Hands-on experience with BI and reporting tools including Tableau, Power BI, Sigma, or SSRS.

¬∑ Strong understanding of software development lifecycles and Agile methodologies.

¬∑ Clear and effective communicator with the ability to engage both technical and business audiences.

¬∑ Highly analytical, detail-oriented, and proactive in identifying and solving problems.

¬∑ Bonus: exposure to scripting (Python, PowerShell), financial operations, or energy industry systems.

Job Number: 12336

Title: Senior Analyst, In-Game Experiences
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

We evolve our games and how players interact with them by using the power of data to continuously uncover insights to deliver an even better player experience. We strive to be the best-in-class AI team in the gaming industry by maximizing the fun for EA players through easier deployment of AI-driven solutions for game makers. Our insights are ubiquitous through autonomous analytics.

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our Data and Analytics team supporting In-Game Experiences. Reporting to the Senior Analytics Manager, you will work with partners to understand player engagement, feature performance, and to identify product growth opportunities. You will use your skills to provide data-driven solutions to complex problems, translate qualitative/quantitative data into insights, and create recommendations to steer the product roadmap.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with product, design, and engineering to deliver insights into user behaviour and to guide product decisions
Develop best practices for experimentation and recommend initiatives to improve the experimentation program
Perform advanced statistical/machine learning analyses to identify trends, patterns, and provide actionable insights
Develop dashboards and self-serve tools to communicate findings and performance metrics to our partners and encourage the use of data in product decisions
Identify opportunities for process improvements, automation, and the implementation of advanced analytics techniques
Communicate results and findings throughout the organization to all levels of leadership
Provide direction to junior analysts to ensure quality, clarity, and development of their analytics skills


Qualifications


4+ years of experience providing insights from data to guide optimization in gaming or product development
University Degree in Statistics, Marketing, Business, E-commerce or related field of study
Proficient in SQL and Python (or equivalent)
Experience in data analysis, statistics, and experimentation
Experience with data visualization tools (Looker, Power BI, Tableau)
Storytelling skills for presenting technical findings to audiences with varying backgrounds


Compensation And Benefits

The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).

PAY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria) * $89,300 - $123,000 CAD


In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

About Electronic Arts

We‚Äôre proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Analytics Engineer ‚Äì Data Modeling & Migration
Description:
Job Title: Analytics Engineer ‚Äì Data Modeling & Migration

Location: Remote (Canada)

Department: Data & Analytics

Reports To: Manager, Data Integration & Architecture

Mogo is seeking an Analytics Engineer who thrives at the intersection of business understanding and technical execution. In this dual-focus role, you will work closely with stakeholders across the finance business to define and build semantic models in Snowflake, while also contributing to upcoming data migration initiatives that involve rebuilding and modernizing our core Python-based ETL pipelines.

This position is a 50/50 blend of business-facing semantic modeling and production-grade data engineering, offering a unique opportunity to drive both insight accessibility and data infrastructure modernization. You will become the subject matter expert (SME) for Mogo‚Äôs core consumer finance products and help shape the next generation of AI-powered analytics at Mogo.

Base salary for this role: $80,000 - $100,000 CAD

What You‚Äôll Do & Key Responsibilities:2. Data Engineering & Migration (50%)3. Culture & High PerformanceWhat you will bring:


Business-Facing Semantic Modeling (50%)
Design and maintain semantic data models in Snowflake to support our products, powering self-service analytics via Cortex Analyst
Partner with Finance, Product, and Risk teams to define KPIs, translate business logic into reusable data models, and ensure consistent reporting
Collaborate on the development of an AI-powered chatbot using Streamlit (Python) that answers natural language questions based on semantic models
Act as the SME for Mogo‚Äôs core consumer finance products, ensuring models are well-aligned with business workflows and financial reporting needs
Support and lead aspects of data migration initiatives by analyzing, redesigning, and implementing production-grade Python ETL pipelines
Ensure new data pipelines are reliable, scalable, and observable, with appropriate documentation and governance
Work closely with other teams to integrate ETL pipelines into the broader production environment
Embody and model Mogo‚Äôs high-performance attributes: ownership, collaboration, innovation, speed, and impact
Share knowledge and best practices across teams to foster data-driven decision-making
4‚Äì7 years experience in a data engineering, analytics engineering, or hybrid data role
Strong proficiency in Python for building, testing, and maintaining ETL workflows
Experience building or maintaining semantic data models in Snowflake or similar platforms
Strong understanding of SQL, data modeling, and dimensional modeling practices
Ability to work closely with stakeholders to capture requirements and translate them into robust data structures
Experience working with AI powered analytics tools or interfaces (e.g., Cortex Analyst, conversational analytics)
Familiarity with best practices in production-grade ETL deployment: testing, monitoring, observability


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with data orchestration tools (e.g., Talend, Airflow)
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Looker)
Familiarity with financial services, particularly lending, credit risk, or loan servicing
Experience contributing to data platform modernization or migration initiatives


What Success Looks Like


Lending business teams rely on your semantic models for fast, self-serve answers to critical questions
You have redesigned and deployed reliable Python ETLs that support Mogo‚Äôs modern data infrastructure
You‚Äôre known across teams as the go-to expert for our core data and a trusted technical partner in data transformation efforts


Benefits of working with us:


ALWAYS FULLY REMOTE WORK - Enjoy the flexibility of remote work, supported by necessary resources
Comprehensive Health and Wellness - Access medical, dental, and vision coverage plus a Health Spending Account
Stock Options - Have a stake in the company's success through stock options
Flex Vacation - Benefit from paid time off, including vacation days, holidays, and personal days
Wellbeing Programs - Access counselling services, mental health support, and additional wellness resources


About Us:

We help make it easy for Canadians to achieve financial freedom while making a positive impact.

We live in the most innovative and technologically advanced era, yet so much struggle exists. Most of us are far from where we want to be financially.

We all want a better future. A better world where reaching financial freedom is a question of when, not if. One that's equitable so that all can prosper. One that's safe from the impact of climate change.

Our money has the power to change the world. It‚Äôs up to us to do things differently.

Apply today! Do you know anyone who would be a great fit for this role or other roles on our career page? Please share this job posting with them! Mogo is an inclusive place to spend your work life. We hire team members for their talent and diverse backgrounds. Bring your unique perspective to Mogo and help our customers achieve their best financial lives.

Title: Healthcare Claims Adjudicator
Description:
This is a fully remote role, but does require onsite training for 1 week in the Chicago area, fully expense paid by company. Once training is completed, fully remote permanently.




Claims Adjudicator - $24.97 Hourly plus tons of growth and amazing benefits, company culture, stability and growth!




The Claims Adjudicator II position will receive, examine, verify and input submitted claim data, determine eligibility status, and review and adjudicate claims (calculate the final bill to the policy holder, on the payer side) within established timeframes.




DUTIES

Screens claims for completeness of necessary information
Verifies participant/dependent eligibility
Interprets the plan benefits from the Summary Plan Description (SPD)/Plan Documents
Codes basic information and selects codes to determine payment liability amount
Evaluates diagnoses, procedures, services, and other submitted data to determine the need for further investigation in relation to benefit requirements, accuracy of the claim filed, and the appropriateness or frequency of care rendered
Determines the need for additional information or documentation from participants, employers, providers and other insurance carriers
Handles the end to end process of Medicare Secondary Payer (MSP) files
Requests overpayment refunds, maintains corresponding files and performs follow-up actions
Handles verbal and written inquiries received from internal and external customers
Adjudicates claims according to established productivity and quality goals
Achieve individual established goals in order to meet or exceed departmental metrics




QUALIFICATIONS

3 ~ 5 years of direct experience minimum in a medical claim adjudication working in an insurance environment (on the payor side/insurance side)
Working knowledge and experience in interpretation of benefit plans, including an understanding of limitations, exclusions, and schedule of benefits
Experience with eligibility verification, medical coding, coordination of benefits, and subrogation and it‚Äôs related processes
Experience with medical terminology, ICD10 and Current Procedural Technology (CPT) codes







We reward great work with great benefits, including but not limited to: Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Time-Off (PTO), Paid Holidays, 401(k), AND Pension Plan, Short- & Long-term Disability, Life, AD&D, Flexible Spending Accounts (healthcare & dependent care), Commuter Transit, Tuition Assistance, and Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
