Title: Financial Analyst - Corporate FP&A - Finance & Administration
Description:
Financial Analyst - Corporate FP&A - Finance & Administration

Location

New York

Business Area

Accounting and Finance

Ref #

10044924

Description & Requirements

The energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, the buzz of a recent tech breakthrough; we work hard, and we work fast - while keeping up the quality and accuracy we're known for. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We bring out the best in each other through collaboration. Through our countless volunteer projects, we also help network with the communities around us, too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen.

What's the Role?

At Bloomberg Finance, we are committed to providing world-class support to our business leaders by providing insight on business performance, financial oversight and thought leadership.

The Corporate FP&A (Financial Planning & Analysis) department delivers consolidated management reporting, financial analysis, & executive decision support to the senior decision makers at the firm, and also facilitates the end-to-end business planning process. As a member of the group, you will be responsible for facilitating the reporting and business planning for Bloomberg‚Äôs global workforce, driving best practices for processes, controls, internal systems and reporting/analytical tools on behalf of the global finance department.

We'll Trust You To


Establish relationships with key business contacts, working closely with clients to define financial and operational reporting needs
Oversee the monthly reporting and analysis of key workforce expenses and metrics for finance leadership and key business customers
Design, develop, and execute efficient and tightly controlled financial reporting processes
Participate in the development of presentations for Senior Management, both on a regularly scheduled and ad-hoc basis
Identify opportunities to improve efficiency of processes, streamline collection, use, and presentation of data
Provide time-sensitive ad hoc analysis to support inquiries from Senior Management in Finance and business partners
Collaborate with Human Resources and Finance partners to ensure alignment between systems and processes


You'll Need To Have


3+ years of relevant experience in Finance
A bachelor‚Äôs degree
The ability to confidently work with data, identifying business trends and be able to create insightful analysis
Ownership over the analysis and reporting within a defined scope
Proficient quantitative, financial and data manipulation skills and exceptional attention to detail
Strong organizational skills, effective interpersonal skills, and the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and stakeholders


We'd Love To See


Ability to understand and articulate the value of various data analysis and enterprise tools such as SAP, Oracle, Alteryx and Tableau
Specific experience in an FP&A or CFO role
Strong analytical skills and Microsoft Office suite fluency
Adapt to a fast-paced environment knowing the team needs to pivot deliverables to respond to Senior Leadership


Salary Range = 85000 - 120000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus

The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level.

We offer one of the most comprehensive and generous benefits plans available and offer a range of total rewards that may include merit increases, incentive compensation (exempt roles only), paid holidays, paid time off, medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, life insurance, and various wellness programs, among others. The Company does not provide benefits directly to contingent workers/contractors and interns.

Title: Work from Home Entry Level Client Relation Specialist (No experience needed, Will train)
Description:
üöÄ Ready for a Career Shift? Join One of America‚Äôs Fastest-Growing Agencies ‚ÄìThis is a work from home opportunity!




At The Stephens Agency, we believe in empowering our people. We mentor, coach, and guide our sales agents toward the success they‚Äôre looking for‚Äîprofessionally and financially. Whether you're just starting out or looking to take your leadership to the next level, we have full-time sales and immediate leadership growth opportunities available.




We‚Äôre looking for driven individuals with:

A goal-oriented mindset and the discipline to follow through
A growth mentality and hunger for personal and professional development
A high standard of professionalism and ethics

Title: Health Informatics System Analyst
Description:
Mission Healthcare, located in seven states, is the largest home health and hospice company in the western United States. We have a critical mission‚Äîto take care of our people. We provide a comprehensive array of services that meet the needs of patients and families across the healthcare continuum. We believe our people, partners, patients and their families deserve care delivered with Compassion, Accountability, Respect, Excellence and Service (CARES), Mission Healthcare‚Äôs core values. By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to impact patient‚Äôs lives daily and grow your career in a culture of collaboration, compassion, and commitment. We are excited to continue to grow our mission family!

Mission Healthcare is seeking a detail-oriented and collaborative Health Information Systems Analyst to support and maintain our clinical applications and electronic health record (EHR) systems. This role ensures the integrity, performance, and optimization of systems that directly support our home health and hospice care operations.

Pay range (depending on experience): $29 - $32/hour.

Schedule/Shift: Full-Time, Monday-Friday, 8AM-5PM

Territory/Location: This position is On-Site at our Tempe, AZ office.

Key Responsibilities:


Maintain and support core health information systems, including EHRs, patient scheduling, and documentation tools.
Collaborate with clinical, operational, and IT teams to analyze system requirements and workflows.
Troubleshoot issues, perform root cause analysis, and implement corrective actions.
Support regulatory and compliance reporting by ensuring accurate data collection and integration across systems.
Assist in managing user access, permissions, and training for clinical systems.
Partner with external vendors and internal stakeholders on upgrades, maintenance, and testing.
Participate in projects focused on data quality, system enhancements, and workflow improvement.



Qualifications:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in health informatics, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
2+ years of experience in healthcare IT, ideally in home health or hospice settings.
Strong working knowledge of EHR systems such as Homecare Homebase, Epic, or MatrixCare.
Experience with SQL, data integration tools, or health IT interfaces preferred.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Familiarity with HIPAA, CMS regulations, and quality metrics in post-acute care settings.

Title: Data Transformation Engineer
Company: CareSignal¬Æ ‚Äì Lightbeam's Deviceless Remote Patient Monitoring
Description:
Job Summary

As a leader in end-to-end population health management solutions and services, we are continuing to grow our talented software development team. We are currently looking for a full-time Data Transformation Engineer to join our experienced team. The Data Transformation Engineer will design, configure, implement, operate, and maintain technology systems. The Data Transformation Engineer will be capable of addressing new technology, compliance, and industry standards. They will be fluent in HL7 data management and normalization. The Data Transformation Engineer will have the ability to work with teammates to accept support tickets from client partners around specific data transformation requests. They will research, review, troubleshoot, analyze, and triage tickets appropriately. They will have strong personal skills in collaborating with partner resources.

The Ideal Candidate Will Have Experience In


Healthcare IT
Java
JavaScript
Groovy
XML
HL7/CCD knowledge
XSLT
JSON
SQL/Postgres


Job Responsibilities


Provide expertise on receiving and transforming data from disparate sources
Work cross functionally within the company and externally with partners to meet data transformation, interface mapping, configuration, and validation needs
Perform risk management pertaining to interfaces and data transformation to maximize client implementation success
Track any/all open interface issues through resolution
Actively work with internal and external project team members to resolve open interface implementation items
Monitor and report on ongoing data transmission for errors or issues at all stages of data ingestion and transformation, including communication to customer
Report and escalate support issues as appropriate
Communicate and collaborate with development engineers for knowledge and assistance
Ensure interfaces and data transformation work are completed within agreed upon project schedule timelines provided by Operations
Review validation reports and address any discrepancies with the Customer


Qualifying Job Knowledge, Skills & Abilities


Proven working experience in interface implementation and/or working with claims/clinical data within the healthcare industry
Payor/provider background preferred
Knowledge of value-based care, population health a plus
Accustomed to customer/partner-facing roles
Ability to speak to all levels within an organization
Outstanding communication skills
Solid organizational skills, including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite
Strong working knowledge of SQL
Ability to embrace change and company growth
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Proven experience managing relationships with customers technical and analytical team members


Key Competencies


Critical thinking with problem solving skills
Decision-making
Communication skills
Influencing and leading
Teamwork and positivity
Conflict management
Adaptability
Stress tolerance
Strong computer skills are required


Education


Required: BS Degree (or higher) or equivalent work experience


Lightbeam Internal Use Only

Position Security Classification

CRITERIA: POSITION RISK LEVEL

High Risk (if any of these are true)

Access to Restricted information, including PHI and PII

Elevated access privileges

Access to the Security Infrastructure

Medium Risk

Access to Confidential, but not to Restricted information

Low Risk

Access to Unclassified information only

Data Transformation Engineer: High

CRITERIA: SECURITY ROLES & RESPONIBILITIES

Security Roles & Responsibilities


Approve security-related changes
Execute security-related changes
Not applicable


Policy/procedures for Lightbeam

Cyber Security Incident Response (CSIRT) team

Data Transformation Engineer: Not Applicable

SECURITY ROLE-SPECIFIC TRAINING

Annual Incident Response Exercises

Title: MDM Data Engineer
Description:
MDM Data Engineer ‚Äì Stamford, CT

Be a part of a revolutionary change!

At Philip Morris International (PMI), we‚Äôve chosen to do something incredible. We‚Äôre totally transforming our business and building our future on one clear purpose ‚Äì to deliver a smoke-free future.

With huge change, comes huge opportunity. So, if you join us, you‚Äôll enjoy the freedom to dream up and deliver better, brighter solutions and the space to move your career forward in endlessly different directions. Our success depends on people who are committed to our purpose and have an appetite for progress.

Our beautiful HQ in Stamford, CT is just steps away from the Stamford Metro-North Train Station and easily accessible from NYC.

Your ‚Äòday To Day‚Äô

As an Analyst Data Enablement, you will be the point of contact for all aspects of data engineering within the MDM data domain. This role involves taking end-to-end engineering accountability, understanding the technology and business needs, and articulating them effectively into technical design MDM space and implementing data pipelines to meet the business requirements. Your role is instrumental in delivering on time, on budget, and with utmost quality data engineering pipelines within the architecture and governance framework.


Ensure Data Quality and Compliance by applying expertise in MDM and data governance principles, including data governance frameworks and practices, to ensure the relevancy, quality, security, and compliance of master data.
Develop MDM Platform Requirements while articulating requirements for MDM frameworks and tools in platforms like Profisee, Informatica, Reltio, and advocate their adoption across teams.
Design and Model master data entities in collaboration with data modelers, data governance leads, and business stakeholders.
Build, test, deploy, and evolve the capabilities for data curation and publishing into the data platform using standards and best practices to deliver high quality, standardized and harmonized consumable data domains for consumption by Advanced Analytics and Operational use cases.
Closely partner and collaborate with other team members from architecture, Data Engineering, Data Governance, Product Managers, Delivery, Data Management Services to curate ingested source data across multiple sources from cleansing and validating to standardizing, harmonizing and transforming for a single view to the enterprise.
Collaborate with Data Governance and business intelligence, driving engineering and technical implementation of the master data solution & services, ensuring accountability across the organization
Lead MDM initiatives to establish a single source of truth, ensuring consistency and accessibility across business domains.
Apply MDM Solutions to business problems by addressing business challenges by applying MDM and data governance concepts, leading workshops and gathering information to evaluate readiness for data governance strategies.
Improve the current level of automation and Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) of our MDM platform as well as do code reviews for your peers.
Provide direction to vendor staff within engineering domain for MDM tracking their quality of work and output.


Who We‚Äôre Looking For


Legally authorized to work in the U.S.
Commutable distance to Stamford, CT.
5+ years of experience as an MDM Engineer with end to end design and development and hands on experience with MDM Tools (Profisee, SAP MDG, informatica, Reltio etc.) and Snowflake, Azure SQL database.
Knowledge of standard data models within master data domains ‚Äì Product, Customer, Finance, Reference Data, etc.
Advanced SQL programming and building ETL/ELT processes using cloud platforms like Azure Data Factory or Matillion.
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Engineering, Information Management, or Information Technology.


Annual Base Salary Range: $105,600 - $132,000

What We Offer


We offer a competitive base salary, annual bonus (applicable based on level of position), great medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k with a generous company match, incredible wellness benefits, commuter benefits, pet insurance, generous PTO, and much more!
We have implemented Smart Work, a hybrid model of working that promotes flexibility in the workplace.
Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We‚Äôll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.
Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture where everyone‚Äôs contribution is respected; Collaborate with some of the world‚Äôs best people and feel like you belong.
Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business ‚Äì our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.
Take pride in delivering our promise to society: To improve the lives of millions of smokers.


PMI is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

PMI is headquartered in Stamford, Conn., and its U.S. affiliates have more than 2,300 employees.

PMI has been an entirely separate company from Altria and Philip Morris USA since 2008. PMI‚Äôs affiliates first entered the U.S. market following the company‚Äôs acquisition of Swedish Match in late 2022. Philip Morris International and its U.S. affiliates are working to deliver a smoke-free future. Since 2008, PMI has invested $12.5 billion globally to develop, scientifically substantiate and commercialize innovative smoke-free products for adults who would otherwise continue to smoke with the goal of transitioning legal-age consumers who smoke to better alternatives. In 2022, PMI acquired Swedish Match ‚Äì a leader in oral nicotine delivery ‚Äì creating a global smoke-free champion led by the IQOS and ZYN brands. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has authorized versions of PMI‚Äôs IQOS electronically heated tobacco devices and Swedish Match‚Äôs General snus as Modified Risk Tobacco Products and renewal applications for these products are presently pending before the FDA. For more information, please visit www.pmi.com/us and www.pmiscience.com

  • Commutable distance to Stamford, CT.
  • 5+ years of experience as an MDM Engineer with end to end design and development and hands on experience with MDM Tools (Profisee, SAP MDG, informatica, Reltio etc.) and Snowflake, Azure SQL database.
  • Knowledge of standard data models within master data domains ‚Äì Product, Customer, Finance, Reference Data, etc.
  • Advanced SQL programming and building ETL/ELT processes using cloud platforms like Azure Data Factory or Matillion.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Engineering, Information Management, or Information Technology.

Annual Base Salary Range: $105,600 - $132,000

What We Offer

  • We offer a competitive base salary, annual bonus (applicable based on level of position), great medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k with a generous company match, incredible wellness benefits, commuter benefits, pet insurance, generous PTO, and much more!
  • We have implemented Smart Work, a hybrid model of working that promotes flexibility in the workplace.
  • Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We‚Äôll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.
  • Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture where everyone‚Äôs contribution is respected; Collaborate with some of the world‚Äôs best people and feel like you belong.
  • Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business ‚Äì our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.
  • Take pride in delivering our promise to society: To improve the lives of millions of smokers.

PMI is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

PMI is headquartered in Stamford, Conn., and its U.S. affiliates have more than 2,300 employees.

PMI has been an entirely separate company from Altria and Philip Morris USA since 2008. PMI‚Äôs affiliates first entered the U.S. market following the company‚Äôs acquisition of Swedish Match in late 2022. Philip Morris International and its U.S. affiliates are working to deliver a smoke-free future. Since 2008, PMI has invested $12.5 billion globally to develop, scientifically substantiate and commercialize innovative smoke-free products for adults who would otherwise continue to smoke with the goal of transitioning legal-age consumers who smoke to better alternatives. In 2022, PMI acquired Swedish Match ‚Äì a leader in oral nicotine delivery ‚Äì creating a global smoke-free champion led by the IQOS and ZYN brands. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has authorized versions of PMI‚Äôs IQOS electronically heated tobacco devices and Swedish Match‚Äôs General snus as Modified Risk Tobacco Products and renewal applications for these products are presently pending before the FDA. For more information, please visit www.pmi.com/us and www.pmiscience.com

Title: Executive Associate to the County Executive
Description:
At the County of Marin, our employees overwhelmingly report feeling their work is meaningful, they like the work they do, and they are proud to tell people ‚ÄúI work for the County of Marin.‚Äù Discover more about us, our values and our organizational culture on the Department of Human Resources website. Read on to find out more about this opportunity.

The County Executive is the chief officer of Marin County government‚Äîappointed by the Board of Supervisors to lead a 3,000-employee organization, oversee 22 County departments and implement the Board‚Äôs strategic direction. This includes driving cross-departmental coordination and public services that improve the lives of over 250,000 Marin County residents. The County Executive reports to all five County Supervisors and serves as the public face of County operations and initiatives ‚Äì meeting regularly with local, regional, and state leaders.

The Office of the County Executive (OCE) is the strategic center of the organization. In addition to overseeing Countywide operations and managing the County‚Äôs $840 million budget, the office ensures the Board‚Äôs initiatives focused on affordable housing, climate, racial equity, emergency response, economic vitality, and long-term planning are implemented timely and effectively. We coordinate major policy efforts, prepare Board agendas, manage intergovernmental affairs, and ensure County departments are aligned in serving the community.

This is a fast-moving, dynamic environment, where timing, judgment, and execution matter. We are a small but trusted team that plays a critical role in ensuring local government functions at the highest level.

Title: Clinical Application Specialist
Description:
(CAS) is a clinical education role focused on internal and external clinical and educational support. This role also supports broader company revenue growth goals via customer support and education. The CAS position will be responsible for providing training and education to new and existing Sentec users and will work closely with the field sales and marketing organization to support new hire and ongoing sales training and development. Expectations of the role include on-site and virtual education, training and CE and non-CE Presentations, and in-person state and potential national society presentations.

Key Tasks


Acts as the subject matter expert for the use of our products in our key market segments to support company revenue growth goals
Collaborates with the local sales team to coordinate and deliver comprehensive onsite and virtual customer training and education i.e., curriculum, process/tools and programs
Develops a common understanding of the technology across care providers and articulates the clinical & economic value proposition
Participates in product evaluations and installations
Assesses needs and ensures comprehensive education and hands-on training on our products, including maintenance and troubleshooting that addresses all members of the clinical team
Provides education and training necessary to drive optimal bedside use of the technology in new and existing accounts
This is a remote position (home-based in the Greater Chicago area) with the ability to travel overnight (60%+) and work flexible hours.



Requirements


Bachelor's Degree in Science or equivalent education and/or experience
Current RRT license is required
Prior experience training/educating healthcare professionals is preferred
Prior experience in the Medical Device Industry in a Clinical Specialist role is highly preferred
Existing In-depth knowledge and usage of Sentec products preferred
Ability to quickly understand new product enhancements and training programs/materials
Must be vaccinated for Covid-19 and must obtain any/all required vaccinations as appropriate for vendor credentialing



Benefits


Meaningful work in a rapidly growing company with opportunity for advancement
Directly influence the quality of products and make a difference for patients worldwide
Opportunities for professional and personal growth


Sentec offers competitive benefits like Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA, FSA, and 401K matching, as well as paid parental leave, a wellness stipend and tuition reimbursement. Sentec emphasizes employee voices and recognizes hard work making it a promising environment for professional growth. Sentec focuses on delivering impactful healthcare products and improving patient care.

By choosing a career at Sentec, you're not just choosing a job - you're embracing the chance to make a real impact, contributing to the development of innovative medical solutions that support the wellbeing of individuals worldwide.

Sentec is a Swiss-American medical device company specializing in respiratory care. Since its founding in 1999, Sentec utilizes a deep-tech approach that is founded on advanced science and avant-garde technologies for respiratory patients across care areas. Sentec provides healthcare professionals worldwide with non-invasive, continuous monitoring and effective therapeutic solutions.

Title: Client Service Manager
Description:
We are looking for a Client Service Manager to drive sales and revenue growth by building strong relationships with clients in the Savannah, GA area. This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing team with a focus on customer satisfaction and business growth.






Location: Savannah, GA 31419




Pay: $65,000- $85,000 Base Salary + Commissions.






Requirements





2+ years of client-facing experience in stormwater or aquatic services


Sales, relationship development, or customer service experience


College degree preferred


Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word


Strong written and verbal communication skills


Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and time management skills


Ability to lift up to 50 lbs


Valid driver's license and a clean driving record


Ability to work well in a team environment, independent thought and critical thinking, business acumen, and an internal motivation to succeed.







Key Responsibilities





Pursues new leads generated by existing client base, digital campaigns, and tradeshows.


Responds to and acknowledges all client inquiries in a prompt and professional manner.


Identify and target potential clients through research and data mining


Connect with decision-makers via phone and email


Serve as the main point of contact for all client inquiries and requests


Estimate and generate proposals for new and existing clients


Recommend additional services to current clients


Develop and implement relationship-building programs (e.g., site meetings, lunch & learns, etc.)


Perform physical tasks such as driving, walking on steep slopes, bending, and kneeling







Benefits & Perks





Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance


401(k) matching


Life Insurance


Flexible Spending Accounts


Paid Time Off & Holiday Pay


Employee Assistance Program







Dragonfly Pond Works is a leading environmental service company specializing in stormwater management. Since 2006, Dragonfly has provided routine maintenance and repairs on stormwater devices, lakes, ponds, wetlands, and underground facilities.




We are proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

Title: SQL Developer
Description:
Step into an environment where your technical expertise powers real-world gaming experiences and supports communities across the globe. As a SQL Developer on our team, you'll play a critical role in building and evolving data solutions across a hybrid landscape-bridging legacy SQL Server systems with cutting-edge cloud technologies.

This is an on-site opportunity based at our U.S. headquarters. If you're someone who thrives on collaboration and hands-on development, this role puts you at the core of data innovation and operational excellence.

What You'll Do


Engineer and maintain high-performance data pipelines and database solutions using SQL Server and Snowflake.
Craft and optimize tables, views, stored procedures, and functions for both legacy and cloud-native environments.
Build ELT/ETL workflows using modern tools like dbt, Airflow, and Azure-fueling analytics, application integration, and real-time business insights.
Drive data quality through rigorous testing, monitoring, and validation protocols.
Collaborate cross-functionally to turn complex business requirements into scalable technical solutions.
Champion best practices for data engineering, documentation, CI/CD, and reusable design patterns.
Enhance system integrations using REST APIs, structured data files, and third-party platforms.


What You'll Bring


3+ years of hands-on experience designing, building, and optimizing database solutions with strong performance and scalability.
Advanced skills in T-SQL, plus deep experience developing stored procedures and views in SQL Server.
Solid understanding of relational database design, query optimization, and data modeling.
Experience with Snowflake, dbt, Azure, Airflow, and real-time data stream design.
Fluency in CI/CD pipelines and version control (Git).
Strong analytical mindset, attention to detail, and excellent communication abilities.
Bonus points for familiarity with SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, Power BI, Salesforce integrations, JSON, RESTful APIs, and enterprise platforms like NetSuite or IBM iSeries.


Your work helps power socially-driven entertainment and community engagement-delivering meaningful data solutions across a unique industry landscape. Ready to bring clarity, scale, and speed to our data ecosystem?

Email Your Resume In Word To

Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. Clicking apply is the best way to apply, but you may also:

keith.ellis@cybercoders.com


Please do NOT change the email subject line in any way. You must keep the JobID: linkedin : KE2-1871289 -- in the email subject line for your application to be considered.***


Keith Ellis - Director of Recruiting

For this position, you must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for sponsorship for a non-immigrant visa.

This job was first posted by CyberCoders on 07/21/2025 and applications will be accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled or closed.

CyberCoders is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, status as a crime victim, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. CyberCoders will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local law, including but not limited to the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, and the California Fair Chance Act. CyberCoders is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please contact a member of our Human Resources team to make arrangements.

Title: Vice President of Transformation
Description:
Job Title: Vice President of Transformation

Location: Remote (Pacific Time Zone required)

Travel: Up to 40%, including one week per month in Los Angeles




Company Overview

Our client is a high-growth, private equity-backed company executing an aggressive expansion strategy through both M&A and organic growth. With ambitious revenue targets ahead, the organization is building a scalable foundation to support operational excellence across all functions. To support this growth, they are seeking a results-driven Vice President of Transformation to lead enterprise-wide initiatives that enhance performance, drive efficiency, and position the company for sustained success.




Position Summary

The Vice President of Transformation will play a mission-critical role in leading strategic initiatives that modernize and scale the company‚Äôs operations. This executive will partner with senior leadership to assess business processes, reimagine organizational capabilities, and implement transformation strategies that align with long-term goals. The ideal candidate brings deep expertise in operational improvement, change management, and enterprise transformation within fast-paced, complex environments‚Äîpreferably in private equity-backed businesses.




Key Responsibilities

Lead the design and execution of enterprise transformation strategies across operations, systems, and business processes.
Collaborate with senior leaders to identify, prioritize, and drive change initiatives aligned with growth and efficiency objectives.
Oversee a portfolio of cross-functional projects, ensuring timely delivery, budget adherence, and measurable outcomes.
Guide change management efforts to support adoption of new processes, systems, and operating models.
Conduct diagnostic assessments and performance analyses to surface inefficiencies and improvement opportunities.
Partner with IT, Finance, and other functional teams to align transformation projects with system and infrastructure upgrades.
Establish KPIs and performance tracking systems to monitor and report on transformation success.
Build and mentor a high-performing team of project managers, analysts, and functional leaders.
Champion a culture of continuous improvement and scalable operational discipline.
Serve as a trusted advisor to the executive team, providing regular updates on initiative progress, risks, and impact.




Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Finance, Operations, or related field; MBA or advanced degree strongly preferred.
10‚Äì15+ years of progressive leadership experience in business transformation, operational improvement, or management consulting.
Proven success leading enterprise transformations, particularly in private equity-backed or high-growth environments.
Demonstrated expertise in business process reengineering, organizational design, and strategic project execution.
Strong understanding of financial planning, cost optimization, and business systems.
Executive presence with exceptional communication, influence, and stakeholder management skills.
Experience managing a PMO and leading large-scale, cross-functional initiatives.
Track record of building and leading high-performing teams in dynamic environments.




Ideal Candidate Profile

You are a transformational leader who thrives in complexity, inspires confidence, and delivers results. You combine strategic thinking with disciplined execution, and you know how to navigate organizational change to build scalable, resilient business operations.

Title: Chief Technology Officer
Description:
Position: Chief Technology Officer (CTO)

Location: Remote ‚Äì Must Reside in the Eastern Time Zone | Travel Required: 50‚Äì60%

Company Type: Private Equity-Backed | High-Growth Technology Company

Position Overview:

East 57th Street Partners is conducting a search for a high-impact Chief Technology Officer (CTO) on behalf of a private equity-backed technology company experiencing rapid expansion. This is a remote-first executive leadership role, but it requires 50‚Äì60% travel to corporate headquarters, field operations, and board meetings across the U.S. Candidates must reside in the Eastern Time Zone to align with executive team schedules. The ideal candidate is both strategic and execution-oriented, capable of scaling platforms and leading enterprise-wide technology transformation in dynamic, growth-focused environments.

Key Responsibilities:

Technology Strategy & Execution: Define and execute the company‚Äôs technology roadmap to support growth, digital transformation, and operational excellence.
